There were no knockdowns in the fight which served as a tuneup for Villaflor who will defend his title against Sammy Serrano of Puerto Rico in October. Villaflor weighed 134 pounds to 133 for his opponent.

title: Grievances Issued
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Opera: Curtain Rises on Fall Season
Uruguay's New President Ends Rights of Thousands
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 1Uruguay's military regime today installed as President a conservative lawyer, Aparicio Mendez, who immediately canceled the political rights of the leaders of all existing parties.

title: Libyan Asks Talks With 2 Arab Chiefs To Settle Disputes
description: CAIRO, Thursday, Sept. 2Col. Muammar elQaddafi of Libya called early this morning for a meeting of the leaders of Egypt, Libya and Syria to try to settle their differences.

title: Custom Gershwin Desk Gives Glimpse of Genius
New Film Makers Series Set for Whitney Sept. 14
description: Lost Lost Lost (Diaries, Notes & Sketches, Reels 16), a film by the avantgarde movie maker and critic Jonas Mekas, will lead off the seventh season of the Whitney Museum's New American Film Makers Series.

title: Lockheed Approach To Two Legislators Reported by Dutch
description: THE HAGUE, Sept. 1 (Reuters)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation approached two members of the Dutch Parliament to promote sales of its Orion antisubmarine aircraftt to the Dutch Navy. according to Lockheed documents submitted to Parliament by Prime Minister Joop M. den. Uyl today.

title: Seidman Accounting Firm Accepts S.E.C. Sanctions
Corporation Affairs
description: LONDON, Sept. 1 (Reuters) The Burmah Oil Company said today that its gas transport subsidiary had completed a renegotiation of various terms and conditions of a liquefied natural gas transportation agreement with Pertamina, the Indonesian Government oil company.

title: Nassau Coliseum To Add 450 Seats
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 1Nassau County and the management of the New York Nets and Islanders have agreed to expand the seating capacity of the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale by 450 seats, Ralph G. Caso, the County Executive, announced today. The agreement was reached with Roy Boe, who heads the hockey and basketball organizations, and will have to be approved by the county Board Supervisors.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Prime Minister John Vorster said in Johannesburg on the eve of his departure for talks in Zurich with Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger that moral lessons and threats from other countries would make no impression on South Africa. His primary target was Mr. Kissinger's speech Tuesday terming apartheid incompatible with human dignity. Mr. Vorster also assailed recent statements by the leader of the SouthWest African People's Organization, calling for United Nations sanctions against South Africa, as unacceptable. [Page 1, Column 7.]

title: Bridge:
description: Any pair that can score more than 70 percent in a pair event can feel proud of its skill, but must also concede that luck played some part in the triumph. Both factors had a role in the diagramed deal played by Irving and Rose Levine of West End, N. J., who won the mixed pair championship at a recent sectional tournament in Point Pleasant, N. J., with a mammoth score.

title: Southern Governors Ask Federal Spending Limit
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Sept. 1The Southern Governors Conference, in its closing session here today, adopted a resolution urging a constitutional amendment limiting Federal spending to a percentage of the national income except in times of war or national emergency.

title: Doesn't Anyone Out There Need a Soft Bathtub?
description: Now there are two soft bathtubs.

title: 3 FORD AIDES ASK BLACKS' SUPPORT
CONFEREES AGREE ON TAX PENALTIES IN ARAB BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Senate and House conferees working on the tax bill agreed today to impose tax penalties on United Stales companies that comply with the Arab boycott of Israel.

title: Cosmos Tie Tornado
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 1 (AP) Giorgio Chinaglia converted a penalty kickhis second of the game14 minutes into the second half tonight to give the New York Cosmos a 22 tie with the Dallas Tornado in a North American Soccer League exhibition match. .

title: Canada Cup on TV
description: .CHANNEL 13

title: Manny Lefkowitz Weds Kaye Becker
description: Kathleen Marie Becker of New York, a model known as Kaye Becker who is with the Stewart Agency,. and Manny Lefkowitz, also of New York, executive vice president of Reiss Games Inc., a subsidiary of the National Paragon Corporation, a recreation concern of which Mr. Lefkowitz is a vice president, were married yesterday evening. Rabbi David Posner performed the ceremony at Ternple EmanuEl.

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON TAX PENALTIES IN ARAB BOYCOTT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 Senate and House conferees working on the tax bill agreed today to impose tax penalties on United States companies that comply with the Arab boycott of Israel.

title: Alexander Looks Great As a Yankee
Rolling Stone Planning Move To New York City in January
description: Rolling Stone, the biweekly magazine of rock criticism, gossip and national politics, announced yesterday that it would move its national headquarters from San Francisco to New York City in January.

title: Hughes Kin Ask Jury to Act
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 1 (AP)A jury here was asked today to determine the legal residence of the late billionaire Howard R. Hughes. The request was filed in the court of Probate Judge Pat Gregoory by Rush Hughes of Palm Springs, Calif.. and Avis Hughes McIntrye of Montgomery, Ala., both paternal relatives.

title: VORSTER ASSAILS KISSINGER STAND
G.O.P. CRITICIZED ON JOBLESS RATE
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N. Y., SEPT. 1Three of the five Democratic candidates for United States Senator from New York stressed the employment problem in addresses at the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. convention here today and offered proposals for getting people back to work.

title: Company Reports
Mexican Bankers and Businessmen Call Peso Move Courageous
OLYMPIA BREWING PLANS A MERGER
description: The Olympia Brewing Company, the nation's seventh largest brewer, and the Lone Star Brewing Company, a regional brewer in Texas, announced yesterday merger plans in an exchange of stock valued at about $75 million. Under the agreement, Lone Star would exchange 3.75 common shares for each share of Olympia common stock. Olympia, which was actively traded in the overthecounter market yesterday at 36, has 2,117,352 shares outstanding. Lone Star has 1,870,015 shares outstanding.

title: Hearing Convened in Newark On Charges Against Surgeon
description: NEWARK, Sept. 1A hearing officer for the State Board of Medical Examiners convened a hearing today on the board's charges of malpractice against Dr. Mario E. Jascalevich, a surgeon who was accused by a Bergen County grand jury last May of mudering five patients at Riverdell Hospital in Oradell a decade ago.

title: CHARLES GARDNER
2 BUILDING LOCALS GET RACIAL QUOTA
description: Two construction union locals in New York City were ordered by a Federal judge yesterday to increase the number of blacks and Puerto Ricans in their membership from a current total of about 6 percent to 36 percent within five years.

title: VORSTER ASSAILS KISSINGER STAND
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept 1Prime Minister John Vorster reacted indignantly today to criticism of South Africa's racial policies, including a speech by Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger. He declared that moral lessons and threats from other countries would make no impression here.

title: Carter Clinging to Old Campaign Style
description: PLAINS, Ga., Sept. 1On the eve of the general election campaign, Jimmy Carter is talking more and more as though he were back in the snows of New Hampshire in the long primary grind.

title: Soybeans Advance
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 1 (AP)Farm commodity futures, with large commercial support and short covering, moved sharply higher on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: Indian Leader Gets 30 Days In South Dakota Court Riot
description: KENNEBEC, S.D., Sept. 1 (AP)Russell Means, a leader of the American Indian Movement, has pleaded guilty to a misdemeanor assault charge stemming from a courthouse riot at Custer, S.D., on Feb. 6, 1973.

title: U.S. Envoys in Junieh
description: JUNIEH, Lebanon, Sept. (UPI)Two United States diplomats, Robert B. Houghton and David Mack, returned today to this Lebanese Christian port north of Beirut for new talks with rightwing Christian leaders

title: Nassau Democrats Score G.O.P. As SalesTax Rise Takes Effect
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 1Nassau County's sales tax was increased by 1 cent today, and local Democrats immediately started their preelection campaign by denouncing the county's Republican Legislators for supporting the added Levy.

title: Official Hurt in Rikers Fight
description: An assistant warden at the Men's House of Detention on Rikers Island was slightly in jured yesterday when he attempted to break up a fight among, four inmates. The official, John Pezone, was taken to the City Hospital Center at Elmhurst, Queens, for Xrays of his lower back after the altercation on Block 8. A correction Department spokesman said the center was quiet after the fight.

title: Aide Assesses DMZ Killings
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) A high State Department official testified today that the killing of two United States officers by North Korean troops last month was part of an unsuccessful plan to make it appear that the United States was trying to start a war.

title: U.S. WildHorse Roundup Barred by a Federal Court
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) A Federal District judge declared illegal today a Government plan to round up 260 wild horses near Challis, Idaho, and he chastized the Interior Department for failing to provide for veterarians at the site.

title: PRODUCTION LAGS ON FLU VACCINES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1Figures made public today by the Department of Health, Education and Welfare show that the four manufacturers of swine flu vaccine will be able to deliver by Oct. 1 only about onequarter of the amount of vaccine they had been expected to make available by that date.

title: Manufacturer Leaves For Ridgefield, Conn.
description: Clarkson Industries, a manufacturer of control systems for air and water pollution, has moved its corporate headquarters from New York City to Ridgefield. Conn.

title: Jersey Woman Murdered After Kidnapping at Mall
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Sept. 1 A 20yearold woman was abducted from the Paramus Park Shopping Mall in daylight yesterday and murdered, apparently with a knife, according to the Bergen County Prosecutor's office.

title: Kenneth W. Buckridge, 61, Professor at TV Center
description: Kenneth W. Buckridge, an associate professor at the Brooklyn College Television Center, died Aug. 17 of a heart attack in Cambridge, Mass., while on a vacation trip. He was 61 years old and lived at 2820 Bedford Avenue, Brooklyn.

title: Voter Drive in Jersey Angers the G.O.P.
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1Representative Frank Thompson Jr. of Monmouth County has used the Congressional franking privilege for the first time in New Jersey to promote a voterregistration drive.

title: CONFEREES AGREE ON DEFENSE FUND
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) House and Senate conferees approved today a compromise $104.3 billion defense appropriations bill that ultimately could increase military spending by $14 billion over present levels.

title: Oakland U. Faculty Strike
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., Sept. 1 (AP)An estimated 300 of the 310 faculty members at Oakland University struck today on the opening day of the school year. A spokesman for the Oakland Chapter of the American Association. of University Professors said the university had refused to bargain on crucial issues until less than 10 hours before classes were to begin.

title: Where Sisterhood Isn't Powerful
description: CHICAGOAmong American Catholics there may be almost as many theories about the critical state of their church as there are communicants. I say almost because some care so little they may not even be aware their church is in trouble, But for the rest, pious folk as well as scholars, the causes cited for current problems have ranged from the papal encyclical Humanae Vitae to the quality of the hymns being sung at Sunday mass.

title: Buffalo Bishop Reaffirms Diocese's Integration Policy
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 1 (AP)The Bishop of the Buffalo Diocese of the Roman Catholic Church said Tuesday that Catholic schools will not become havens for those seeking to avoid publicschool inteeration.

title: Fire Union Head ReElected
description: The Uniforced Fire Officers Association in New York City yeterday reelected battalion Chief Edwin F. Jennings as president. Other officers elected to oneyear terms included William J. McCann as vice president and John J. McGarty as treasurer. The union represents 2,200 Fire Department officers.

title: INDIA REGIME ASKS VAST NEW POWERS
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 1With the small parliamentary oppok tion protesting bitterly, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government today formally intro duced a wideranging set of constitutional amendments that would give her sweeping new legislative powers.

title: Knicks in Hall Game
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Sept. 1 (AP)  The Washington Bullets will play the New York Knicks on Dec. 12 in the fifth annual National Basketball Association Hall of Fame game here, officials announced today. Proceeds from the annual game, which have totaled $50,000 thus far, go to the Hall of Fame.

title: Film: A Peculiar 'Death'
description: "Death Play" is a peculiar, lopsided movie that attempts to join two stories done in drastically different modes. Despite one impressive performance it does not succeed.The main story is a naturalistic account of a young actress who, rehearsing her first big role, becomes increasingly estranged from her lover. The lover, a self-pitying, frustrated writer, vents his resentment of the actress's success by conducting a surreptitious affair with his estranged wife.The second story, suggestive of the expressionist theme of the 1920's, concerns the insane doorkeeper at the theater where the actress is working. A former Shakespearean actor, he begins to see her as the wife who once betrayed him. At the movie's end, spouting Othello and Hamlet, he kills her.Although Michael Higgins does the best he can as the madman, the role simply does not work. The stagy devices that accompany himthe rattling, hissing sound effects, his visions of his wifeare ludicrous.As for the main story, the tensions between the producer, the director and the star hired as the main actor are written with some acuteness, and have moments of liveliness and interest. The lover, on the other hand, played by James Keach, is simply too petulant and unpleasant to arouse the slightest concern.The one brilliant thing in the moviepitiably wastedis a beautiful, high-strung performance by Karen Leslie as the young actress. In her first movie roleshe has been seen in various regional theatersMiss Leslie makes the role not only believable but endearing as well: a shifting prism of high spirits, grief, humor and irrepressible life. She is so good that without being able to believe the murder at the end, we are terribly sorry about it.The PG rating is based, apparently, on the murder and a sex scene between the lover and his estranged wife. The movie, which opened at the Thalia and the Cinema Village, is not likely to draw many children, in any case.

title: Ouster Move Rejected
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) The House ethics committee voted, 10 to 2, today to reject a resolution calling for the expulsion of Representative Andrew J. Hinshaw, Republican of California, from the House of Representatives.

title: RockandRoll, Texas Style, Riding High
description: Texas rockandroll has been riding high in New York the last two nights, what with Johnny and Edgar Winter at the Felt Forum and Doug Sahm at the Other End. The Winters are the more popular of the two, and played to the bigger audiences. But Mr. Sahm was appreciably the more pleasing; this was as fine a set of roots rock as this listener has heard in a good, long time.

title: Shift of the CarterArtis Trial Is Asked
description: PATERSON, N. J. Sept. 1 Contending that Rubin (Hurricane) Carter and John Artis cannot get a fair trial on triplemurder charges in Passaic County because of pretrial pub. licity, defense lawyers today urged the judge here to transfer the coming trial to Essex County.

title: VIKING 2 CHECKING MARS FOR LANDING
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 1 (AP)With America's second Mars landing attempt two days away, Viking 2 began today to check the weather over the sandy, rolling Utopia Plain.

title: Canada Raises Postage For FirstClass Mail
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 1A new basic domestic postal rate of 10 cents for firstclass letter mail came into effect here today. The previous rate was 8 cents for one ounce.

title: ARTHUR C. PARKER
description: Arthur C. Parker, a Manhattan lawyer, died yesterday at Memorial Hospital at the age of 69.

title: Beame Testifies 5 Hours, At S.E.C. Finance Inquiry
description: Mayor Beame spent five and a half hours in testifying before the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday as part, of an investigation that many experts said would produce recommendations for drastic nationwide changes in municipal finance, and might also lead to potentially explosive political problems for local politicians.

title: Solomon Upset by Martin
Passport Photo Leads To Recovery of Loot
description: A wrong picture on a passport led yesterday to the arrest of a convict on parole and the recovery of most of the proceeds of a $48,000 midtown jewel burglary from a Saudi Arabian diplomat's hotel room Tuesday.

title: Ruling Allows an Increase In Spending By Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1  Jimmy Carter's legal advisers have found a way to inject up to $4.5 million worth of private political contributions into the national campaigns of both major parties, over and above the present $25 million spending ceiling for each ticket.

title: INDIA REGIME ASKS VAST NEW POWERS
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 1With the small parliamentary opposition protesting bitterly, Prime Minister Indira Gandhi's Government today formally introduced a wideranging set of constitutional amendments that would give her sweeping new legislative powers.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Connecticut ended the last fiscal year with a $34.7 million surplus, Comptroller J. Edward Caldwell reported. The Finance Commissioner, Jay Tepper, said it had not been decided how to use the surplus. Mr. Caldwell said in a report to Gov. Ella T. Grasso that it had been created by counting some tax revenues earlier than in the past, by economy measures taken by the Grasso administration and by inclusion of certain funds in the state's General Fund.

title: Police Find a Garden
Claiming Tax Deduction For an Office at Home
description: The Internal Revenue Service has long contended that anyone who tries to claim a tax deduction for an office at home will have a difficult time unless he is either selfemployed or responding to a specific condition of employment. Enough court decisions have now come down on the side of the Revenue Service so that it may be almost a waste of the deduction unless the I.R.S.'s strict standards are met.

title: Solomon Upset by Martin
Pomona Expects $45 Million Project
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 1A $45 million building project is virtually assured for the National Aviation Facilities Experimental Center at nearby Pomona, with ground breaking expected in January, the chair, man of the Atlantic City Improvement Authority said today.

title: The Future of Black Colleges
description: The predominantly black colleges of this country have always occupied a proud place in the drive for opportunity and justice for black people. Most of the black leadership we know today was educated by them; of the blacks with bachelor's degrees today, more received their education at the country's 100 black colleges than at over 2,000 other institutions of higher education. In the South, there are more blacks going to these colleges today than to all other institutions combined.

title: Heart Disease Deaths Drop Below One Million
Agency to Let Processors Ignore Deboned Meat Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 1 (UPI) The Agriculture Department said today that it would allow processors to continue using meat containing groundup bone in hot dogs and other foods despite a Federal judge's ruling.

title: AntiObscenity Unit To Aid Communities Taking Legal Action
description: The creation of a national antiobscenity office that would provide legal research and other support services to communities fighting obscenity cases was announced yesterday by Morality in Media, an organization founded in 1962 to combat pornography.

title: Coleman Picks Illinois Location for St. Louis Airport
Byrne Signs 2 Bills Repealing Taxes
description: TRENTON, Sept. 1Governor Byrne today signed into law two bills repealing taxes on businesses in the state, as the New Jersey personal income tax took effect and was reflected in reduced paychecks for workers being paid today.

title: Hurricanes Reported at Sea
description: MIAMI, Sept. 1 (AP)Hurricane Emmy, barely retaining hurricane status, moved toward the Azores Islands as another hurricane in the North Atlantic turned toward the northeast. Neither storm threatened land. Forecasters at the National Hurricane Center in Miami said that Emmy, with winds of up to 75 miles an hour, was on a course that probably would take it south of the Azores tomorrow. The second storm, Hurricane Frances, turned her maximum winds of 100 miles an hour to the northeast today.

title: Nightmares Continue In the Town of Attica
Bowing to Critics, U.S. Cuts Request On Saudi Missiles
description: WASHINGTON, Sept.1 (AP)In a substantial reduction of its original request, the Ford Administration asked Congress today to permit the sale of 850 Sidewinder and 650 Maverick missiles to Saudi Arabia.

title: Prayer in Dayton
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 1 (AP) Determined to avoid any violence, Dayton residents paused today to pray before embarking on the first courtordered busing plan in Ohio.

title: Koosman Shuts Out Giants
Devaluation of 25% in Peso Is Expected To Bring Benefits to Mexican Economy
Giants Sign Snead Again
description: Norm Snead, who once replaced Fran Tarkenton as a Giant and then was replaced by Craig Morton, yesterday became a New Yorker again. He signed on as backup to Morton following the knee injury Tuesday to Jerry Golsleyn. who has been placed on the 16day inactive list.

title: 6 Witches and Channel 13 Auction Fan Turn Out for a FullMoon Ceremony
description: Michael Aaron, a 28yearold cosmetics company supervisor, donned a red robe yesterday, placed a dagger across his heart , and took part in a fullmoon ceremony with six witches from a coven in Passaic, N.J.

title: Crime Costly to Businesses
description: BOSTON, Sept. 1 (UPI)Crime cost United States business more than $23.6 billion last year, about 50 percent more than five years ago, according to an expert on industrial security. About $6 billion of that total was paid by businesses for private security systems and guards, Arthur J. Bilek told the American Society of Industrial Security.

title: U.S. Will Try Gurney Again For Perjury in Influence Case
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Sept. 1(AP)  The United States Govern. ment dropped a conspiracy charge against former Senator Edward J. Gurney today, but said it would retry him Oct. 4 on a perjury count in an alleged influencepeddling scheme.

title: FORD IS ASSURED ON FLU VACCINE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) F. David Mathews, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, assured President Ford today that there would be enough swine influenza vaccine available to inoculate every American who wanted it before the peak of the flu season in January and February.

title: Mother of 3 Victims Of Blaze Is Charged
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 2 (AP) The mother of three children who were left unattended and died when a small fire broke out in their locked apartment has been charged with child abuse.

title: Dow Is Off 1.16, but Gains For Stocks Top Declines
description: The stock market was unable to keep its foursession rally alive yesterday as prices lost early gains to finish mixed in more active trading.

title: Second Mars Landing Is Set for Tonight
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 2Tomorrow afternoon for the second time this summer a highly automated Viking lander will be detached from itsmoth??r ship in Martian orbit and sent down to land on the Utopia Plain of Mars to probe the planet's interior, its surface properties, its weather, atmosphere and biology.

title: Big Payoffs Mark Orderly 2d Night
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Sept. 2  Like an outofcontrol harness horse regaining its proper gait, the new Meadowlands track went from an openingnight gallopto a manageable trot tonight in its second program, With rain falling, the novelty of a debut gone and the memory of last night's traffic jams still fresh, attendance plummeted to 10,694.

title: Dispute Shatters Great Swamp Tranquillity
description: MORRISTOWN, Sept. 2The second battle of the Great Swamp is beginning.

title: Federal Panel in Texas Denies McCarthy a Place on the Ballot
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Sept. 2Former Senator Eugene J. McCarthy of Minnesota has been denied a place on a Texas ballot next November in his race for the Presidency.

title: Rudel Marks 20 Years at City Opera
description: Tomorrow night at 8 o'clock or a couple of Minutes thereafter a wavyhaired, athletically trim man will bounce onto the podium at the New York State Theater, take a quick bow or two and set in motion a performance of Puccini's Turandot.

title: CANDIDATE IN BRONX RULED OFF BALLOT
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Northrop Payments Recalled
description: A Northrop spokesman in Los Angeles said last night that no one was available to comment on the Netherlands report.

title: Cultural Differences
description: Switzerland and Liechtenstein have pleasantly demonstrated the advantages of avoiding what President Washington once described as entangling alliances. When a troop of Swiss militiamen inadvertently invaded their neighboring state in the course of foggy maneuvers, the incident could have blown up into a major affair if Liechtenstein had had an automatic defense pact, say, with Austria, or Switzerland one with Italy.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Overcrowding in New York's Prisons Is Laid to Indeterminate Sentencing
description: Citing indeterminate sentenc ing as one of the primary reasons for overcrowding in the state's prison system, Benjamin C. Ward, the New York State Correctional Services Commissioner, called yesterday for the abolishment of the current system. of determining sentences.

title: 6 Accused of Manipulating Credit Data Bank on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 2A Federal grand jury indicted six persons today for allegedly manipulating the records of more than 100 people in the nation's largest consumer creditdata bank. The bank stores information on the borrowing habits of more thin 50 million Americans.

title: Trail Blazers Sell Wicks to the Jazz
description: The Portland Trail Blazers, overstocked in the frontcourt, in need of backcourt help and with an unmanageably high payroll, sold Sid Wicks yesterday to the New Orleans Jazz.

title: SYLVAN SCOLNICK, 46, CRIMINAL INFORMER
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Sept. 2 (UPI)Sylvan Scolnick, whose activities ranged from bankruptcy fraud to robbery, died last night at his home. He was 46 years old.

title: What Kind Of Debates?; It's all in the cards, my dear
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2  In ?? forthcoming debates between President Ford and Governor Carter, the President will begin with several obvious advantages. Elected or not, he is the President, and in any dispute between them on issues of fact, the tendency of most uncommitted television viewers will be to give the President, with all his superior access to the Government's vast store of information and intelligence, the benefit of the doubt.

title: Schools Calm in Dayton, Ohio, As City Meets a Busing Order
description: DAYTON, Ohio, Sept. 2 (AP) School opened quietly and without incident today as the city began busing public school students to meet the first Federal court desegregation order in Ohio.

title: TaxExempt Bonds Showing Strength
Metropolitan Briefs
description: The main ramp entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel was closed yesterday for five days of repairs, forcing an average of 50,000 vehicles, at least during the first two days, to exit onto local roads.

title: Vietnam Parade on National Day Accents the Transition to Peace
description: HANOI, Vietnam, Sept. 2 (Agence FrancePresse)  Reunified Vietnam celebrated its first National Day today with a parade that featured farm and industrial equipment instead of missiles and military vehicles.

title: LEVI SAID TO BACK RETAINING KELLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Attorney General Edward H. Levi is expected to ask President Ford to retain Clarence M. Kelley as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation despite disclosures that Mr. Kelley accepted gifts from subordinates and may have misused Government property, a source with access to details of the case said today.

title: BIG BOARD FAVORS AUDIT COMMITTEES AMONG COMPANIES
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that it would ask listed companies to consider a proposal to make the formation of an audit committee a requirement for continued listing on the exchange.

title: Draft Pact Denies Terrorists Asylum
description: BONN, Sept. 2  Eighteen European governments are expected to give preliminary approval later this month to a farreaching treaty that would deny political asylum to terrorists.

title: Compromise Indicated
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 2There were indications here on the eve of talks between Secretary Kissinger and Prime Minister Vorster that some compromise resolution on the issue of SouthWest Africa might already have been outlined and possibly even endorsed by some black African leaders.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: In the coming days, the nation's 340,000 school buses will be out in force again, carrying more than 20 million children to school and on field trips.

title: Yanks Chambliss Speaks Softly But He Is Wielding a Loud Bat
description: The Yankees already held a 13game lead, at the time their biggest margin of the season, and they had been winning regularlya fivegame winning streak here, a threegame winning streak there. Another victory didn't appear to be so vital at the time.

title: For Harbor, No More Oops Sail in Store
description: the need for rapid communications. I want to tell you you'll meet a ship coming your way at four knots in five minutes. I don't want to wait one minute to tell you that.

title: Paterson Celebrates Its Great Falls
description: Someone once said that nobody takes a vacation or spends a honeymoon in Paterson, N.J., but thousands of visitors will travel to the heavily industrialized city 15 miles from New York for the sixth annual Great Falls Festival beginning today and running through Labor Day.

title: A Suit Challenges Ouster Of 1,050 City U. Teachers
description: Eight dismissed teachers filed a Federal suit yesterday challenging the constitutionality of the dismissal of more than 1,000 fulltime teachers at the City University of New York.

title: Candidates for Surrogate Agree on Issues
description: The five Democratic candidates for Manhattan surrogate all say they want politics removed from the Surrogate's Court.

title: Great Lakes Water Levels Found Lower in a Survey
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2 (AP)  Great Lakes water levels are dropping slightly, according to officials in the Detroit district office of the United States Army Corps of Engineers.

title: More Improper School Purchase Orders Reported
description: An audit by the New York City Comptroller's office has found that the Board of Education's Bureau of School Lunches gave improper split orders totaling about $550,000 to a second supplier as well as awarded such orders in lesser amounts to other companies.

title: Carter Gains in the Gallup Poll
description: Jimmy Carter's lead over President Ford in the race for President has increased to a margin of 52 percent to 37 percent, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Mexican Peso Is Off 39% On Trading Resumption
description: MEXICO VITY, Sept. 2The value of the Mexican peso fell by 39 percent today when foreign exchange dealings resumed here following the Government's decision Tuesday to abandon the currency's fixed parity with the dollar.

title: New Kosygin Aide Named Amid Rumors on Premier
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 2Nikolai A. Tikhonov, a longtime associate of the Soviet Communist Party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, was appointed today as a First Deputy to Prime Minister Aleksei N. Kosygin.

title: ARMY TO HOLD OFF EXPELLING CADETS
description: The Army has decided to permit cadets who have been found guilty of cheating at the United States Military Academy at West Point, N.Y., to continue attending classes and to participate in normal student activities until the legal complications surrounding the controversy have been resolved.

title: VITAMIN PILL ADS ON TV CURTAILED
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2A major drug company that manufactures candylike vitamin pills agreed today to stop running in comic books or on daytime television advertisements that appeal to children or use hero figures as inducements to buy its product.

title: Bernhard Asked Schmidt To Buy Northrop Planes
description: THE HAGUE, Sept. 2Prince Bernhard asked Helmut Schmidt, the West German Chancellor and former defense minister, to purchase planes in 1971 produced by the Northrop Aircraft Corporation, according to letters released here today.

title: Future Cloudy
description: YONKERS, Sept. 2Heartened by their own attendance and handle figures last night despite competition from an openingnight sellout at New Jersey's new Meadowlands in East Rutherford, Yonkers Raceway officials today said their immediate policy would be one of watchful waiting.

title: Steel Offers an Opportunity
description: Virtually the entire American steel industry has now rescinded the 4.5 percent increase in prices of flatrolled steel products that was to have taken effect Oct. 1. The steel rollback gives the Administration an opportunity to get a firmer grip on inflation than it has had up until nowand thereby strengthen the flagging economic recovery and avoid a regeneration of inflation next year, should the economy again spurt.

title: Replacing the World's Airline Fleets
description: LONDON, Sept. 2If there is one thing on which there is almost universal agreement among aviation experts, it is that the world's airlines are going to need a lot of new aircraftmany hundreds of themstarting about 1980 or 1981. That means large.staggeringly expensive plane orders will probably have to be placed some time in 1977. The bulk of the newly ordered planes will be tailored for route lengths and passenger loads below those of today's jumbo jets.

title: U.S. and North Korea Reported Near an Accord on Panmunjom
description: SEOUL, South Korea. Sept. 2United States and North Korean negotiators are reported moving toward a broad agreement on security arrangements at the Panmuniom truce site that would include measures to assure the safety of Americana guards.

title: Peyser Certain He Can Beat Buckley
description: Representative Peter Peyser says that he can beat Senator James L. Buckley in the Republican primaryand that he hadi better, to save the party from succumbing to absolute blackmail by the Conservatives.

title: Mondale Ends Campaign Swing, Hails Unity in Party
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Sept. 2 Heading back to Washington after a nine  day campaign swing from coast to coast, Senator Walter F. Mondale said today that this last shakedown cruise had gone quite well, considering that this is a new experience for me.

title: Quake Hits Puget Sound
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 2 (UPI)A minor earthquake rumbled through northern Puget Sound early today, shaking many residents to an early awakening. A spokesman at the Canadian Search and Rescue Coordination Center in Victoria, B. C., said the temblor was felt strongly in that city and less so in Vancouver.

title: At the Movies
description: BILLY WILDER, who applied a wicked scalpel to the underbelly of Hollywood in the classic Sunset Boulevard. is at it again. He and his collaborator, I. A. L. Diamond, are now writing an adaptation of Fedora, one or the four kinky tales of Hollywood horror that comprise Thomas Tryon's novel Crowned Heads, in which the central character, an eerily ageless movie queen, is a cross between Greta Garbo and Sunset Boulevard's Norma Desmond. The other day, the 70yearold director of such enduring films as Double Indemnity, The Lost Weekend, Ace in the Hole, Love in the Afternoon, Witness for the Prosecution, Some Like It Hot, The Apartment and The Fortune Cookie, took a break and talked about his latest project.

title: Notes on People
description: Her three grown sons have smoked marijuanathey told me they did, Rosalynn Carter said yesterday. But the only time I worry about my children,said the wife of Jimmy Carter, the Democratic Presidential nominee, is if I thought they were slipping around and doing it and not letting me know about it.

title: Lefkowitz Defends Way Of Handling Voter Case
description: The New York State Attorney General, Louis J. Lefkowitz, said yesterday that Representative Herman Badillo was wrong when he implied that Mr. Lefkowitz's office did nothing with a 1972 investigation on allegations of voterregistration fraud.

title: Bernhard Asked Schmidt To Buy Northrop Planes
description: THE HAGUE, Sept. 2Prince Bernhard asked Helmut Schmidt, the West German Chancellor and former defense minister, to purchase planes in 1971 produced by the Northrop Aircraft Corporation, according to letters released here today.

title: LEVI SAID TO BACK RETAINING KELLEY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Attorney General Edward H. Levi is expected to ask President Ford to retain Clarence M. Kelley as director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation despite disclosures that Mr. Kelley accepted gifts from subordinates and may have misused Government property, a source with access to details of the case said today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 3, 1976

title: ARSENIC REPORT ON WINES SCORED
description: Three Wisconsin scientists have said that they found relatively high levels of arsenic in some California wines and raisins. Their findings were part of a paper prepared for delivery at the annual meeting of the American Chemical Society in San Francisco this week, but was withdrawn after its subject matter was disclosed prematurely by the press.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The main ramp entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel was closed yesterday for five days of repairs, forcing an average of 50,090 vehicles, at least during the first two days, to exit onto local roads.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 3, 1976

title: Payments Reported By AnheuserBusch And a Bristol Unit
description: The BristolMyers Company disclosed yesterday that it had probably made payments of $1.9 million to foreign government officials and AnheuserBusch Inc. said it. had made questionable domestic payments of $2.72 million.

title: Panel Reports Doctor Shortage Limited to Poorer Areas of U.S.
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Sept. 2 (AP)America's shortage of doctors appears to have ended, but the physicians are concentrated in areas where they can make more money, leaving lowincome rural and urban areas without proper medical services, according to Carnegie Council on Policy Studies in Higher Education.

title: Chain Store Sales
description: *Sales period ended Aug. 25 **Sales period ended Aug. 24

title: Mrs. Dole Is Honored on Visit to Hometown
description: SALISBURY, N.C., Sept. 2While the wife of Senator Robert J. Dote, the Republican VicePresidential candidate, was still trying to decide whether she would give up her post as a Federal Trade Commissioner to campaign this fall, she was honored here in her hometown today at Elizabeth Hanford Dole Day.

title: Article 2  No Title
Maddox Opens Campaign at Fair
description: FLEMINGTON, Sept. 2Former Gov. Lester Maddox of Georgia opened his campaign for the Presidency here this afternoon with a scathing denunciation of Jimmy Carter and a highly controversial, conservative platform calculated, he said, to clean that crowd out of Washington.

title: Mexicans Resume Heroin Campaign With American Aid
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 2The United States and Mexico have resumed their joint campaign to eradicate thousands of opium poppy plantations in the hope of sharply reducing the flow of Mexican heroin into the United States.

title: 4 Nassau Democrats Rebuffed In a Challenge to Election Law
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Sept. 2The constitutionality of a section of the state election law that permits county chairmen of political parties to recommend a person to a county legislature for appointment as a commissioner of elections was upheld todayin State Supreme Court here.

title: Former Head and 2 Past Officers Of a Toyota Subsidiary Indicted
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 2The former president and two other former executives of a subsidiary of Toyota Motors, the Japanese auto manufacturer, were indicted by a Federal grand jury today for alleged tax fraud involving half a million dollars in alleged kickbacks from persons seeking automobile distributorships and other concessions in this country.

title: Weekend Gardening: Peonies
description: When it comes to planting peonies, timing is not to be underrated. In the longoutofprint The Book of the peony, Mrs. Edward Harding states: I shall try to firmly fix in the mind of the peonylover the proper time to begirt planting; it is Sept. 15 at 9 A.M. (I do not believe in hurrying through breakfast!)

title: Gold Rises
description: LONDON, Sept. 2 (AP) Gold prices rose 75 cents an ounce today in London and $1 in Zurich, the two major European billion markets, while the American dollar advanced in value against most major currencies of Europe.

title: AIR CHARTER PLAN APPROVED BY C.A.B. CUTS RESTRICTIONS
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board, significantly expanding the opportunities for lowcost air travel, approved yesterday a new category of charter flights that eliminates virtually all restrictions except advance booking.

title: Steelworkers to Seek Guaranteed Annual Wage in the Contract Talks Next Year
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 2The United Steelworkers of America is serving notice here this week that it hopes to break new ground in its contract negotiations next year by winning a guaranteed annual wage for members of its union.

title: Washington Crew Flying Scot Victor
description: MIAMI, Sept. 2 (AP)A threeman Washington, D. C., crew won the Sears Cup in the final heats in the North American junior sailing championships today on Biscayne Bay.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Thursday.

title: GOV. MOORE BARS RACE AGAINST BYRD
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Sept. 2 (AP)The office of Gov. Arch A. Moore Jr. announced today that the Governor would not seek the Republican nomination to oppose Democratic Senator Robert C. Byrd in November.

title: People and Business
description: Walter E. Hanson, senior partner of Peat, Marwick, Mitchell & Company, the accounting firm, said yesterday that the magnitude of the demands for disclosure is an important reason why the public is getting less than it deserves from auditing.

title: Canadian Six Wins Opener
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 2A nervous team of gangly, blond hockey players from Finland lost, 112, tonight to the talented Team Canada squad in the opening game of the Canada Cup of Hockey, a sixteam international tournament.

title: Air Force Checks Charges of Crimes By Ring of Cadets
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Sept. 2The Air Force has begun a fullscale investigation into allegations that cadets at the Air Force Academy here have been operating a theft and forgery ring since 1972.

title: AIR CHARTER PLAN APPROVED BY C.A.B. CUTS RESTRICTIONS
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board, significantly expanding the opportunities for lowcost air travel, approved yesterday a new category of charter flights that eliminates virtually all restrictions except advance booking.

title: WHOLESALE PRICES DOWN FOR AUGUST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Wholesale prices, reflecting the sharpest drop in farm prices in 18 months, slipped slightly in August, continuing a trend of moderate price movements.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: GEORGE P. McGOWAN

title: Article 3  No Title
TV WEEKEND
description: Friday

title: Murakami, Hill Hold Golf Lead
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 2When 20 of the world's best golfers gather for the first time, as they did today, to share a $300,000 purse, with a first prize of $100,000, the atmosphere turns out to be relaxed and cozy.

title: S.E.C. ALLEGING AUDITING FAULTS AT TOUCHE ROSS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2The Securities and Exchange Commission, bringing charges against a major accounting firm for the second day, alleged today that Touche Ross & Company had negligently certified false and misleading financial statements issued by the Giant Stores Corporation and the Ampex Corporation.

title: Part of Income New York City Awaits Is Now Unlikely to Be Arriving on Time
description: A critical part of income that New York City is depending on this year is now unlikely to arrive in time, city officials said yesterday  a development compounding the difficulty of paying back city loans from the Federal Government next spring.

title: New Element Arises in School Talks
description: For more than a year, nego tiations have dragged on in the sputtering, fruitless effort to reach agreement on contract terms between the New York City Board of Education and the United Federation of Teachers. But in the last 10 days, a rapid succession of events has taken place giving new urgency to the contract talks, raising the possibility that an accord can be reached before school startsand, perhaps most significantly, thrusting a new element into the volatile mixture of political forces surrounding labor negotiations in the city.

title: OFFICIALS SOUND GONORRHEA ALERT
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 2 (UPI)Health authorities are on a worldwide alert for a new strain of gonorrhea resistant to penicillin, the antibiotic used successfully since World War II to treat the venereal disease.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Harry J. Hibner Jr., a division manager of the American Telephone & Telegraph Company, died Wednesday of Cancer in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L.I. He was 52 years old and lived at 36 Wellington Road, Garden City, L. I.

title: Big Surge in Auto Sales Is a Surprise to Dealers
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2John Medved, a salesman for Mark Chevrolet in suburban Wayne, concedes he is surprised at the way people are buying cars these days.

title: Estee Lauder Will Use More Than One Woman
description: Este Lauder, the cosmetics company, has for many years used one model in the advertising for all of its fragrances as its symbol of beauty. At first it was Phyllis Connor, then it was Karen Harris and since 1970, it has been Karen Graham.

title: Air Force Checks Charges of Crimes By Ring of Cadets
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo., Sept. 2The Air Force has begun a fullscale investigation into allegations that cadets at the Air Force Academy here have been operating a theft and forgery ring since 1972.

title: Two Executives Acquitted Of Plotting in Kepone Case
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Sept. 2The first two chemical company executives to be tried in the Federal prosecution of corporations and their officials accused of dumping the insecticide Kepone into Virginia waterways were acquitted today of conspiring to conceal the toxic pollution from Government agencies.

title: Playoff Tickets OK'd for Yanks
description: The Cincinnati Reds. Philadelphia Phillies, Kansas City Royals and the New York Yankees have been given permission to print league championship and World Series tickets, Commissioner Bowie Kuhn said yesterday.

title: Siderowf Gains, 5 and 4, in U.S. Amateur
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 2 (UPI) The British Amateur champion, Dick Siderowf, a 39yearold Westport, Conn., stockbroker, defeated Ed Barnes of Kinneson, Ga., 5 and 4 today in a thirdround match of the 76th United States Amateur golf champlonship.

title: Sinnott Is Arrested
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (AP) The Rev. James P. Sinnott, former vicar general of Inchon, South Korea, was arrested today for conducting a prayer vigil on the grounds of the South Korean Embassy. The police said Mr. Sinnott, who was protesting the sentencing in South Korea last week of 18 political dissidents, violated a Washington law that prohibits demonstrations within 500 feet of an embassy.

title: SouthWest Africa Called Focus of Kissinger Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2State Department officials said today that Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has set progress toward independence for SouthWest Africa as the minimum goal for his talks this weekend in Zurich with Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa.

title: Gary Wright's Pop Lyricism
description: Gary Wright, the British rock singer/songwriter, performs with a band consisting of four keyboard players, each of whom commands a battery of instruments, plus a drummer and two backup singers, one of whom also mans a fifth set of keyboards. The sound that results is loud but lyrical, because for all his spaceage technology, Mr. Wright is primarily a purveyor of romantic pop music.

title: From Israel With Fiddles
description: The Israel Philharmonic Orchestra, which begins a round of metropolitan area performances Sunday night at the Garden State Arts Center in Holmdel, N.J., serves as the center of Israel's music lifethe leading orchestra and the source of a number of its leading chamber ensembles.

title: 4 on Fresno Bee Lose Contempt Case Appeal
description: SAN FRANCISCO. Sept. 2 (UPI)The State Supreme Court refused today to hear arguments on contempt charges against four newsmen on The Fresno Bee, thereby sentencing them to indefinite jail terms for declining to disclose a news source.

title: 3 of 5 Senate Candidates To Use TV in Last Week
description: Three of the five New York Democratic candidates for the United States Senate nomination have scheduled extensive television commercials for the final week of the primary campaign next week to try to win over what many politicians believe are still a large number of undecided voters.

title: Israeli Buildup Near Lebanon Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 2Israel was reported today to have moved troop reinforcements to its northern border with Lebanon.

title: Safety Pamphlets
description: For parents interested in how to evaluate the school bus system in their districts or how to set up a bus family education program such as the one in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., pamphlets are available from Action for Child Transportation Safety, 400 Central Park West, 15P, New York, N.Y. 10025. A packet of safety information is $1.

title: The Labor Scene
description: The computers and printout machines on the seventh floor of the House of Labor two blocks from the White House are whirring on a roundtheclock basis, seven days a week, as American unions gear up for the most intensive getoutthevote effort in their history this fall.

title: Chancellor of State U. Criticizes Regents' Master Plan
description: ALBANY, Sept. 2Dr. Ernest L. Boyer, the chancellor of the State University of New York, today sharply criticize, major recommendations for higher education made by the Board of Regents, which determines education policy in the state.

title: Storm Heads to Azores
description: MIAMI, Sept. 2 (AP)Hurricane Emmy, on the threshold of being downgraded to a tropical storm, moved eastward across the Atlantic today on a path that forecasters said could, take it close to the Azores.

title: Business Records
description: Thursday; Sept. 2. 1976

title: Canada Air Fares Up
description: OTTAWA, Sept. 2 (UPI)Increases of as much as 8 percent went into effect yesterday on Air Canada and Canadian Pacific Air's domestic flights. They followed a similar increase imposed last April.

title: Jerseyan Shot to Death
description: CHERRY HILL, N J., Sept. 2 (AP)A 59yearold man was shot to death today after emerging from his car in the parking lot of his apartment building here, the ponce sm. The man, John W. Franks died at the Cherry Hill Medical Center about 5:30 A.M., four hours after he was shot once in the throat. The police said Mr. Franks had just stepped from his car at the Plaza Towers Apartments when someone shouted, Turn around. he did and was shot.

title: Martina Navratilova Eliminated As Rain Cuts Open Tennis Play
description: One year ago, Martina Navratilova climbed aboard the freedom train with an emotional defection from Czechoslovakia during the closing days of the United States Open tennis championships.

title: Winter Wheat, an Innovation, Helps Tibet Raise Output
description: LHASA, Tibet  The large, regular fields in the wide valleys of Tibet were covered with ripening crops, with patches of rapeseed providing a brilliant yellow contrast to the green of the barley that Tibetans call ginkho.

title: 3,000 IN CAPE TOWN CLASH WITH POLICE
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 2 About 3,000 nonwhite people clashed with the police today in downtown Cape Town in the first racial violence to take place in a white area since the wave of violence against apartheid began in South Africa two months ago.

title: Waldheim Sees War Threat in Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 2Secretary General Ku??t Waldheim warned today that the problems of southern Africa create a serious potential threat to international peace and security.

title: For Harbor, No More Oops Sail Impact on Port Preventable Accidents Controlling Traffic Advisory Given
description: Data from two television cameras continuously watching ships move past 23 locations around New York harbor for weeklong periods have laid the groundwork for a modernized control network that will bring the harbor traffic into the computer age by 1978.

title: Chemical Flowing Illegally Into Niagara
description: The highly dangerous chemical compound Mirex is currently being discharged at the formidable rate of more than a pound a day from outfalls of the Hooker Chemical Company of Niagara Falls, N. Y. The Mirex, which has caused cancer in laboratory animals, is going into the Niagara River.

title: Don Smith Dies in Canada
description: EDMONTON, Alberta, Sept. 2 (AP)Don Smith, 55 years old, father of two Olympic medal winners in swimming, died yesterday. Two of his children, Graham and Becky, won medals at Montreal this year.

title: Dictatorship in India
description: During the bitter debate in India over the drastic constitutional amendments designed to remove many of the remaining restraints on Indira Gandhi's authoritarian rule, Law Minister H. R. Gokhale categorically denied any intention of censoring reporting on Parliament. Within an hour after he had spoken, the Government imposed precensorship on the parliamentary debate that had included harsh criticisms of the Prime Minister.

title: State Closes Book on Corruption Matter
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2The state closed the book today on a corruption case that helped to bring down the administration of former Gov. William T. Cahill.

title: The Pop Life
description: THESE DAYS, we have disco and salsa, cabaret and singersongwriters, country and reggae, and it's sometimes hard to know where good old rockandroll fits in. The answer is nowhere particularly different: it's still as often on the top of the charts as any other kind of music, but its most popular and successful practitioners aren't always seized upon now by the selfappointed tastemakers.

title: Peking Discloses Looting Occurred After Earthquake
description: PEKING, Sept.: 2 (Reuters)For the first time Jenmin Jih Pao, the official Communist publication, has used the word looting in discussing the earthquake that devastated parts of northeast China last month.

title: Bridge
description: The recent domination of New York championships by young experts was threatened earlier this week when a sextet of veteran players whose ability greatly exceeds their reputations reached the final of the Von Zedtwitz double knockout team championship.

title: Fishing Fare Varies In Nearby Waters
description: With the departure of the recent strange, prottracted spell of steaming semitropical weather, many East Coast anglers are looking forward to the annual fall feeding binge of bluefish and striped bass. The peak of that glorious fall fishing is still about a month away, but surf angling for those species should improve steadily from now on.

title: Merle A. Gulick, 70
description: He joined Equitable in 1930 after graduating from Hobart College, where he was a star football player. He served with the Coast Guard in World War II, and was elected vice president of Equitable's Group Department in 1950. He was named vice president in charge of public relations and personnel in 1960, and vice president of corporate affairs in 1968.

title: Article 1  No Title
Indian Press Gives Regime Wide Berth
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 2During the parliamentary debate yesterday on the Government's far  reaching proposals to amend the Constitution, Samar Mukherjee, a Marxist member from Calcutta, rose to protest.

title: Malignancy Feared in Blast Victim at Atom Plant
description: RICHLAND, Wash., Sept. 2 (AP)A doctor says he is worried about the possibility that a worker contaminated with radiation after a chemical explosion could develop a malignant condition of the bone.

title: Barbados Ruling Party Beaten After 15 Years
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados. Friday, Sept. 3 (AP)Prime Minister Errol Walton Barrow's 15 years in office ended early today when J. M. G. Adams and his Barbados ?? Pa??y defeated Mr. Barrow's Democratic Labor party in a general election.

title: 3,000 IN CAPE TOWN CLASH WITH POLICE
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 2About 3,000 nonwhite people clashed with the police today in downtown Cape Town in the first racial violence to take place in a white area since the wave of violence against apartheid began in South Africa two months ago.

title: Chemist Says a Botanical Plant Can Be Used to Make Gasoline
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Calif., Sept. 2A Nobel laureate in chemistry from the University of. California, Berkeley, has announced the discovery of a plant that might be capable of producing crude oil more cheaply than conventional oil wells.

title: Manufacturing Appropriations For Future Spending Increase
description: Capital appropriated for future spending on plants and equipment by the nation's 1,000 largest manufacturers rose in the second quarter to $12.8 billion, a 13.2 percent increase over the first quarter, the Conference Board resorted yesterday.

title: B1 Slowdown
description: The decision of the SenateHouse conference committee on the defense appropriation bill to delay fullscale procurement on the B1 bomber until next Feb. 1 deserves at least a quiet cheer. While the conferees did not exactly turn back the militaryindustrial river, they at least blunted the BI program's bounding momentum.

title: Art People
description: AT 10 A.M. on Wednesday, a public hearing will be held in Baltimore on the question of whether work shall proceed on the sculpture by George Sugarman that was commissioned by the General Services Administration for the forecourt of the new Edward A. Garmatz Federal Building and Courthouse. Commissioner Nicholas A. Panuzio of the agency's Public Buildings Service will conduct the hearing,. which will be held in Room G30 of the Fallon Building at 31 Hopkins Place in Baltimore. Speakers will be allowed five minutes each and must talk in order of registration. (Registration closed last Wednesday, by the way.)

title: New York's Medicaid Mills Suffering Their Worst Crisis, a Spokesman Says
description: Owen J. McCormack, the chief lobbyist for New York City's shared health facilities, is a man of amiable disposition, but he is somber these days. He says the facilities, widely known as Medicaid mills, are in their worst crisis, and may be doomed.

title: Restaurants
description: ONE OF THE MORE WELCOME ADDITIONS to the local restaurant scene is, at first glance, Bijou, in a polished and sophisticated setting near Sutton Place. Brown walls, superrealistic stylized paintings of foods such as melon slices, red peppers and eggs, glowing lowlevel lighting from icy, crystal chandeliers and a long, stunning bar, artfully partitioned into intimate compartments, create an atmosphere that is already drawing a loyal and attractive clientele, and Bijou has been open only three months.

title: U.S. Tire Testing Rules Upheld by Appeals Court
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 2 (AP) The Department of Transportation's regulations for the testing and grading of automobile tires were upheld today by the United States Court of Appeals for the sixth circuit.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (Reuters) Japan and the United States are agreed that countries running balance of payment surpluses should be prepared to allow their foreign exchange rates to adjust, Treasury Undersecretary for Monetary Affairs Edwin Yeo 3d said in a statement.

title: TAX CONFEREES MAKE PROGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Senate and House conferees suspended their work on they manysided tax revision bill late today after making considerable progress toward agreement. but with some major issues unresolved.

title: Hays Tried for 2 Months To End Inquiry in House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Despite reports of mental depression and physical impairment,) former representative Wayne L. Hays waged a running fight for two months with the House ethics committee to head off his resignation, drop its investigation of him and stop public hearings into his conduct.

title: Legislature Will Discuss Stopping Medicaid Abuse
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Matthew Feldman of Teaneck, president of the State Senate, said today that how to stop Medicaid fraud would be a major subject to be taken up by the State Legislature when it reconvenes after the summer recess later this month.

title: Metropolitan Baedeker
description: If your travel prescription calls for a healthy dose of Americana this fall, and you are not prepared to go to great lengths to get it, think of Morristown, N.J. Everyone from Washington to the industrial tycoons of the 19th century left an imprint on the town and a lot of it is still there to see, only 30 miles from Times Square.

title: Phillips Petroleum And Head Indicted
description: TULSA, Okla.,Sept. 2  A Federal grand jury indicted the Phillips Petroleum Company, its board chairman and two former chairmen today on Federal tax charges alleging a global, conspiracy to conceal $3 million in Swiss bank accounts and a secret cache at company headquarters.

title: New Form of Infant Botulism Is Found
description: California state health officials said today that they had discovered a previously unsuspected form of infant botulism that could he fatal if not quickIy recognized and treated.

title: Lions Victors Over Colts, 249
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Sept. 2 (AP)  Garth Ten Napel, a rookie linebacker, returned a blocked punt 29 yards for a thirdquarter touchdown and, three minutes later, returned an interception 36 yards to a set up another score, leading the Detroit Lions to a 249 National Football League exhibition victory over the Baltimore Colts tonight.

title: A Dropout's Account Of Life at West Point
description: As if the United States Military Academy hadn't enough troubleswhat with 199 cadets in last year's junior class accused of having dishonored their codethe first West Pointer to ever stand in an unemployment line has written a book, a sort of One Flew Over the Hudson River.

title: Debates Facing Challenge By McCarthy and Maddox
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2Attorneys for Eugene J. McCarthy and Lester G. Maddox said today that they had been in touch with each other, and that they intended to explore the possibility of joint legal action over the exclusion of the two men from the scheduled television debates between President Ford and Jimmy Carter.

title: Seidman Told Ford of Study When Asked to Be Adviser
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 (UPI) L. William Seidman told President Ford that his auditing firm was under Government investigation when the then Vice President asked him to become an adviser, a White House spokesman said today.

title: Forage First at Belmont
description: William Haggin Perry's Forage drew clear in the stretch and won the $25,000 Gun Bow Purse at Belmont Park Thursday, giving Jorge Velasquez his third winner of the day. Velasquez gained his fourth victory in the ninth race.

title: WHOLESALE PRICES DOWN FOR AUGUST
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 2 Wholesale prices, reflecting the sharpest drop in farm prices in 18 months, slipped slightly in August, continuing a trend of moderate price movements.

title: Unchanging Prisons
description: Events of the past few weeks have shown that New York State's troubled prisons system has undergone little, if any, constructive change since 43 persons died in the fourday revolt at the Attica Correctional Facility in September 1971.

title: Market Place
description: Investors who bought shares of companies going public this year for the first time have fared less than well. Of the 20 new stock issues sold publicly this year, 12 now are trading below their original offering prices. Four show gains and four are still trading unchanged from their original prices.

title: How to Get Tickets
description: Tickets to all performances of the New York Dance Festival are free. They will he distributed at 6:15 P.M. for 8 P.M. performances and at 1:15 P.M. for 3 P.M. matinees at the Delacorte Theater box office. Tickets are available only on the day of the performance, and there is no admission after 7:45 P.M.

title: GOLD
description: By The Associated Press

title: 6 Accused of Manipulating Credit Data Bank on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 2A Federal grand jury indicted six persons today for allegedly manipulating the records of more than 100 people in the nation's largest consumer creditdata bank. The bank stores information on the borrowing habits of more than 50 million Americans.

title: British Accuse Irish on a Torture Report
description: DUBLIN, Sept. 2British officials today accused the Irish Republic, of deliberately embarrassing the British Government and thereby endangering joint efforts by the two countries to control terrorism in the United Kingdom.

title: Labor Day Weekend Is Open Season on Theater Tickets
description: The long Labor Day weekend is the time to catch up on everything you've wanted to see on Broadway before the arrival of a new and unusually busy fall season. It is the weekend for those who grumble about the comparative ease of theatergoing in London. Tickets appear readily available for all shows except A Chorus Line (sold out) and The Wiz (some available) during the holiday weekend. Some theaters have even added performances on Monday.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: CLAYTON H. CHARLES

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 2Election deadlines will force the State Senate to cut its summer recess short.

title: Pirates Shut Out Padres
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 2 (UPI)  Larry Demery pitched a fivehit shutout and Richie Hebner doubled home two runs and stole home tonight as the Pittsburgh Pirates beat the San Diego Padres, 50, for their seventh straight victory.

title: NEW YORK CALLED A TARGET OF FORD
description: Richard M. Rosenbaum, the New York Republican state chairman, said yesterday that President Ford, his running mate, Senator Robert J. Dole, and other highranking Republicans. as well as members of the Ford family, would campaign in the state in an effort to carry it in November.

title: How to Get There
description: The Great Falls are only a short distance by auto from Route 80. Going west, the exit is at Main Street, Paterson; going east, it is the Paterson Business District. Follow Main Street to Grand Street, turn left to Spruce Street, then right to the falls.

title: Wright, Mrs. Chisholm Trade Charges In FacetoFace Debate in Brooklyn
description: The intense emotion of the Brooklyn Congressional primary between Councilman Samuel D. Wright and Representative Shirley Chisholm was evident when the two met last night for the first time in a facetoface debate in which they spent the bulk of the time trading charges rather than highlighting differences on issues.

title: NEVADA IS CHECKING SINATRA'S HOLDINGS
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Sept. 2State investigators are attempting to learn how much stock Frank Sinatra owns in the Del Webb Corporation, which owns four Nevada gambling resorts, and whether the singer's lawyer is holding more stock on his behalf, according to a state gaming official.

title: Buying Frocks For Flappers
description: Somewhere in the memories of all those yesterdays are the visions spunperhaps in childhood, perhaps from some special experience viewing a film, play or ballet of the clothes that spelled glamour, stunning sophistication or the essence of ease.

title: Caribbean Holiday In Brooklyn
description: For most metropolitan New Yorkers the chance to sample the delights of Caribbean culture comes only during winter vacations. But starting tonight in Brooklyn and continuing practically nonstop through Labor Day they will have that opportunity as Carnival, that exuberant celebration of Caribbean life, is celebrated in a way that has no parallel anywhere else in North America.

title: Murcer Stars as Mets Fall
description: The Mets and the San Francisco Giants spent a waterlogged afternoon at Shea Stadium yesterday, watching rain soak the playing field for a long while but still finding time to play a baseball game that the Giants won, 107.

title: Police Follow Screams To Bryant Park Slaying
description: A shabbily dressed young man was found stabbed to death last night in Bryant Park just off West 40th Street.

title: Charity Groups Helping SwineFlu Shot Program
description: Under the leadership of the United Fund of Greater New York, several major New York philanthropic organizations are helping to underwrite the cost of inoculating the city's 10 million residents against the swine influenza virus.

title: About Real Estate
description: ALTA LOMA, Calif.  A home on the range it isn't. But the new home of Mr. and Mrs. William Maynard here is called, nevertheless, a horse ranch. It has onehalf acre of land, a threebedroom house, a barn and corral. And the back yard opens to several miles of bridle paths.

title: Antiques
description: PHOTOGRAPHICA FANS haunt the hock shops of Manhattannot to pawn their cameras, but to purchase rare vintage designs. They scour antiques stores, flea markets, junk yards, garage and tag sales and auctions, eagerly eyeing mountain of merchandise to find somethinganythingto satisfy their passion for old cameras and equipment.

title: Amex and Counter Gain for the 5th Day in a Row
description: The American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market registered their fifth consecutive advances yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Chemical Flowing Illegally Into Niagara
description: The highly dangerous chemical compound Mirex is currently being discharged at the formidable rate of more than a pound a day from outfalls of the Hooker Chemical Company of Niagara Falls, N. Y. The Mirex is going into the Niagara River.

title: WITNESS SAW CAR OF SLAIN WOMAN
description: HACKENSACK, Sept. 2Joseph C. Woodcock, the Bergen County Prosecutor, said today that the police had a witness who had seen the car belonging to Kim Montelaro, the 20yearold woman who was raped and murdered Tuesday, parked near the scene of the crime at the Pine Lake Beach Club in Washington Township.

title: Truce Zone at Panmunjom Now a Lure for Tourists
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Sept. 2  American soldiers who volunteer for oneyear tours of duty in Panmunjom, the tensionfilled truce camp 35 miles north of here, are screened for their ability, physically and emotionally, to survive in the area and then receive special combat training before they go.

title: MiniMarket Is Displayed By Weeden
description: A miniature automated trading system designed to demonstrate the feasibility of a much more comprehensive electronic stock market was introduced here yesterday by Weeden & Company, the Wall Street securities dealer.

title: Soybeans And Grain Up Sharply
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 2 (AP)Concern over a possible short crop of soybeans created strong domestic and foreign demand today, and soybean futures advanced the permissible limit of 20 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Shanker Assails Mrs. Abzug
description: KIAMESHA LAKE. N. Y., Sept. 2Albert Shanker, president of the American Federation of Teachers, today assailed Representative Bella S. Abzug as a scab who had crossed teacher picket lines and taught classes during the 1968 school strike in New York City.

title: Phillies Sign Allen To a 1976 Contract
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 2 (AP)Dick Allen, the Philadelphia Phillies' often controversial first baseman, signed his 1976 contract today. The terms were not disclosed.

title: A Token for CUNY
description: For the time being the Legislature has prevented closing of entire campuses of the City University as a response to budgetary crisis. But as the state moves toward increasing responsibility for financing collegiate education within the five boroughs, pressure will unquestionably resume to reduce the number of senior colleges from the present total of nine.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Dr. Luther A. Weigle Dies
description: The Rev. Dr. Luther A. Weigle, dean emeritus of the Yale Divinity School and the man who directed the writing of the Revised Standard Version of the Bible, died yesterday at the YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 95 years old.

title: A.M.C. Prices Up 5.4% On 10 of 1977 Models
description: DETROIT, Sept. 2The American Motors Corporation has announced a tentative average 5.4 percent price increase on 10 of its 1977 models. The increases range from $150 to $922.

title: Mexicans Resume Heroin Campaign With American Aid
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept, 2The United States and Mexico have resumed their joint campaign to eradicate thousands of opium poppy plantations in the hope of sharply reducing the flow of Mexican heroin into the United States.

title: Sea Containers Ending Israeli Shipping Venture
description: Sea Containers Inc., said yesterday that it was terminating a previously announced joint venture with the IsraeliAmerican Maritime Fruit Carriers shipping line because it did not want to provoke ill feeling in Middle Eastern areas where it has extensive Arab port operations.

title: A World Festival of Chamber Music
description: The underlying concept of the first International Chamber Music Festival, which will be held this weekend and next. in Stockbridge, Mass., has implications, political as well as musical. Like international politics, chamber music relies primarily on mutual understanding, cooperation and agreement among its participants in order to achieve fruitful results. What better way to symbolize an ongoing dialo??ue among nations than by inviting chamber groups of various countries to join in an annual festival?

title: New Luster for An Old Team
description: For the next four Sundays patrons of the Carnegie Hall Cinema will witness a twin challenge to the Law of Gravity and the laws of time. Gravity loses; no question about it. As for time, it is probably a standoff.

title: Scholar Eases Criticism Of Study of White Flight
description: Reynolds Farley, a University of Michigan demographer who has criticized studies linking school desegregation to the flight of whites from the cities, says that new research is leading him to the conclusion that such a relationship does exist in large cities.

title: Sarah Vaughan Meets the Herd
description: Two of jazz's most durable stars, Sarah Vaughan and Woody Herman, will be making their first appearance together in this area over the weekend at the Westbury Music Fair on Long Island.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK; MANHATTAN; BRONX; BROOKLYN; QUEENS; QUEENS (Cont'd); STATEN ISLAND; LONG ISLAND; LONG ISLAND (Cont'd); WESTCHESTER; FAIRFIELD
description: Specials

title: SALES IN AUGUST AT RETAIL CHAINS REPORTED MIXED
description: Consumer buying across the country in August showed mixed results compared with the same month last year and generally failed to improve over July's sluggish pace.

title: How to Enjoy The Golden Age Of Grease How to Enjoy Golden Age of Grease
description: AFIFTEENYEAR OLD I know asked me recently what high school was like in your day, meaning five years ago. My first reaction was shockthat in so little time I'd managed to cross the lines, to have had a day and to be done with having it, to have known an era so different from the present one that it called for explanation, But history has, after all, gone into something of a compression chamber, to the point where the space of time separating one generation from the next is about equal to the number of months. separating one Elton John release from another.

title: Management
description: A few years ago, Russell B. Long, the influential Democratic Senator from Louisiana, became convinced that employee stock ownership plans represented the best way of giving workers a stake in their company. Since then, through his position as chairman of the Senate Finance Committee, Senator Long has been influential in winning legislative encouragement for the plans.

title: COURT GRANTS DELAY FOR POTATO TRADERS
description: The traders who defaulted on Maine potato contracts covering 50 million pounds of the commodity last May were granted a Federal court order yesterday that temporarily prevents them from paying the $980,000 due to the buyers.

title: Whatanut Ties Mark
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Sept. 2 (AP)  Whatanut, driven by Bill Popfinger, tied the world mile record for 2yearold pacing fillies. 1:57 15, today in Grand Circuit racing at the Du Quoin State Fairgrounds. She paid $36.80 for a $2 bet.

title: Books of The Times
description: I THINK IT'S TIME to protest the humorless and specious complexity of suspense novels such as The Kobra Manifesto by Adam Hall.
