While WOR/Channel 9 provides Thames Television with a MondaythroughFriday showcase for its better productions, the New York metropolitan area is being afforded an invaluable glimpse of what can be found in Britain, at least occasionally, on the single commercial channel that competes with the British Broadcasting Corporation.

title: Colombia Hit by Quake
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Sept. 7 (Reuters) An earth tremor with a force of 4 on the 12paint Mercalli scale today struck southern Colombia near the border with Ecuador, the Andean Geophysics Institute said. No damage or casualties were reported.

title: Viking Biology Equipment Is Functioning Normally After Activation and Tests
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 7 (UPI)Viking 2's vital biology instruments have passed their first test and appeared ready today to begin man's second attempt to search for life on Mars Saturday.

title: L.I. Workers Cite G.O.P. Kickbacks
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Sept. 7Nine Government witnesses testified today that it was common practice to contribute 1 percent of their salaries to the Town of Hempstead Republican Finance Committee, but ell of them denied that they had been coerced into doing so

title: Sketches of African Leaders Who Conferred in Tanzania
description: Kaunda

title: Suspect in the Kidnapping Of L.I. Business Executive Is Arrested in California
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 7A California man has been arrested for allegedly kidnapping a wealthy Kings Point, L.I., business executive 22 months ago and releasing him unharmed after the payment of a $750,000 ransom.

title: Nastase Wins FiveSet Battle; Hostile Fans Disrupt Play
description: Ilie Nastase attracted a full moon and a full house last night for his match with Roscoe Tanner in the United States Open tennis championships. Despite many of the 14,418 spectators doing their best to get the fiery Rumanian angry, Nastase restrained himself en route to a thrilling 75, 67, 16, 76, 64 victory over the lefthanded blaster from Tennessee.

title: Business Increases Plans For NewPlant Investments
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7United States business has revised upward its plans to invest in new plant and equipment for the final quarter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Lester S. LaPierre, 85; Architect Had Designed Large Country Homes
description: Lester S. LaPierre, a retired architect, died Sunday at his home in Sea Cliff, L.I. He was 85 years old.

title: Leslie Report Sends Soybeans and Corn Upon Chicago Board
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 7 (AP) After an estimate by a private crop analyst that there would be less corn and soybeans produced this year than the Government had forecast, several commodity futures advanced the permissible daily limit on the Chicago Board of Trade today.

title: King Is Sentenced to One Year For Defrauding I.O.S. Holders
description: John McCandish King, former chairman and chief executive officer of the King Resources Company of Denver, was sentenced yesterday to one year in prison after being convicted on fraud and conspiracy charges.

title: Canada Downs Sweden, 4 to 0
description: TORONTO, Sept. 7  Bob Gainey, playing in his first Canada Cup hockey game, scored two goals tonight as Team Canada defeated Team Sweden, 40. The Canadians had to overcome a ragged start performance in heating the inconsistent Swedes and, particularly in the opening period, relied heavily on the sturdy goaltending of Rogie Vachon, who stopped 28 shots.

title: About Education
description: Despite the availability of billions of dollars of aid for college students, many potential recipients may not be getting their maximum benefits because they lack the knowhow to cope with the system.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 35yearold Howell Township man was charged yesterday with last week's rape and murder of Virginia Duerkes, 20 years old, the police said. William H. Matthews of the Farmingdale section of the township, was taken in for questioning at about 2:30 P.M. He was charged with the crimes last night, the police said. Mr. Matthews was being held without bail at the Monmouth County Jail in Freehold, a police spokesman said. The body of Miss Duerkes, who was engaged to be married next month, was found in he?? home in Howell Township. Authorities said she had been stabbed several times in the chest.

title: Bridge:
description: It is widely believed that, there are no modest bridge playersat any rate in the higher echelons of the tournament world. If there is such a player, he has so far failed to come forward and claim the honor.

title: About New York
description: Can you tell if an extra sardine comes into a can?

title: BADILLO AND VELEZ AGREE TO HOLD DEBATE MONDAY
description: The two contenders in the heated race for the Democratic nomination from the 21st Congressional District, which takes in the South Bronx, Representative Herman Badillo and Councilman Ramon S. Velez, have agreed to appear in a debate on Monday, the day before the primary.

title: FORD HOPES TO GAIN FROM G.M.'S DECISION TO REDUCE MODELS
description: DETROIT, Sept.7 The Ford Motor Company today introduced a 1977 model lineup that is essentially the same size and weight as last year's because, the company said, there is still a market for big cars as they have been built.

title: Leonard Koppett
description: As a new football season begins, a few moments of reflection on how some American philosophic attitudes are both shaped and reflected by this entertainment might be appropriate.

title: BONDS DRIFT BACK, LOSING EARLY GAINS
description: The credit markets advanced yesterday morning but then faltered, prices slipping back and closing little changed iron their levels last Friday. The downward drift in prices in the afternoon resulted from disappointment that the Federal Reserve permitted the Federal eral funds ratethe basic shortterm interest rate in the money marketto rise as high as 58 percent without acting. Prices of fixedincome securities opened higher yesterday than they closed Friday as many moneymarket economists made favorable comments in their weekly newsletters. The markets were closed Monday for the Labor Day holiday.

title: Those Proliferating Cooking Schools: A Selection of the Best
description: Andre's Mediterranean Cooking School, 301 East 66th Street, 2496619. Instructor: Andree Abramoff. Cost: $75 for five sessions. Starting date: Sept. 15; mornings and evenings. Type: Limited participation. Description: Emphasis is on interesting MiddleEastern dishes with some Provencal and Spanish cliches. Participation is limited in dining area; much cooking goes on off stage. Some dishes were good, others only fair.

title: Comeback by Smith Is Incomplete
description: The moment of truth came at the beginning of the third set. Stanley Roger Smith, the matador of championships past, had taken the first two sets from Manuel Orantes, and the Spaniard had all but conceded the ears and the tail.

title: M. TROY JONES
description: M. Troy Jones, who retired last year as chief executive officer of Northern Oil Company of Paoli, Pa., died Friday in his home in Paoli after a short illness. He was 68 years old.

title: 5 LAWYERS INDICTED IN SELLING OF BABIES
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Sept. 7A Bergen County grand jury indicted lawyers in New York, Illinois and Michigan today on charges of conspiring with a New Jersey lawyer to sell babies for as much as $8,000 to childless New Jersey couples.

title: Communists Receive Third Place on Ballot
description: ALBANY, Sept. 7 (UPI) The Communist Party filed petitions with the State Board of Elections today to put candidates for President, Vice President and United states Senator on the statewide ballot in November.

title: HARVEY H. OLSON
description: WETHERSFIELD, Conn., Sept. 7 (AP) Harvey H. Olson, a longtime Hartfordarea broadcaster and news official, died at home yesterday. He was 64 years old.

title: From Captain's Galley, Some More of His Dishes
description: Fish Stock

title: PEYSER ASKS U.S. AID TO COT CRIME IN CITY
description: Representative Peter A. Peyser charged yesterday that violent crime was out of control in New York City and asked that President Ford provide emergency funds to put more publicsafety officers on the streets now to slow down and eventually stop these terrible and sickening attacks on our people

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON. Sept. 7The Council of Churches of New Jersey said today that a drive by a coalition of organizations to keep casino gambling out of the state would begin Monday.

title: Too Much Too Soon
description: WASHINGTONAs America's children return to school, many conscientious parents are genuinely uncertain whether they may be delivering their children into enemy territory.

title: Little Rock School Now Integration Model
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Sept. 4In the late 1950's, Central High School became the world's most notorious public school. Segregationists pointed daily to the strife there to prove that white and black students in the South could not go to school together in peace.

title: U.S. Public Health Service Repott Says the Agency's First Priority Is Controlling Escalating Medical Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 7The United States Public Health Service issued its fiveyear plan for health today and named as its first priority, controlling escalating health costs.

title: Gold Price Off in Europe On Wave of Prof it Taking; Dollar Is Mostly Steady
description: LONDON, Sept. 7 (AP) The price of gold fell on major European bullion markets today in a wave of profit taking after yesterday's sharp rise, but it remained well above Friday's levels. The United States dollar held steady in most foreign exchanges.

title: CORRECTION
description: In an article in The Times on Saturday, the chef at the Hammond Museum, Lynne Bierer, was inadvertently, referred to as he.

title: CHARLES M'HARRY, 62, COLUMNIST FOR NEWS
description: Charles McHarry, a columnist for the New York Daily News, died yesterday at New York Hospital. He was 62 years old and lived in Peter Cooper Village.

title: The Use of Basic Research
description: BOSTON  Some years ago, Prof. Bruce Ames, a University of California molecular biologist, noticed a list of chemical preservatives on a bag of potato chips that his young son had asked him to open. His concern about the possible health hazards of the chemicals led to what proved to be a futile search for relevant information.

title: U.S. Notifies Japan It Will Grant Asylum to Defecting Soviet Pilot
description: TOKYO, Sept. 7The United States notified Japan today that it would grant political asylum to the pilot of the Soviet MIG25 jet fighter that landed in Japan yesterday.

title: Voister Briefs Cabinet on Talks
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 7  Prime Minister John Vorster returned to South Africa today and immediately briefed his Cabinet on the outcome of his weekend talks in Zurich with Secretary Kissinger.

title: Milan's La Scala Makes U. S. Debut
description: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Sept. 8 Milan's renowned La Scala Opera made ifs historic debut in America here last night before an audience that was both glittering and demanding.

title: People in Sports
description: The Detroit Pistons have called a news conference for today to announce the signing of Leon Douglas, their No. 1 draft choice. The 6foot9inch, 230pound Douglas was given a reported fouryear, nocut $500,000 contract. Douglas averaged 21 points and almost 13 rebounds a game last season for the University of Alabama. The Pistons, who have several unsigned players, are still negotiating with Marvin Barnes, their first choice in the American Basketball Association dispersal draft. Barnes has expressed displeasure with the Spirit of St. Louis' contract the Pistons have inherited. He wants more of his money up front.

title: Marchibroda Returns, Placated, to the Colts
description: Ted Marchibroda was rehired as head coach yesterday by the Baltimore Colts, thus concluding as bizarre an episode as one can imagine involving a coach, a general manager and a team owner. The quiet, moderate 45yearold Marchibroda, voted the National Football League's coach of the year last season, had quit twice, once last Thursday night in Pontiac, Mich., and again on Sunday aboard the owner's yacht, which happened to be in Milwaukee. His formal resignation was accepted the second time.

title: LAYOFFS TO AFFECT HOMEBOUND PUPILS
description: Fifteen hundred handicapped children who are taught in their homes will have the time they spend with teachers cut in half this year as a result of a New York City Board of Education action eliminating 60 percent of the teaching jobs in education of the homebound.

title: To Our Readers
description: The Business/Financial section of The Times begins today an expanded news report, including various new features, as well as a consolidated display of New York Stock Exchange and other tables.

title: New York Lottery Proves an Instant Success in Debut
description: The new New York State instant lottery opened yesterday with long lines of buyers mobbing newsstands, supermarket counters and candy stores throughout the state.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: New Tool Developed To Measure Uranium
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Government scientists have developed new nuclear device that can be used to detect and measure uranium in a drill hole, the United States Geological Survey said today.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 9, 1976

title: U.S. Installs Harpoon Missile
description: NORFOLK, Va., Sept. 8 (UPI)The Navy says its first new shiptoship Harpoon missile has been installed on the Ainsworth, an escort ship based here. A Navy spokesman said the longawaited missile aboard the Ainsworth is the first to be permanently installed, after testing on other Navy vessels. The Harpoon was designed to match the power of the Soviet antiship missile Styz, one of which, fired from an Egyptian vessel, sank an Israeli destroyer in 1967.

title: City U. Enrollment Declines 17% As FreeTuition Policy Is Ended
description: The City University will begin its first academic year as a tuitioncharging institution today with an estimated 32,294 fewer students than last year, a drop of 17 percent.

title: Sutton Gives His Backing To Mrs. Chisholm in Race With Wright in Brooklyn
description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan, who said he was forced to decide between two valued friends, yesterday endorsed Representativ Shirley Chisholm for reelection in Brooklyn's 12th Congressional District.

title: The Standings
description: Thursday, September 9, 1976

title: 65 of West Point's Cadets Swear Top Students and Athletes Cheat
description: WASHINGTON, Sept: 8Sworn statements by 65 cadets accused of cheating at the United States Military Academy at West Point assert that nearly 700 of their colleagues, including highranking students and captains of athletic teams, engaged in such practices as cheating in academic courses, lying to officers and even fixing student honor boards to obtain notguilty verdicts.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: IRISH Brendan Behan's The Hostage has been tackled before in New York since it was first produced in London 18 years ago. The results have been somewhat uneven. The New York Times drama critic, Clive Barnes, said in 1972 that the City Center Acting Company's choice of repertory was courageous, and in presenting The Hostage he said that the courage savored of foolhardy.

title: People and Business
description: The tricentennial is fast upon us, at least at the Treasury Department where Secretary William E. Simon dedicated a time capsule yesterday to be opened 100 years from now.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Byrne signed a bill yesterday repealing New Jersey's new state income tax as of June 30, 1978, but he it anted that the Legislature would have to reenact the tax or some other major tax.

title: Companies List Sales and Earnings
Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: HELMS CALLS FOR KISSINGER TO BACK PLATFORM OR QUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Renewing his criticism of Secretary of State Kissinger, Senator Jesse Helms said today that Mr. Kissingef should either embrace the Republican Party platform..or resign immediately.,

title: 4 Jerseyans Charged With a Plot To Murder Man Because of Fight
description: TOMS RIVER, N. J., Aug. 8 (AP)Four men were held in Ocean County Jail on $25,000 bail each today on charges of conspiring to murder a Spring Lake Heights man, the police said. The four were arrested last night in Point Pleasant.

title: The Defense Issue
description: President Ford's attack on the voices of retreat that urge the United States to reduce defense spending and to withdraw American troops from overseas appears to be an attempt to pin an antidefense label cn Jimmy Cartera label that is not justified by the Democratic candidate's stated positions. But Mr. Ford's evident belief that he could force the issue into such blackandwhite terms may explain his early emphasis on defense and his earlier, unsuccessful proposal that national security affairs be the first subject for the projected FordCarter debates.

title: Selling of U.S. Registration Cards To Illegal Aliens Is Charged to
description: NEWARK. Sept. 8 (UPI)A clerk for the Immigration and Naturalization Service and a former interpreter have been indicted on charges of selling phony alien registration cards to illegal aliens.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Planners Ask Better Amenities for Plazas In Deals Made With Apartment Builders
description: The City Planning Commission yesterday proposed a set of zoning rules intended to improve the quality of public plazas built alongside highrise apartment buildings.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Sept 8 (Reuters)Ecuador threatened today to confiscate the Gulf Oil Company's assets here unless the company paid its debts to the Government.

title: A. U.N. Group Stresses Links Between Israel and South Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 8A United Nations committee approved a report today attesting to the evercloser collaboration between Israel and South Africa.

title: 4 Sports, Dropped in Budget Cut, Restored to P.S.A.L.'s Program
description: Four varsity sports that were dropped from the city's Public Schools Athletic League boys program last year because of budget cuts have been reinstated for the 197677 school year.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8Governor Byrne announced today that a basic restructuring of the Division of Youth and Family Services was under way as a result of an interim report by a special task force looking into charges of waste, mismanagement and possible fraud in the operation of the division and in the statefinanced daycare centers.

title: The New York Times/Nal Boonil INSTANT LOTTERY TICKETS GO ON SALE: Ticket buyers in Midtown watching as one rubs a ticket to see if she has a winner. Page 43.
description: The new New York State instant lottery opened yesterday with long lines of buyers mobbing newsstands, supermarket counters and candy stores throughout the state.

title: Creavy Posts 71 to Lead State Senior Golf by Shot
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Sept. (AP)Jack Creavy, 61 years old, of Eastchester took the firstround lead today in the New York State senior men's golf championship at the McGregor Country Club with a oneunderpar 71. The former state amateur champion, who was second in last year's event, toured the testing 7,001yard layout in 36, 35 while getting eight birdies.

title: ROBERT E. MARTIN
description: Robert E. Martin, former passenger traffic manager for United States Lines, died Sunday at Valley Hospital, Ridgewood, N.J. He was 67 years old and a resident of Ridgewood.

title: 17 Die in Polish Mine Explosion
description: WARSAW, Sept. 8 (Reuters)At least 17 miners were killed and more than 30, injured last night when an explosion ripped a shaft in a coal pit in Walbrzych, in, the west, the Polish press agency reported today, Seventy other miners were rescued and one is missing.

title: Rev. Moon's Church Will Purchase Manhattan Center
description: The Unification Church, founded and headed by the Rev. Sun Myung Moon, yesterday announced the signing of an agreement to purchase the 70yearold Manhattan Center, at 311 West 34th Street, just west of Eighth Avenue, for more than $2 million.

title: Dutch Woman Wins Cycling
description: MONTERONI DI LECCE, Italy, Sept. 8 (UPI)Kornelia Van OoostenHage of the Netherlands retained the women's world pursuitcycling title today by defeating Luigina Bissoli of Italy. Miss Van OostenHage completed the course in 3 minutes 58.92 seconds, Miss Bissoli was second in 4:04.57. Nicole Van Broeck of Belgium was third with time of 4:11.11, defeating last year's runnerup, Mary Jane Reoch of Philadelphia.

title: Egyptian Art Glitters in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 Despite the fabled curse of King Tut's tomb, everything went smoothly today at a news conference held by the National Gallery of Art and preview of the Treasures of Tutankhamen exhibition sent here by the Egyptian Government.

title: U.S. Forms Drop Loyalty Queries
description: Tne United. States Civil Service Commission has ordered elimination of all political loyalty questions on the standard application for Federal jobs, including whether a job seeker has belonged to the Communist Party or any group advocating forcible overthrow of the Government.

title: EXAIDE OF OIL INDUSTRY AND WIFE DIE IN GARAGE
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 (UPI)Felix Chappellet, former vice president of the Western Oil and Gas Association, and his wife, were found dead in their garage yesterday. The engines of two automobiles had been permitted to fill the garage with carbon monoxide.

title: COLEMAN SETS PLAN FOR OPPOSING BRITAIN ON AIRLINE TRAFFIC
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The Ford Administration announced a new international air transportation policy today and said that a major aspect of it was to oppose unilateral British plans to restrict competition on routes between Britain and the United States.

title: Beame and Goldin Disclose a FailSafe System to End Hidden Deficits
description: Mayor Hearne and Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin unveiled plans yesterday for a new city agency and an elaborate failsafe mechanism to eliminate the possibility of hidden deficits in future municipal budgets.

title: ADELPHI'S TEACHERS MK OUT OVER PACT
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Sept. 8The faculty. of Adelphi University went on strike this morning after five months of negotiations failed to achieve a new contract.

title: Stronger U. S. Law on Arab Boycott, Backed at New York Senate Hearing;
description: An amendment to a Federal export law that would add teeth to prohibitions against compliance with the Arab boycott was supported in New York City yesterday by witnesses appearing before a State Senate subcommittee hearing on human rights.

title: Despite Era of Detente, Moscow Builds Up Its Military Capability
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8One of the more persistent questions raised about Soviet foreign policy is why the Soviet Union has built up its military strength while pledging its commitment to detente with the West.

title: Bridge: Selection of a FourFour Fit Can Be Problem in Bidding
description: One of the most difficult areas in bidding is the selection of a fourthree fitso difficult that inexperienced players would be welladvised to steer clear of such contracts altogether.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Associated Press

title: FORD TO RAISE PRICE OF ITS NEW MODELS
description: DEARBORN, Mich., Sept. 8The Ford Motor Company plans to raise prices on its 1977 models by almost, but not quite, as much as the General Motors Corporation's 5.9 percent increase, Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the company, said today.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: The Now York Times/Noel koontl

title: Chess: With Bishops of Opposite Colors, Watch Where You Put the Pawns
description: In bishops  of  opposite  color positions, where do you place your pawns? On the samecolor squares as your own bishop, or on the samecolor squares as your opponent's?

title: Accused Jersey Physician Denies Causing Hepatitis in His Patients
description: PINE HILL, Sept. 8Dr. Peter T. DeMarco denied today that syringes he had used in treating patients had caused hepatitis.

title: 3 Rural
description: The Rainbow Grill, in a departure from its customary booking policies, is making its first exploration of country music during the next three weeks. It is a rather parochial effort because the five groups involved in the Country Over Manhattan engagement have been recruited from O'Lunney's, the Second Avenue countrymusic club, and all are New York bred or based.

title: FORD SAYS REMARKS BY RIVAL ON KELLEY ARE CONTRADICTORY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8President Ford described Jimmy Carter today as both callous and indecisive in making contradictory public appraisals of Clarence M. Kelley, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: 70 U.S. PRISONERS ARE SAID TO END MEXICAN JAIL FAST
description: MEXICO CITY, Sept. 8 (AP)  More than 70 Americans in Mexican jails ended a hunger strike today after 36 hours and thanked the Mexican government for making proposals that could free hundreds of them before the end of the year, the Interior Ministry announced.

title: MARC F. WEIL
description: Marc F. Weil, former president of the Patrician Paper Company in Glens Falls, N.Y., died last night at Beth Israel Hospital after a brief illness. He was 65 years old and lived in New York City.

title: A Kentucky Man Kills His Wife And Three Sons, Then Himself
description: STEPHENSON, Mich., Sept. 8 (UPI)A Kentucky man killed his wife and three sons and then took his own life today by shooting himself during a high speed chase, the state police said.

title: Bache in Boston Expansion Move
description: Bache Halsey Stuart, the brokera'gr firth, said yesterday that It had formed new technology research group in Bostor in a step to expand its institutional re search capability.

title: A Bad Nomination
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee is considering the nomination of Federal District Judge Harry W. WeIlford to the Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit. The nomination has raised much opposition, as well it should. Judge WeIlford has been on the bench since 1971, and his record raises serious questions about his fitness for higher judicial office.

title: Dorothy D. Balding Wed To William C. Jackson Jr.
description: Dorothy Davis Balding of Upper Brookville, LI., and Aiken, S.C., was married yesterday morning to William Ccmgreve Jackson Jr. of Aiken, where the bridegroom heads his own petrolelm distribution company. The Rev. John Hascup performed the ceremony in the Upper Brookville Reformed Thurch.

title: AN UNSIGNED CONFESSION CITED IN BRONFMAN CASE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Sept. S (UPI)  A suspect in the 1975 kidnapping of Sam uel Bronfman 2d confessed to the crime and dictated a 16page statement but then refused to sign it, a Federal Bureau of Invpstirtation aeent testified today.

title: B'nai B'rith Panel Rejects a Proposal for State Aid to Religious Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8A proposal that B'nai B'rith support state aid to religionsponsored schools for services and activities that are wholly secular in nature prompted spirited debate, but was rejected in committee here today at the B'nai B'rith biennial convention at the Washington Hilton Hotel.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Allen Rates. Giants'
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N.Y., Sept. 8The Giants beat the Redskins! The Giants beat the Redskins!

title: VORSTER SAID TO BACK U.S.BRITISH PROPOSAL ON RHODESIA ACCORD
description: LONDON, Sept. 8Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa has agreed to a United StatesBritish plan to provide financial guarantees of perhaps $1.5 bitlion to $2 billion for whites living in Rhodesia, according to diplomatic sources.

title: Rome Mayor, Reds
description: ROME, Sept. 8 (AP)Ugo Cardinal Poletti, the Pope's vicar in Rome, celebrated mass today in the presence of Mayor Carlo Giulio Argan, an independent allied with the Communist Party.

title: VORSTER SAID TO BACK U.S.BRITISH PROPOSAL ON RHODESIA ACCORD
description: LONDON, Sept. 8Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa has agreed to a United StatesBritish plan to proyide financial guarantees of perhaps $1.5 billion to $2 billion for whites living. din Rhodesia. according to diplomatic sources.

title: Antitrust Bill Voted By the Senate Allows State Damage Suits
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)A major antitrust bill that would empower states to obtain triple damages against businesses convicted of price fixing schemes was passed by the Senate today.

title: Critic of Attica Conditions Ousted Because of His Independent Way
description: Scott Christianson, chief of a State Commission of Correction teamwho reported in July that conditions at Attica Prison were just as bad, perhaps worse than before the bloody inmate =rebellion that began five years ago todayhas been dismissed.

title: $600,000 Theft at Italian Museum
description: SULMONA, Italy, Sept. 8 (UPI)Burglars broke into the Sulmona Civic Museum today and stole ancient gold objects and manuscripts worth an estimated $600,000, the police said.

title: Canadian Fishing Boat Seized
description: SEATTLE, Sept. 8 (UPI)A Coast Guard cutter seized the 36foot Canadian fishing vessel Retirement early this morning in the Strait of Georgia and accompanied it to Bellingham. A spokesman for the Coast Guard said the Canadian vessel was violating territorial fishing laws by its presence one mile inside United States territorial waters and five miles west of Point Roberts. The vessel had 30 salmon on deck and another six in its nets.

title: Rhodesia Says Black Guerrillas Killed a Bedridden White Woman
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept. 8 (AP)The Government said today that black nationalist guerrillas striking from neighboring Botswana killed a bedridden white woman yesterday near Plumtree.

title: Contractor Who Seeks $194,596 Pickets the TavernontheGreen
description: the major contractor ror tne newly reopened TavernontheGreen led group of pickets in front of the fashionable restaurant yesterday, protesting what he called the failure of the proprietor to pay for $194,596 worth of work done on the building.

title: U.S. Assumes That Iranian Agents Maintain Watch on Students Here
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (Reuters)A high State Department official said today that he assumed that Iranian security agents were keeping watch on Iranian students in the United States to guard against potential terrorists.

title: Mexico Begins Exports Offensive With Biggest Fair in San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, Sept. 8A week after effectively devaluing its currency by almost 40. percent, Mexico has begun an offensive to increase its exports to the United States by holding its largestever trade fair in this southwestern American city.

title: Belmont Racing
description: C 1976, by Triangle Publications, Ine. (The Daily Racing Form)

title: ON A SENTIMENTAL JOURNEY: Jack Kamerman, left, 76, of the Bronx, and Maxwell Temkin, 75, of Jersey City; on their way to Ellis Island, through which they were processed when they immigrated to the United States
description: The New York Times/William k. Sillro many years ago. In the background is one of the first landmarks they sighted on arriving, the Statue of Liberty. Both men are members of a group of Zionists who were holding their annual convention in city yesterday.

title: EXLOBBYIST RECANTS ON 1970 GIFT TO DOLE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. SA former Gull Jil Corporation lobbyist, Claude C. Wild Jr., said today that he was confident he had been in error when he said that in 1970 he gave $2,000 to Senator Robert J. Dole, now the Republican VicePresidential nominee.

title: Personal Finance
description: The Veterans Administration, in an effort to stimulate more loans for mobile homes, has increased the amount of such loans it will guarantee to 50 percent from the former level of 30 percent.

title: For the Colonel, It Was FingerLickin
description: A small boy, seated at a table in Kentucky Fried Chicken store in Greenwich Village paled and almost dropped the extracrispy drumstick he was about to bite into yesterday as he looked up and saw none other than the Kentucky Colonel himself, Harland Sanders, every inch his television image with flowing white hair, trim goatee and blazing white suit.

title: NEW YORK 1 OF 3 STATES WITH DROP IN TOTAL JOBS!
description: New York is one of only three statesalong with Florida and Montanathat lost jobs, during the year ended last June, according to Bureau of Labor Statistics reports yesterday. The 47 others showed gains.

title: Gulf Lobbyist Said to Have Aided Many Congress Drives in 15 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Claude C. Wild Jr., according to a witness who testified in a suit against him, once told Watergate prosecutors that all of the Senators on the Watergate Committee except for Sam Ervin had taken money from Gulf.

title: Cuba Honors Laotian Premier
description: HAVANA, Sept. 8 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Kaysone Phoumvihasi of Laos tonight received the Jose Marti Order, Cuba's highek award. Mr. Kaysone Phoumvihan flew here earlier today from Moscow for a weeklong visit, the first to Cuba by a Laotian Government leader.

title: IMPERIAL CHEMICAL ADMITS TO PAYING QUESTIONABLE FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Imperial Chemical Industries, Britain's secondlargest company after the British Petroleum Company, has admitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission it had made S2.4 million in questionable payments since 1972, according to a document filed here late last week and made available by a commission official today. None was made in the United States.

title: Ara Fitzgerald Presents Intriguing Dance Works At American Theater Lab
description: Ara Fitzgerald's dances are quick sketches with the advantage of snapshot observation but without any deep elaboration. Miss Fitzgerald tantalizes the eye by drawing some startling props and gestures together and then passes on to another intriguing situation. Assisted by Kathy Kramer and Joan Durkee, she presented a program of works Tuesday evening at the American Theater Laboratory.

title: Market Place
description: Some investors in preferred stocks have been puzzled by the fact that $25 par value issues yield about a quarter of a percentage point less than more traditional $100 preferreds issued by the same company.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Board Must Rehire Pregnant Teacher

title: Zabilski Named Director
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Joseph P. Zabilski, a member of Northeastern's athletic staff for 29 years, was named today as athletic director of the university. Zabilski, 59 years old, joined Northeastern as head football and basketball coach and assistant track coach in 1948. He was relieved of the basketball and track duties in 1958 to become assistant athletic director.

title: South Africa Gets ProRegime Paper
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 8Interests close to the South African Government launched an Englishlanguage newspaper here yesterday, posing a strong threat, to the usually antiGovernment Rand Daily Mail.

title: Washington and Business
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  A new Bureau of Labor Statistics series premises to give economists and business managers more specific information about labor costs in the American economy than have been available so far from other bureau reports.

title: Soviet Says U.S. in Africa Tries to Save Status Quo And Economic Interests
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8 (AP)The Soviet press agency Tass charged today that United States intervention in Africa's problems was an attempt to preserve the status quo and protect growing economic interests in the area.

title: 65 of West Point's Cadets Swear Top Students and Athletes Cheat
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Sworn statements by 65 cadets accused of cheating at the United States Military Academy at West Point assert that nearly 700 of their colleagues, Including highranking students and captains of athletic teams, engaged in such practices as cheating in academic courses, lying to officers and even fixing student honor boards to obtain notguilty verdicts.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Congressional investigators accused Government officiali today of lying ano intimidating witnesses who were questioned in a House subcommittee inquiry construction irregularities on the Alaska oil pipeline.

title: POLICE TO REINFORCE PATROL AT MIDNIGHT
description: New York City sPolice Department will substantially increase the number of officers assigned to midnightto8 A.M. patrol duty under in work schedules to go into effect soon.

title: Goodwin Resagnation Held Style Result
description: The johnsManville Corporation, whose president resigned suddenly last Friday, issued a statement yesterday saying that its differences with W. R. Goodwin were over style rather than substance.

title: House Adds. Tougher CleanAir Standards To Bill Designed to Strengthen 1.970 Law
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)  New standards to protect the quality of the air in, areas where it is clean:now were tentatively approved today by the House.

title: While a Curtain Waves in the Wind on Coast
description: BLOOMFIELD, Calif., Sept. (AP) Like a shimmering white vel'et snake, the 24milelong curtain of the artist Christ() Javacheff began winding its way across the northern California countryside to the sea today.

title: Sorg Printing Company To Stay in City but Shift Operations to a New Site
description: The Sorg printing Company, a large financial and corporate printer, has decided to remain in New York City and consolidate. its operation in a single new site in lower Manhattan.

title: ADELPHI'S TEACHERS WALK OUT OVER PACT
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Sept. 8The faculty of Ade1phi University went on strike this morning after five months of negotiations failed to achieve a new contract.

title: Dissident French Bishop Restates His Defiance of Pope on Doctrine
description: FANJEAUX, France, Sept. 8 (AP)Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre reiterated his defiance of Pope Paul VI today at a ceremony at a convent of dissident traditionalist nuns.

title: Oscar M. Taylor, ExBell System Executive And Dewey's Civil Service Chief, Dies at 86
description: Oscar M. Taylor, former president of New York State's Civil Service Commission and former executive vice president of the New York Telephone Company, died Sunday at his home in Burlingame, Calif. He was 86 years old.

title: Paris Opera's Debut in U.S. Offers Unplanned Drama
description: The Paris Opera made its American debut last night at the Metropolitan Opera House before an audience as large as New York's entire population in 1669, when the French opera company was created and New York was only a small, young, English colony.

title: 2 Children Killed as Train Hits School Bus in Oregon
description: LAFAYETTE, Ore., Sept. 8 (AP)A Southern Pacific engine and caboose struck a school bus carrying 50 persons today on the second day of school. The state police said that at least two persons were killed and many were injured.

title: Police in New York Will Reinforce Midnight Patrol and Cut Days Off
description: New York City's Police Department will substantially increase the number of officers assigned to midnightto8 A.M. patrol duty under work schedules to go into effect soon.

title: Universal Atlas Sets Upstate Plant Closing
description: The Universal Atlas Cement Company said that it was preparing to close its Hudson, N.Y., plant because of difficult problems that have made the plant noncompetitive. Some workerd will be laid off. The Company is division of the United Stated Steel Cornoration.

title: Hoover EstateTax Issue Raises New Question on the Use of F.B.I. Files
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8No Federal estate tax was paid on a collection of memorandums and correspondence belonging to J. Edgar Hoover, the late Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation ,that has been characterized by Mr. Hoover's longtime secretary as his personal property, a House subcommittee has learned.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 9, 1976

title: Doctor Denies Causing Hepatitis; Calls His New Drug Spectacular
description: PINE HILL, Sept. 8Dr. Peter T. DeMarco denied today that syringes he had used in treating patients had caused hepatitis.

title: DoubleDecker Buses Force Some Changes
description: The city's eight brand new doubledecker buses are proving to be a tight fit. They are too tail for some of the traffic lights, wires, lamp posts and old tree limbs along their new routes.

title: Naturopathic Physicians Are Taking Court Action To Soften Curbs on Them
description: medical practitioners in other disciplines.

title: BYRNE SIGNS REPEAL OF INCOME TAX IN 78
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8Governor Byrne signed a bill today repealing the state income tax as of June 30, 1978, but he warned that the Legislature would have to reenact it or some other major tax.

title: Ford Proclaims Forest Week
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)President Ford; citing the nation's long reliance on its forest resources, today designated the week beginning Oct. 17 as National Forest Products Week.

title: Mets Rout Cubs, 115, and Sweep Series
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8Manager Joe Frazier of the Mets said he was hoping that his team would have a big enough lead today so that he would be able to use Lee Mazzilli, the outfield prospect from Brooklyn.

title: At P Minus 6, Democratic Hopefuls For the Senate Step Up Campaigns
description: After debating all morning, the five Democratic candidates for the United States Senate nomination quickly dispersed yesterday to various corners of the city and state to pursue active campaign schedules with six days to go before the Sept. 14 primary.

title: Tennessee Post to Ranson
description: KNOXVILLE, Sept. 8 (AP)Rolland Ranson, an assistant track coach at, Central Michigan, was named today to succeed Ron Richardson as an assistant coach at the University of Tennessee. Ranson, who is considered an authority on exercise physiology, will coach the high jump, pole vault, shot put, discus and javelin throws at Tennessee. Richardson has been named as track coach at the University of Wyoming.

title: Sindona to Face Charges in Italy After Surrender
description: Michele Sindona, the Italian financier who held a major interest in the Franklin National Bank when it failed in 1974, surrendered here yesterday on a warrant for his extradition to Italy to face fraud charges there.

title: Chamoun Confers With Assad
description: BEIRUT, Sept. 8Camille Chamouif,, the Lebanese Christian leader and Minister of Interior, met with President Hafer alAssad in Damascus today to discussefforts to solve the Lebanese civil war.

title: Business Records
Carter Suggests That U .S. Foster Rights Overseas
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Jimmy Carter suggested today that United States foreign policy could be more effectively used as a lever to advance human rights in Communist nations and in repressive regimes that are friendly to America. But he proposed few specific steps to reach the goal.

title: Ford Says U.S. Must Seek an Agreement in Africa
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8President Ford said today that the United States must now make a major effort to bring about a diplomatic solution that would allow blacks to take over power peacefully from white minority governments in SouthWest Africa and Rhodesia.

title: Meadowlands Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Plunge by Soybeans Weakens Corn and Wheat Prices
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 8 (AP) Soybean futures fell 121/2 cents a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade today and pulled Corn, wheat and oats prices lower.

title: Senator Chiles Faces a Tight Contest in Florida
description: MIAMI, Sept. 8A close race appears to be in prospect in Florida for the seat of Senator Lawton Chiles.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Laos Bans Birth Control to Build Population After a Decade of War
description: VIENTIANE, Laos  The Laotian Government has banned birth control.

title: Arab Oil Nations and West Join In Aid Effort for Egypt's Economy
description: CAIRO, Sept. 8The major Western nations that have assisted the Egyptian economy are reportedly joining with Arab countries in a consultative group to discuss and coordinate these aid programs.

title: NEWSDAY TO BUILD PLANT TO REPLACE 2 IT NOW HAS
description: Newsday, the Long Island newspaper, will construct a new plant on a 30acre site in Suffolk County, it was announced yesterday by William Attwood, its publisher.

title: McCarthy Fails in Bid For California Listing
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8 (UPI)  Eugene J. McCarthy, who is running an independent campaign for the Presidency, will not have his name listed on California's ballot in November because he failed to obtain enough signatures on his petitions, a judge ruled today.

title: Notes on People
description: Reportedly the target of threatening letters, Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn has moved from Zurich to the United States with his wife and four children and has bought a house in Cavendish, Vt. The 57yearold author, expelled from the Soviet Union in 1974, has been lecturing in the United States this year, but moved for good in August. Swiss sources said yesterday.

title: Radio
For One Night, the Store's Elevators Served Drinks
description: It isn't that John Schumacher has a literal mind. Things just worked out that way. On Labor Day, Mr. Schumacher was doing some unusual laboring: unusual, that is, for a chairman of the board.

title: Judge Rules N.F.L. Draft Is Illegal
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)A Federal judge struck down the National Football League's annual draft of college players today on grounds it violated Federal antitrust laws.

title: Troy, in Court for His Sentencing, Withdraws Earlier Plea of Guilty
description: City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. yesterday suddenly withdrew his plea of guilty to a charge that he had filed 1972 income tax return that did not report $37,000 taken from the estates of his law clients, in a turnabout that surprised the judge and the Federal prosecutor.

title: Books of The Times
description: When a highly intelligent and talented woman writes a preposterous novel, we can only suppose that she is in the grip of a crippling idea. The idea in A Sea Change seems to be an eccentric offshoot of what is now called the sexual revolution. But while this movement has produced some brilliant books by women, Lois Gould's fourth novel is one of its casualties. No revolution is complete without its bad books.

title: British Animal Lovers Admit Attack
description: LONDON, Sept. 8 (Reuters)A group 1 calling itself the Animal Liberation Front took responsibility today for vandalism on a truck that the group said had been used to transport animals for live experiments. The vehicle, belonging to a firm of breeders in rural southeastern England, had its tires slashed, the windshield sprayed with black paint and the wiper blades torn off. Soil was poured into the gas tank. Several weeks ago, a similar caller took responsibility when the office of a Government adviser on animals was wrecked.

title: Reason on Puerto Rico
description: For the second straight year, common sense eventually prevailed in the United Nations Decolonization Committee's wholly unwarranted deliberations about the political status of Puerto Rico. Last year it required a formal vote of 11 to 9 to shelve a fatuous Cuban resolution that would have reaffirmed the inalienable right of the people of Puerto Rico to selfdetermination and independence. This year, the committee simply decided without a vote to postpone the issue until next year.

title: Curt Flood, Forgotten Man In Baseball Freedom Fight, Lives in SelfImposed Exile
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  The smallish black man in a pale yellow shirt and brownandwhite striped slacks walked into the lobby of the Edgewater Hyatt House, and Lou Piniella stood next to him without showing any sign of recognition. Mickey Rivers and Elrod Hendricks passed him in a corridor of the motel and did not know him. Billy Martin came out of his room and the smallish black man stopped.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor.

title: Merger Action Heats Up
description: Merger activity involving major companies heated up yesterday. The CocaCola Company is holding merger talks with the Taylor Wine Company. CBS has agreed in principle to acquire Fawcett Publications, and the Norton Company plans to take over Christensen Inc. in an exchange of stock valued at $100.6 million, Page 67,

title: First CarterFord Debate Is Set For Old Theater in Philadelphia
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8The first campaign debate between President Ford and Jimmy Carter will be held in a historic 167yearold theater in Philadelphia the night of Sept. 23, unless the courts intervene.

title: FRENCHMAN IS HOME, MISSING MONEY ISN'T
description: PARIS, Sept. 8With a newly sprouted beard and wearing blue jeans, the oncetrusted middleaged chief accountant who vanished two months ago with $1.6 million belonging to the giant DassaultBreguet company returned to France today without the cash.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN RIOTS REACH ANOTHER TOWN
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 8 (AP) Racial unrest spread today to Kimberley, the diamond town midway between Johannesburg and Cape Town. Blacks stoned buses and cars, and an openair boxing ring was set afire. The police said there was no shooting, but they made several charges with staves to disperse the crowds.

title: G.E.State Pact on PCB Is Praised As Guide in Other Pollution Cases
description: ALBANY, Sept. 8The Columbia University law professor who conducted hearings on state pollution charges against the General Electric Company said here today that yesterday's agreement to stop the company's chemical contamination of the Hudson River was an effective precedent for dealing with situations of joint culpability.

title: Troy, in Court for His Sentencing, Withdraws Earlier Plea of Guilty
description: City Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. yesterday suddenly withdrew his plea of guilty to a charge that he had filed a 1972 income tax return that did not report $37,000 taken from the estates of his ,law clients, in a turnabout that surprised the judge and the federal prosecutor.

title: Retired Leader Of Steelworkers Misses Limelight
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Sept. 6The walls of David J. McDonald's retirement home are lined with pictures of his glory days as president of the United Steelworkers of America, pictures with Harry S. Truman, James A. Farley, Dwight D. Eisenhower, John F. Kennedy and Zsa Zsa Gabor. There are trophies and plaques and a framed picture of him on the cover of Time magazine.

title: Detroit's Public Schools Open a Lean Year
description: DETROIT, Sept. 8When the doors of Stevens Mason Elementary School opened here this morning, hundreds of enthusiastic children were soon at their desks giggling. chattering, making new friends and meeting old ones they had not seen over the summer vacation.

title: Paris Opera Offers a Great Figaro
description: Sanity returned to the world of opera last night with the Nozze di Figaro presented by the Paris Opera in its initial American performance. Instead of the directorial ego trips we have been having here and abroad, this was a traditional, steady performance of the Mozart opera; and whatever novel ideas it did have worked into a Mozatean conception. The audience at the Metropolitan Opera cheered everything in sight. Curiously, the director was the same Giorgio Strehler whose peculiar Macbeth had opened the Theatro alla Scala visit in Washington on Tuesday night.

title: Jury Selection Under Way in Trial Of Mandel and Four Close Allies
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 8The bribery and fraud conspiracy trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland and four of his close friends and political allies got off to a slow start in Federal Court here today as lawyers on both sides began the process of selecting a jury.

title: Norway Workers Make Own Rules
description: OSLOFredrik Thoresen who runs one of the biggest companies in Norway, spends a lot of time dealing with the workers. But he doesn't, like storybook capitalist, thump his desk and fume about them.

title: Advertising
description: You're the Boss, is the theme of the new $6 million United Airlines campaign to attract the business traveler.

title: The Distant Candidate
description: ST. HELENA, Calif., Sept. 8Nell MacVeagh is a widow who owns ranch here at the upper end of the Napa Valley, in the grape country north of San Francisco Bay. She is a Democrat. But if she had to vote right now, she would vote for President Ford.

title: Shirt Makers and Union Agree on a 3Year Pact, Averting Walkout Today
description: The Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union and major shirt manufacturers reached agreement yesterday on a riew threeyear contract that will provide increases in wages and benefits for 30,000 workers.

title: Air Force Academy. Discloses Resignation of Cadet in Inquiry
description: AIR FORCE ACADEMY, Colo., Sept. (AP)A cadet under investigation for being near an offlimits, area of the Air Force Academy with a bag containing stereo equipment and marijuana has resigned, an academy spokesman said yesterday,

title: SUFFOLK PASSES BILL TO SAVE FARMLANDS
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Sept. 8The Suffolk County Legislature, in what was believed to be the first action of its kind by any local government in the country, agreed today to begin buying $21 million in development rights to eastern Long Island farmland to keep it out of the hands of real estate developers.

title: The U.N. Today.
MARGARET PHILBROOK ZUG
description: Margaret Philbrook Zug, managing editor at Grosset & Dunlap, book publishers, died of cancer yesterday at Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital, Hanover, N.H. She was 31 years old.

title: ISRAELI'S PROPOSAL ON ARABS DISPUTED
description: JERUSALEM, Sept. 8The publication of a confidential report written by an Israeli official suggesting ways to curb the growing number and influence of Israeli Arabs in the Galilee region has provoked a sharp controversy here.

title: Dividends
Locomotive Kills 6 in Switzerland
description: DIETIKON, Switzerland, Sept. 8 (UPI) A locomotive ran into a group of workers repairing railroad tracks today, killing six persons and injuring a seventh. The police said that rail officials attributed the accident to a lack of warning signals.

title: DoubleA Electric Utilities Poised To Test Lowest Yields in 2 Years
description: A key sector of the corporate bond marketdoubleA rated electric utilities is poised to test today its lowest yields in two years as a result of fundamentally favorable conditions for fixedincome securities. Expected to reach the public at prices to yield 8.45 percent is a $60 million, 30year issue of Public Service Electric and Gas bonds. Heading the group for this underwriting of Peggy's, as the company is known in the bond trade, is Merrill Lynch. Credit Markets

title: Buckley Says Tendency to Create Quota Society
description: ???enator James L. Buckley, the Conservative Republican, incumbent, asserted yesterday that one of the great dangers to freedom in New York State and the nation was the growing tendency on the part of wellmeaning individuals in and out of government to make ours a quota society.

title: and Arms Control
description: Apart from Korea, two other significant national security issues have been posed by Mr. Carterwithout as yet a direct response from Mr. Ford. One is his opposition to the Ford Administration's largescale arms sales to thirdworld countries. particularly Iran and Saudi Arabia. Even more important is his disagreement with Administration weapons programs preparing counterforce capability for limited strategic nuclear war, a major departure from the earlier American strategy of deterrence. Mr. Carter has also urged a far more vigorous antiproliferation policy than has been pursued until recently by the Ford Administration. But the differences here are being blurred now by a shift in Washington toward the Carter viewpoint.

title: Schorr Bids Congress Define Issues in Intelligence Data Disclosure
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 8Daniel Schorr sought today to define the issues in next week's confrontation between Congress and the press by requesting that the House Ethics Committee specify how national security was violated by the publication six months ago of portions of the Pike intelligence committee report.

title: White Youths Attack Blacks in Washington Sq.
description: A band of at least 20 white youths swarmed through Washington Square Park last night, yelling racial epithets and attacking blacks with baseball bats and sticks, the police said.

title: Excerpts From Debate of 5 Democratic Senate Candidates
description: Assessment of Opponents

title: FIVE SHOT IN CHINATOWN IN FLAREUP OF GANGS
description: Four young men and a young woman were shot last night in Chinatown in what the police believed was a flareup between members of rival youth gangs. None of the victims was seriously wounded, it was reported.

title: U.S. Forms Drop Loyalty Queries
description: The United States Civil Service Commission has ordered elimination of all political loyalty questions on the standard application for Federal jobs, including whether a job seeker has belonged to the Communist Party or any group advocating forcible overthrow of the Government.

title: A $1 Million FoodStamp Embezzlement Laid to. Head of White Plains Check Firm
description: The operator of a White Plains checkcashing concern was indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury,. charged with embezzling $1,067,102 in foodstamp money.

title: 15 in House Move to Thwart Sale of Missiles to Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Fifteen House of Representatives members said today they would introduce three resolutions to block reported plans by the United States to sell $60 million in advanced missiles to Saudi Arabia.

title: Argentina Orders Jail Sentences For Those Causing Labor Unrest
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 8Argentina's military Goyernment responded to strikes in the automotive industry today with a decree punishing instigators of work stoppages with uo to 10 years in orison.

title: Opera: Figaro
description: A capable cast gave a comfortable glow to the first Marriage of Figaro of the young New York City Opera season. Production values were in good order at the New York State Theater on Tuesday night, the ensemble numbers came off with reasonable precision, and while the performances never really caught fire, they stated Mozart's case with gentle charm.

title: Stocks Mixed in Higher Volume; Dow Index Slumps 3.65 to 992.94
description: The stock market encountered profit tilting pressures yesterday after its recent strong advance and closed mixed in accelerated trading.

title: Beaths
description: Braths

title: NATIONALISTS IN CORSICA SAY THEY BLEW UP PLANE
description: AJACCIO, Corsica, Sept. 8 (AP)An anonymous caller who said he spoke for the Corsican National Liberation Front said today that the front was responsible for blowing up a French Boeing 707 airliner at Ajaccio's airport last night.

title: Arizona Republicans Select Steiger, Slain Reporter's Friend, for Senate
description: PHOENIX, Sept. 8Representative Sam Steiger defeated Representative John B. Conlan yesterday in a bitterly fought contest for the Republican nomination for the Senate.

title: Article 7  No Title
Top State Democrats Seem to Be Uniting for Carter
description: TRENTON, Sept. 8Pressured by the personal intervention of Jimmy Carter, feuding New Jersey Democrats were reported today ready to resolve their differences in the interests of carrying the state for the Democratic Presidential nominee in November.

title: HERMAN RIVKIN
description: Herman Rivin, a lawyer for 66 years, died yesterday at University Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 131 East 21st Street, Brooklyn.

title: SPANISH LEADER APPEALS FOR SUPPORT OF MILITARY
description: MADRID, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Prime Minister Adolfo Stiafez Gonzalez sought the support of Spain's military leaders today for hisplans to change the authoritarian administration inherited from Franco.

title: Black Police Officials Establish Organization in Effort to Expand Influence in Criminal Justice Fick
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Sept. 8More than 60 of the nation's topranking black police officials today organized the National Organization of Black Law Enforcement Executives in an effort to give blacks more influence in the field of criminal justice on the national and local levels.

title: Pirates Set Back Phiflies Again, 61
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 8 (AP)Richie Hebner drove in four runs to back the ninehit pitching of Jim Rooker and lead the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 61 victory tonight over the floundering Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Despite Lingering Tension, Boston's Third Year of CourtOrdered School Busing Begins Without Incidex
description: BOSTON, Sept. 8Public schools opened quietly here today for the third year of courtordered busing for school desegregation.

title: Fewer, Stronger Cold Medicines Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8  Americans should be offered fewer and more powerful ingredients in nonprescription cough, cold, asthma and allergy medicines, for which they spend $735 million a year. a panel of experts has advised the Food and Drug Administration after a major threeand ahalfyear study.

title: Figueroa Takes 17th, 80; Nettles Connects forYanks
description: Ed Figueroa carried out his pregame plan perfectly last night, quickly dispatching the Milwaukee Brewers with a threehitter so he could get to Puerto Rico in time for the birth of his second child.

title: Pirates Only 41/2 Back
description: The Pittsburgh Pirates moved to within 41/2 games of the lead in the National League's Eastern Division last night by defeating the firstplace Phillies, 61. The victory was Pittsburgh's 13th in the last 14 games and it gave the Pirates a sweep over the fading Phillies. Details on Page 54.

title: SOUTH AFRICAN RIOTS REACH ANOTHER TOWN
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 8 (AP) Racial unrest spread today to Kimberley, the diamond town midway between Johannesburg and Cape Town. Blacks stoned buses and cars, and an openair boxing ring was set afire. The police said there was no shooting, but they made several charges with staves to disperse the crowds.

title: Plays by Stoppard Set in Washington
description: The Kennedy Center will use theater not on its own premises to offer the American premiere of Tom Stoppard's double bill, Dirty Linen & NewFoundLand. It has rented for six weeks the West End Theater in Washington and will offer the British playwright's new work there starting Wednesday, Oct. 6.

title: Toward Greater Clarity, Lucidity, Transparency
description: WASHINGTON Following are excerpts of White House transcript of an exchange between Ron Nessen, President Ford's press secretary, and White House reporters on Friday, Sept. 3, as Mr. Nessen announced the plans for the President's first overtly political appearance of the campaign.

title: Teachers, Rebuffed on PayRise Demands, Strike in Buffalo, Bayonne and Jersey City
description: Teachers in Buffalo. Jersey City and Bayonne, N. J., struck yesterday over the issue of money, or rather the lack of it.

title: Legal Gambling Said to Spur Illegal Bets
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Tens of thousands of Americans were attracted to illegal gambling after being introduced to gambling by legalized staterun games, a House committee was told today.

title: William A. Reifel Dies in Algeria; Employee Relations Supervisor
description: William A. Reifel, an employee relations supervisor for Bechtel Corporation, a San Franciscobased construction company, died in a drowning accident Friday in Algeria where Bechtel is building petrochemical plant.

title: Dave Anderson
description: It's not Wimbledon but the colonists are trying. At the United States Open tennis championships at Forest Hills, the concession stands offer strawberries and blueberries with Devonshire cream. Quiche, with bacon and gruyere, is available; also knockwurst steamed in beer on fluted bread with caraway sauerkraut. There are bratwurst and frankfurters. But no hot dog as such. At least not on the menu. Too bourgeois. The hot dog is on the court, instead. Ilie Nastase, steamed in controversy, is the pro everybody is talking about. But with the Rumanian. pro is short for provocateur rather than professional. He deserved to be banished from the tournament for his tantrum last Friday, but he wasn't. And today he will be playing against Dick Stockton in the quarterfinals, with many people not quite sure whether they want him to win or lose. If he wins, he might embarrass tennis again. But if he loses, the show is over. The phenomenon of Ilie Nastase is that nobody in tennis wants live with him or without him.

title: Strike by Jersey City's Teachers Bars School Opening for 38,0.00
description: JERSEY CITY, Sept. 8Jersey City teachers joined clerks and secretaries on the picket line today and effectively blocked the scheduled opening of schools for 38,000 students.

title: CORRECTION
description: It was erroneously reported in The Times yesterday that a Federal Trade Commission Investigation of the nursing home industry would try to determine the general quality of nursing home services. The agency said that it would not attempt to make such a determination.

title: Jehovah's Witnessei Banned by Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 8 (AP)The Argentine Government banned the Jehovah's Witnesses religious sect today, accusoing it of violating the country's principles.

title: Stranded Ships Move in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Sept. 8 (Reuters)Freighters bound for Eastern Europe today began moving along the Danube for the first time since Vienna's mairt river bridge collapsed 39 days ago. About 500 ships had been stranded since the Reichsbruecke fell into the Danube.

title: Philharmonic Praised in Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8 (UPI)  The New York Philharmonic orchestra opened its first Soviet tour in 17 years today with a soldout concert in Leningrad that won warm critical praise.

title: Utilities Warn of Energy Crisis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)The United States has moved closer to a severe electrical energy crisis during the past year and faces the threat of blackouts or power reductions during the next. decade unless existing problems can be solved, the nation's electrical utilities said today. A pair of reports by the National Electric Reliability Council, formed by the utility industry in 1968, said there were severe problems with nuclear energy, with Government regulation of other fuel sources, with pollution and power plant locations and with financing of new power plants.

title: Carter's Wife Says His Attitude Toward Abortion Won't Change
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Sept. 8 (UPI)Jimmy Carter's wife said today that her husband was not likely to change his position on abortion.

title: Carter Suggests That U.S. Foster Rights Overseas

title: Anne Stratton Crowley, 76, Dies; Was Founder of Crow Hill School
description: Anne Stratton Crowley, the founder of the former Crow Hill School in Rhinebeck, N.Y., died yesterday at Northern Dutchess Hospital in Rhinebeck. She was 76 years old.

description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (AP)Star Trek fans have apparently balked the space agency's choice of name for the country's new sevenpassenger space shuttle, which N to make its first oroital flight in 1979.

description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I. Sept. 8With the force, and broad pattern, of a shotgun Vast, sweeping changes were made in the Jets lineup today four days before they open their regular season.

description: MOSCOW, Sept. 8 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union today toned down its previously outright support for the Palestineist ,ians and leftwing groups in Lebanon. For  the first. time, it criticized ultraleftilt; elements for having rejected all peace. nronosals.

title: Atlantic City Fireman Is Killed
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Sept. 8 (UPI)Pete Gerber, 30 years old, an Atlantic City fireman, died in a collision between his private motorcycle and a city trash truck.

The lawye Emil Oxfeld of Newark, said mentat patients were being released from state institutions when in no medical shapr to deal with their own problems. He said they presented a real danger to the

description: Seven United States television stations in cities with large Spanishspeaking populationsincluding WXTV, Channel 41, in the New York areathis Sunday will begin carrying direct transmissions from Mexico's network, Televisa, on regular schedule.

title: Heavy Loss of Farmers
description: LONDON, Sept. 8 (Reuters)  The drought will cut British farm incomes this year by up to $720 million, or an average of 30 to 40 percent; a farmers representative says.

description: The mood outdoors on the sunny, hot afternoon was upbeat, with the postLabor Day atmosphere that signifies the start of a new work year and all its potential for change.

The weeklong contempt trial ended with Superior Court Judge Maurice Bois of Rockingham County telling the defendants they had attacked the integrity of the whole judicial system and were going to suffer the consequences.

description: Q. What are the most vulnerable aspects of the program and the background of your Democratic opponents that the Republican candidate could most successfully attack?

title: SenateHouse Conferees Reach a Major Decision on a Minimum Tax
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8Senate and House conferees reached a key compromise today tightening taxation of wealthy users of various tax preferences.

title: Washington Aide Arraigned
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (Reuters)The associate director of the District of Columbia treasury was arraigned today on a charge of impersonating a military officer. to obtain Governmentpaid medical treatment. The Federal Bureau of Investigation said that Charles Walker, 40 years old, :whose salary from the city is $32,000 a year, was arrested at Walter Reed Army Hospital while trying to obtain a military identification card for his wife, Evelyn Walker, for medical services and other privileges.

title: Connors and Vilas Move to Semifinals
description: The last time they met, four years ago, they were teenagers searching for a small slice of the pie. Now Jimmy Connors has two bodyguards, Guillermo Vilas is heavy into poetry and they will meet in the semifinals of the United States Open tennis championships as two of the sport's genuine stars.

title: Free Child Services Go Begging At New York Foundling Hospital
description: Help in the form of free shelter, food, parental guidance and rehabilitative work is available to children and their families at the New York Foundling Hospital Center for Parent and Child Development, but few families are using the free services, according to the hospital's director.

title: Around the Nation
description: MACON, Ga., Sept. 8 (AP)Former Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. of the Army, convicted of murdering 22 Vietnam civilians at My Lai in 1968, said today that he favored blanket amnesty for men who fled the draft during the Vietnam War.

description: The recent turbulence in Europe's money markets, which undoubtedly has abated only temporarily, reflects the strain between economic reality and political aims.

title: FORD SAYS REMARKS BY RIVAL ON KELLEY ARE CONTRADICTORY
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8President Ford described Jimmy Carter today as both callous and indecisive in making contradictory public appraisals of Clarence M. Kelley, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Aides Say Reagan Will Campaign For Ford if He Gets Assignments
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 8Ronald Reagan, now vacationing in Mexico, is willing to campaign for the FordDole ticket this fall, his aides said today, but so far the White House has been slow to provide him with a speaking schedule.

title: Japanese Team Starting To Examine MIG25 Jet Brought In by Defector

title: EXLOBBYIST RECANTS ON 1970 GIFT TO DOLE
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8A former Gulf Oil Corporation lobbyist, Claude C. Wild Jr., said today that he was confident he had been in error when he said that in 1970 he gave $2,000 to Senator Robert J. Dole, now the Republican VicePresidential nominee.

title: Nitrogen Danger to Lawns Seen
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex. (UPI)  A turfgrass specialist says homeowners who use too much nitrogen fertilizer on their lawns may be covering up some serious lawn problems. Grass invaded by weeds, weakened by insect or disease attacks, or showing the effects of thatch accumulation may be boosted temporarily by nitrogen fertilizer, Dr. Richard Duble, a specialist for the Texas Agricultural Extension Service, said. However, unless the primary problem is diagnosed and solved, the addition of nitrogen will only add to the problem.

title: Toms River Man Killed in Crashi
description: TOMS RIVER, N. J., Sept. 8 (AP)A 44yearold man was killed Tuesday, when the car he was driving and another vehicle collided on Route 70 here, the police said. The victim was Paul Burgess The second car in the collision was driven by Robert White, 20; of Fort Dix He and a passenger were treated for minor injuries,

title: Jet Trainer Crashes, 2 Escape
description: EAGLETOWN, Okla., Sept. 8 (UPI)A military jet on a training flight crashed and burned last night in the hills of southeastern Oklahoma. Both crewmen ejected and landed safely about three miles from the wreckage, suffering only minor injuries. The Air Force identified the crewmen as 1st. Lieut. David Engebretson, 26, of Clarksville, Ind., the pilot, and 1st. Lieut. Larry Powers, 26, of Lumberton, N. C., the navigator. Both are assigned to the 91st Tactical Reconnaissance Squadron at Bergstrom Air Force Base.

title: Fischer's Manager Says Match With Karpov Is Now Very Likely'l

title: Vorster Says He Will Meet With Rhodesian Premier Next Week
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 8  Prime Minister John Vorster, speaking tonight at a rally of the ruling National party, said that he would meet early next week with Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia. The meeting, in Pretoria, the South African capital, will be the first between the two men since South Africa publicly committed itself to support moves toward black majority rule to Rhodesia.

title: Ehrlichman Sentence Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8 (UPI)Three judges on the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit temporarily blocked today an order requiring John D. Ehrlichman, former chief domestic adviser to President Nixon, to surrender to begin his prison term. The court stayed Federal District Judge Gerhard Gesell's order until Sept. 16. Mr. Ehrlichman was due to begin..serving a 20month to fiveyear. sentence for ordering a breakin by White House plumbers at the office of Dr. Lewis Fielding, Daniel Ellsberg's psychiatrist.

title: Study Finds Most Women Facing LowPaying Jobs Over Next Decade
description: Although more women will be working as school bus drivers, bank officials and medical technicians 10 years .from now, the vast majority of working women will still be employed in traditionally female, lowpaying jobs, according to an analysis released yesterday by The Conference Board.

title: A Hot New Act At the Cabarets
description: Vaudeville blues, torch boogie, and funky jazz rag rock are only a few of the terms that could be used to describe the music of Stormin Norman and Suzy, and although they are colorful terms, they are woefully inadequate. But while there has been some confusion as to how to categorize them, there has been general agreement among critics and listeners that Stormin Norman and Suzy are exceptionally original, exceptionally good, and just about the hottest cabaret act in town. Stormin Norman and Suzy were virtually unknown here three weeks ago when they began working at Tramp's 125 East 15th Street at Irving Place, and crowds were sparse. title: Werner Lieb, a Horticulturist, Dies on Cape Cod at Age of 93
