Paul Jazowski of Millington, N.J.

title: Ill do things my way
description: In 1973, when he was first elected mayor, Ed Hanna promised to turn Utica, a sooty and disheveled city on the Mohawk River, into a wonderful and beautiful place to live. Considering the condition it was in, this would have required something on the order of a miracle. When the knitting mills moved South in the 1930's, jobs became so scarce that nearly 20 percent of Utica's population eventually left town. The rate of unemployment among the 90,000 who stayed was the second highest in the state, with 10 percent of the work force chronically unemployed. Along Genesee Street, the

title: Mary Davis Bride of William Booth
description: Mary Allison Davis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Meacham Davis of Harwich Port, Mass., was married yesterday afternoon to William Nichols Booth, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Howe Booth of Lincoln, Mass.

title: Mary J. Bulger Becomes Bride Of G. M. Miller
description: Mary Jan Bulger, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas J. Bulger, was married yesterday to G. Montagu Miller at the Bulger home in West Chester, Pa. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Robert Scott, minister of the Lower Brandywine Presbyterian Church.

title: FILM VIEW
description: The surprise box office hit of the New York summer season has not been the lugubriously silly exorcize of demonology, The Omen, nor Mel Brooks's nonstop smile, Silent Movie, nor Brian De Palma's softfocus hedoneit, Obsession, nor Don Siegel's The Shootist, which. having John Wayne in the foreground of the Old West, could only have been a surprise had it been a flop. The surprise of the season wasand continues to bea wise, gentle, supremely romantic French comedy that came into this country with absolutely nothing in the way of the usual buildup going for it, including a director unknown in this hemisphere and some actors whose names might have been slightly familiar though it would have been difficult to place their faces.

title: Housing Goals: List Stirs Debate
description: TRENTON THREE housing experts, working in secret within the state's Department of Community Affairs, have nearly completed a long list that has New Jersey's developing communities alarmed. This is because the list is a tabulation of housing goals for the state, broken down into what the Byrne administration regards as each community's fair share of moderate andlowincome housing.

title: Three Begin Walk for P.O.W.
description: PITTSBURGH, Sept. 18 (AP)Three relatives of a Vietnam prisoner of war who has not been returned home began a walk to Washington today to call attention to their plight. John Estocin, 35 years old, his wife and sister started the trek from their home in nearby Turtle Creek and expected to cover the 250mile march in 16 days, Mr. Estocin's brother, Michael, Navy pilot, is one of 36 men still listed as a P.O.W.

title: LETTER FROM WASHINGTON
description: REPRESENTATIVE Lester L. Wolff, Democrat of Great Neck, is moving to set up his new narcotics committee swiftly, to show Congressmen that it is worthy enough to keep going next year.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: JAKARTA, IndonesiaMaj. Gen. Piet Haryono is a careful, infinitely painstaking man. Words like effort and care almost seem to be etched deeply in the furrows of his brow.

title: We Get the Education We Deserve
description: LONG Islanders concerned about educationand that should include every one of usare well advised to ponder two recent revelations. One, by the State Education Department, tells us that defeats of publicschool budgets during 1976 reached a record for the state of 29 percent, with the Island leading the tally. The other, by the Long Island Association or commerce and Industry, informs us that 9,000 jobs have been lost by Nassau and Suffolk Counties in the last 18 months as businesses have folded or left.

title: Jefferson Goals Clear: A 3d Title, Day of Rest
description: For Thomas Jefferson, the twotime defending Public Schools Athletic League football champion, a day without practice is a cold day in November but one day is enough at the Brooklyn school where football is a way of life.

title: A REPORT FROM LONDON
description: LONDON It's been a melancholy summer and early autumn in London. The drought has withered the grass on Hampstead Heath, emptied the sprays on Trafalgar Square and sparked pleas for restrictions on washing dishes and taking baths. There was the worst racial violence in years near Portobello Road, the pound has begun to drop again, the chimes of Big Ben collapsed at 3:45 one afternoona case of metal fatigue and the British Government was asked by Pakistan to return one of the most valuable gems in the world, the 109 carat Kohinoor diamond, which was set in Queen Victoria's crown, and served, in its own dazzling way, to symbolize British imperialism. (Greece will be on about the Elgin Marbles again any time, muttered Tile Financial Times).

title: Brookville Is Victor in Polo
description: Special to The New York Times

title: VIKING 2 WILL TRY TO OVERTURN ROCK
description: PASADENA, Calif., Sept. 18Scientists searching for signs of life on Mars are planning two more samplings by Viking 2. in one sampling, they hope to turn a rock over to see what's under it.

title: South Florida Is Stirred by Study Indicating That Boom Has Ended
description: FORT MYERS, Fla., Sept. 1  When Prof. Howard T. Odum came to town one night this week and pronounced that the boom in south Florida just might be over, he was immediately assailed as a dreamy Academic, if not the rankest heretic in the Sunbelt.

title: Olive Dixon Is Married To E. L. Gidley, Lawyer
description: The marriage of Olive Dixon of Saddle River, N.J., widow of Warren Dixon Jr., to Edwin L. Gidley, a widower of Fripp Island, S.C., took place yesterday afternoon in Saddle River. Theodore W. Trautwein, Superior Court assignment judge for Bergen County, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's stepdaughter, Mrs. Daniel B. Robertson, and her husband.

title: 5 Parties Vying To Gain Power
description: The governing party, Sweden's largest political organization, has been in office, alone or in coalition, since 1932, except for three months in 1936. The party, which has 156 of the 350 seats in the outgoing Parliament, derives most of its support from trade unions, urban intellectuals and the bureaucracy. It is a moderate, Socialist labor party, which seeks increased Government supervision of industry and trade, a redistribution of wealth through high income taxes and extensive social welfare. Its chairman is Prime Minister Olof Palme.

title: Syracuse U. Tightens Security After Sexual Attacks Nearby
description: SYRACUSE, Sept. 16 (AP)  Security patrols at Syracuse University have been increased because of several sexual attacks in a bordering residential area in recent weeks.

title: Music
Fashion
description: What are designers such as Halston, Calvin Klein, Kasper, Geoffrey Beene, Bill Blass, Viola Sylbert, Pauline Trigere, Scaasi and Ralph Lauren doing in what's known as downtown Seventh Avenue, the area below 30th Street where the furriers dwell? They are convincing that ordinarily conservative breed that thinking mink doesn't preclude thinking fashion, and in the process they are picking up Coty Awards for furs, as well as tweeds. In consequence, furriers are going around looking like smile buttons: Business, which was good in 1975, is 20 to 30 percent better already, and the season is just starting.

title: The War Wrecked the Economy, but Vietnam Has Experienced Leadership
description: HONG KONGAs they reconstruct Vietnam after three decades of war and revolution, the leaders in Hanoi are looking toward their recent enemy, the United States: They want American capital and technology to develop their energy resources and agriculture.

title: Marjorie Zale Is the Fiancee Of Seth Levy, Social Worker
description: The engagement of Marjorie Zale to Seth D. Levy has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Marvin Zale of Great Neck, L.I., parents of the bridetobe. Mr. Levy is the son of Rabbi and Mrs. Theodore S. Levy of Syracuse, where his father is spiritual leader of the Temple Society of Concord. Mr. Zale is a group vice president of the Zale Corporation, jewelry retailer.

title: Floating a Show
description: INTHEWATER boat shows have been enthusiastically accepted across the natiort. Now, one will make its debut on Long Island Thursday as the Long Island FIating Boat Show opens for a fourday run at the Anchorage Marina in Lindenhurst.

title: For young readers
description: Jane Yolen has written some fine children's books (The Seventh Mandarin and The Girl Who Loved the Wind, among others). Her prose is often quite beautiful. Here are six new parables of some wondrous worlds and an age gone by, written in that characteristically fine style, yet with seemingly borrowed characters and contrived situations.Why would she need to recycle Cinderella (Sylva in The Moon Ribbon)? Or reconstitute Thumbellina without adventure (Rosechild)? Why would Miss Yolen, a master of the woven themeintostory, give us pallid characters and pretentious, almost overwritten and overmoralistic tales? It just doesn't make sense.

title: A SeaChange
description: In Lois Gould's third novel, Final Analysis, the almost ludicrously masochistic heroine eventually straightened herself out by withdrawing alone to a deserted beach cottage to write a book. It was a curiously sudden sort of resolutionperfunctory. vague. as if the author herself were not entirely convinced of its feasibility.

title: L.I. CAR COMMUTING DEPLORED IN STUDY
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Sept, 18The NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board, after a study of automobile commuting patterns between New York City and Long Island, has concluded that economic constraints put a major solution to the problems of congestion, high cost and pollution caused by automobile commuting out of reach for the time being.

description: Suzanne Mulrenin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George J. Mulrenin of Osterville, Mass., and Stuart Scott Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Scott of New York and Dorset, Vt., were married yesterday in Osterville. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Clarence P. Murphy in Our Lady of the Assumption Roman Catholic Church.

title: Analyzing the Suburbs
description: RESPONDING to the problems of the cities, which surfaced and were brought before the country's conscience in the 1960's, colleges and universities were jolted into establishing formal, specific study of what came to be known as urban affairs.

title: Around the Nation
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 18 (AP)The Philadelphia County Council of the American Legion has shifted its first meeting of the season to the Bellevue Stratford Hotel, the site of the state Legion convention in July at which a number of legionnaires are believed to have contacted mysterious disease.

title: After a Bad Start, Suffolk Meadows Is Back on Track
description: YAPHANK HIS racetrack still gives Ronald J. Parr a lot of sleepless nights. But the $22 million project now gives him fewer nightmares. I can't even begin to say how much of a personal and professional relief it is to see the work started again at the track, Mr. Parr said. We have proved the cynics wrong. He added: It really has been hell.

title: All, For the Moment, Is Forgiven
description: In a week or two it will be time to reflect on the new television season. Reviewers, like Vikings, will land on Mars and look for signs of life. In screeningrooms and livingrooms, with our clipboards and our pencilflashlights and our press packets and our fine discriminations, eyes glittering as though nails had been hammered into the headcheese of our brains, we will grow opinions arid give them away in pots to the readers of our publications.

title: Patricia Hopkins Married
description: Patricia Anne Hopkins, daughter of Ida M Hopkins of Middletown, N. J., and Herbert S. Hopkins of New Haven, was married yesterday to Charles Davis Palmer. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Palmer of Upper Nyack, N.Y. The Rev. Robert Anthony performed the nondenominational ceremony in the Old Stone Church in Upper Nyack.

description: The longest winning streak in Westchester was stretched to 17 games yesterday when CrotonHarmon defeated Bronxville, 120.

title: BigCity Schools, in Money Pinch, Face Cutbacks Like New York's
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 18  An increasing number of bigcity school systems, beset by staggering financial problems, are edging toward impoverishment of the sort that has produced massive cutbacks in the public schools of New York City.

title: HELENE FITZGERALD
description: Helene Mary FitzGerald, director of nursing at the Yale University Health Service and assistant clinical professor at the Yale School of Nursing for 28 years until she retired in 1973, died last Sunday at New Rochelle (N. Y.) Hospital following a heart attack. She was 68 years old and lived in Middlebury, Conn.

title: Knick Rookies Carrying Big Hopes, Little Chance
description: LONG BRANCH, N.J., Sept. 18  Brent Wilson was the center of attention last night in the lobby of the resort hotel that houses the Knick rookies and free agents. Not only is Wilson, at 6 feet 11 inches, the tallest player in training camp, but he also is blond, handsome and filled out at 245 pounds.

title: Diana K. Temple Is Married to Rodney Pitts
description: Diana K. Temple and Rodney C. Pitts were married yesterday evening in Christ Church United Methodist by the Re??. Dr. David James Randolph.

title: The old Singer's young Singer
description: L B. Singer's new book, his 17th in English, does not break much ground, but it is not all repetition either. Its hero, as in Singer's two previously published memoirs, is a clever, intensely curious kid coming of age in the world of the Polish Jews when that world still existeda hothouse of obsessions and enthociacrns, morbid fears and the most innocent illusions. Again the reader meets young Singer as Singerthefamouswriter wishes him to be encountered, an impressive lad with red earlocks trying to puz zle out the mysteries of being by smuggling Spinoza and Schopenhauer into his Orthodox home, a voracious observer taking in all and everything around him, fascinated by animals and pain and sex, and beginning to scribble. Once more, the portrait is drawn in the style for which Singer is famous, which comes through even in translation and to which his readers have almost become accustomed, a rapid, declarative flow full of tangible allusion, at once homely and sly, artfully exploiting a pretense of artlessness.

title: ART VIEW
description: There is a Paris most of us have never seen but that remains nevertheless fixed in our minds more vividly than many things we have observed at firsthandan image compounded of poetry and old movies, of certain novels and paintings and what, in that distant era before pornography entered the college curriculum as a course of solemn study, were known as dirty postcards. It is not a city, it is a world, Corbiere declared in his poem Paris Nocturnethis Parisian world, or underworld, now as mythical as the Styx to which Corbiere compared it, that we glimpse in Baudelaire and Maupassant, in Degas's brothel scenes and the young Picasso, and in those movies ?? which a malevolent and unjust fate is about to overtake Jean Gabin or Michel Simon in seedy circumstances.

title: Track Asks Inquiry on Illegal Devices and Hints Plant
description: NICROLS, N. Y., Sept. 18 (AP)Fred Renz, president of Tioga Race Track, said today that illegal devices had repeatedly been found at the track. He called for a state investigation on whether or not efforts are being made to blemish the reputation of [the track's] horsemen, jockeys and trainers.

description: A workable home darkroom that will add hours of engrossing and creative pleasure to the photographic hobby can be set up by almost anyoneregardless of whether it is only a simple setup that makes temporary use of an apartment bathroom or kitchen, or a larger and more permanent facility that the photographer builds into his home basement.

title: How to Exploit a Tomato
description: THE tomatoes this year have been extraordinary. From the tiniest, cherry tomatoes, smaller than cherries, to voluptuous beefsteak varieties, we have been blessed with a bountiful harvest. The season, alas, is all too short and will begin to wane before long. While it lasts, take advantage of the offerings of your garden, your neighbors, the farm stands and even the supermarkets.

title: ART
description: THERE are many remarkable and alluring characteristics about East Hampton: its lush landscape, seductive climate, august landmark houses, its unrivaled beaches, its friendly people and amicable atmosp??ere a??d its poetic serenity.

title: Democrats Retaining House in Poll
description: The Democratic Party is likely to retain the strong majority in the House of Representatives that it gained in the offyear elections of 1974, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Miss Lindsay Plans Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Van Cleef Lindsay of London and Syosset, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter. Cameron Lindsay, to John Barton Warkentin, owner and operator of the Steamboat Village Ski Shop in Steamboat Springs. Colo.

title: Hounds Will Run at Exhibition in Virginia
description: In the same rolling country where George Washington rode to the hounds ?? than 200 years ago, a colorful pageant will be enacted Saturday at the Fairfax steeplechase meeting at Belmont Plantation in Leesbure. Va. Randolph Rouse, master of hounds, accompanied by Albert Poe, the huntsman, will lead the Fairfax park across the infield in an exhibition between races on a steeplechase card that has attracted the top timbertoppers in the country.

title: KISSINGER TO MEET WITH SMITH TODAY ON RHODESIA ISSUE
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Sept. 18Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger will meet here tomorrow with Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia as part of an effort to bring about black majority rule in that whiteruled country and prevent an expansion of the guerr??la war.

title: Henn's Streaker Takes Coast Powerboat Race
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 18Preston Henn of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., the 45 yearold owner of adult film drivein theaters, won the 181mile San Francisco Offshore Powerboat Race today despite problems with his hydraulic steering system.

title: Rehab Funds Go Begging
description: In a city said to be starved for housing rehabilitation money, New York City officials are disappointed that relatively few landlords have applied for a slice of $4 million in lowinterest loan funds that have become available for financing the upgrading of privately owned apartment houses.

title: HIGHER COSTS DIVERT BUSINESS FROM PORT
description: Higher handling costs here are shutting the port out of the substantial movement of United States potatoes to droughtstricken Western Europe. The reason that shiploads of nearby potatoes from Long Island and New Jersey are bypassing local piers was explained last Port week by Lawrence SchulNotes man, president of the N.Y. Export Company of Yonkers, a major exporter of produce. According to Mr. Schulman, it is more advantageous for a potato shipper to use the ports of Albany, Philadelphia or Norfolk for exporting nearby potatoes because of higher basic costs and lower labor productivity here.

title: Army's LastPeriod Rally Defeats Holy Cross, 2624
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Sept. 18No one will be able to accuse Army's football team of a lack of persistence or courage. Not after what happened today in Michie Stadium.

title: Home Clinic
description: Q: During the hot humid summer months there is a musty odor on ourfirst floor, which is located over a halfbasement and crawl space area. We thought the odor came from old carpeting, but this has been replaced and the odor still persists. We have tried making sure there is ventilation in the crawl space. The basement is damp and we wonder if this is the source of our problem, and if so what can we do about it?H.G., East Brunswick, N.J.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Urban Growth Bind

title: New Democratic Coalition Endorses Carter, Delays Action on Moynihan
description: The New Democratic Coalition, liberal wing of the state Democratic Party, yesterday endorsed Jimmy Carter, the party's Presidential candidate, but postponed action on a possible endorsement of Daniel P. Moynihan, the Democratic candidate for United States Senator.

title: SUSAN SAXE ON TRIAL FOR KILLING IN 1970
description: BOSTON, Sept. 18Susan Saxe sits in the wooden prisoner's dock now, six years later, in a demure green blouse, short dark hair, small hoop earrings, watching the people who will sit in judgment on her.

title: Private Schools Are No Longer Exclusive Retreats
description: Once a private or parochial school education was viewed as evidence of membership in the social and economic elite or in the dwindling but steadfast group of the religiously faithful in a materialistic age.

title: The Press and Its Right to Silence: Not Yet Clarified
description: The drama of Daniel Schorr, played out last week before the House ethics committee, focuses attention once again on an intriguing question of law and politics and the ethics of the press. That is the extent of a journalist's rightand professional obligationto keep secret the names of sources to whom he or she has promised anonymity in exchange for information.

title: Endpaper
description: When my daughter Bronwyn was 6 years old, she announced, I can draw a cat. As I leaned over her shoulder, she drew a lopsided circle about 2 inches in diameter, then a smaller circle touching it. The smaller circle was given ears, the larger one a curled tail. Then in the supreme act of creation, she drew three whiskers extending out from either side of the smaller circle. It was undeniably a cat, and not unlike the silhouette of T.S. Eliot's Bustooher !ones on this page.

title: E.P.A.'s 5Year Plan Is Criticized For Focus on ShortTerm Issues
description: The Environmental Protection Agency, which presented a fiveyear research and development program to Congress six months ago, has come in for a modicum of praise and a lot of criticism of its plans for the next halfdecade.

title: Audits of Income Tax Up to 2.5% of Total
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (AP)The chances of a tax return's being audited are increasing, according to the latest figures from the Internal Rvenue Service.

title: All the candidates' clothes
description: Jimmy Carter is not the first candidate in history to wear jeans as a political tactic; Calvin Coolidge tried it in 1924, but photographs of him in the fields in starched, creased overalls and a pair of wellshined black F hoes made him an object of national ridicule. Jeans are an authentic part of Carter's character, however, and the wellworn fit of them proves that he feels at home in the Plains, Ga., uniform of the day. Not lost on his political advisers is the fact that jeans register contradictory impressions with the young people around Harvard Square and the farmers in Iowaanother example of the former Governor of Georgia's remarkable ability to design a campaign that attracts voters of opposite political views.

title: Auto Racing
Joseph Durso
description: BOSTON, Sept. 18The Great Wall still stands in left field and so does Carl Yastrzemski. But otherwise, Fenway Park is a changed and sometimes lonely place these days, one year after the Boston Red Sox captured the public's fancy as the underdogs who became folk heroes. And now, where has the romance gone?You can stand in 64yearold Fenway Park these September days and it's not difficult to flash back to the scenes that bewitched the nation during the last pennant race and the last World Series. Fat old Luis Tiant spinning and tantalizing on the pitcher's mound. Trim young Freddie Lynn patrolling center field and making baseball history as the rookie of the year and the most valuable player in the American League. Bernie Carbo pinchhitting his home runs and Bill Lee talking his role of the spaceman. Carlton Fisk hitting the ball over the screen after midnight, and the whole joint jumping while the rousing Red Sox clawed away at the Mean Machine of Cincinnati until the final out of the final game.

title: Tracking a Mystery
description: ON a clear spring morning last year in the woods a dozen miles north of Newton in Sussex County, two men were examining a swamp made by a beaver dam when growls shattered the quiet. Across the swamp water, 150 feet away, two dogs were fighting with something that was partly submerged.

title: Moscow, Puzzled by FordCarter Contest, Worries About Detente
description: MOSCOW, Sept 17The American Presidential campaign seems to be leaving Moscow puzzled and somewhat apprehensive.

title: Mood Over Rules These Days
description: Resort fashions are emerging as a kaleidoscope of vibrant or muted colors, swirling skirts and tiny waistlines, strapless necklines and halters, with the cleancut look of American sportswear sandwiched amid the outpouring of romantic designs.

title: Hannah's Daughters
description: Oral historythe technique of capturing a time, a place, an individual character through the tape recording of more or less spontaneous speechdepends for its interest on the quality of that speech. Some have it, some don'tsome are salty, eccentric, unpredictable, revealing what they never meant to reveal, what the interviewer never thought of probing for. Others tighten up and protect their feelings, or are simply flavorless to begin with: their accounts are valuable chiefly to historians or sociologists. Hannah's Daughters has a little of each of these qualities. Those who grew up or live now in the state of Washington, I suspect, will read it with delight. Sociologists, psychologists and historians will flndit useful, but its appeal to the ordinary reader will be a matter of taste. Also a matter of sex.

title: New Products
description: An easily installed protective device that will discourage forced entry, and sound a loud whistle when someone does try to force the door open has recently been put on the market by the Sunbeam Appliance Service Company, 5600 West Roosevelt.Road, Chicago, Ill. 60650. Called the Stop Alarm, and priced at under $10, it is basically a folddown type door stop which screws to the bottom of the door. In its foldeddown position it not only serves as a door stop, it also has a builtin ?? ing whistle (90 decibels) which soundsautomatically when pressure is applied to the door while the stop is folded down. The whistle is activated by an aerosol container, so there are no batteries or wires.

title: Abbatiello Out 4 Weeks
description: Special to The New York Times

title: .... Renewal in Canada
description: Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau has carried out an unusually sweeping Cabinet revision in Canada for the most obvious of reasons: A poll shows his Liberal Party commanding support from only 29 percent of the electorateits lowest standing since 1958 and a sizable 18 points behind his ProgressiveConservative opposition.

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: Upper Montclair Is `Literally Up the Creek

title: Novels and stories
description: Someone once said that every novel is also a theory of the novel. If so, their the theory Island People seems to be propounding is that only through brief journal entries, many separate stories, a changing cast of characters and a phantasmagoria of musings, questions and revisions can a novelist assemble his own shadowy, insular feelings. Or, as one of its characters puts it, All there is, is fragments, because a man, even the loneliest of the species, is divided among several persons, animals, worlds.

title: SHIFT OF SPACE CENTER SCORED IN NASA STUDY
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 18 (AP)A study presented to a Congressional subcommittee says that relocation of crew training and mission control functions from the Johnson Space Center in Texas to Cape Canaveral in Florida could cost as much as $842 million.

title: There's no such thing as economics, said the economist
description: The Economists

title: News Summary
description: SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 19, 1976

title: Conservative Party, by 140 to 137, Stops Bid to Keep Ford Off Ticket
description: The Conservative Party's state committee, by a margin of only three votes, defeated an attempt to deny President Ford a place on the Conservative line on the ballot in New York State for the November election.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: MUSIC as DANCE

title: New York State's Lottery, Overwhelming Success, Is Still Called Far Behind Illegal Games in Some Areas
description: Although the new instant New York State Lottery is an overwhelming success, it is not very popular in communities that still favor longerestablished betting games such as numbers and the horses.

title: Cricket Catching On
description: EAST MEADOW PRACTICALLY every summer and fall Sunday Winston English scoops up his ball, bat and playing garb and heads with his wife and children to Eisenhower Park to play ball.

title: Art
Stylistics Confronted by Mishaps
description: It takes professionalism to overcome obstacles of the sort that confronted Stylistics at their Felt Forum show Friday. Russell Thompkins, whose plangent high tenor is the group's lead voice, was limping about the stage, his right foot in a cast. Aarion Love, the Stylistic's second lead, walked to the lip of the stage to sing The Way We Were and, as the houselights went down, he walked too far and fell into the audience.

title: Music Notes: Asked for One, Cage Writes Two
description: John Cage's newly commissioned work for the Boston Symphony (which will be given its first performance in Boston under Ozawa on Sept. 29 and presented here by the New York Philharmonic under Boulez on Nov. 5, is in a sense a double premiere. Cage has, so to speak, delivered two scores for the price of one: Renga and Apartment House 1776 can be played separately, but they are designed also to be heard simultaneously, with the conductor making the decision as to which piece is to begin first, and which to end first.

title: ISSUES HOLD THE KEY TO LEGISLATURE VOTE
description: The battle for control of the New York State Legislature this fall will consist mostly of skirmishes in a relatively few key districts where, politicians of both parties believe, state and local issues and personalities will do more to determine the outcome than will any coattail effect from the Presidential election.

title: Susan B. Skakel, Photographer, Bride of Curtis Rand, a Forester
description: Susan Brannack Skakel, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. George Skakel Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon in Greenville, Del., to Curtis Gordon Rand. He is the son of John Alsop Rand of Salisbury, Conn., and Mrs. Harrison E. Salisbury of New York.

title: A River Runs Through It And Other Stories
description: Friends aware of my extravagant attachment to the great outdoors and to the joys of primal contact with nature will attribute my enthusiasm for this collection of autobiographical fiction to the builtin lures of subjectmatter. Not so. A poorly crafted story about troutfishing or lumberjacking is still garbage. This book contains no garbage, not a single speck of dreck in its two novellas and one short story about a rich life in the western Rocky Mountains in the early 20th century.

title: New Jersey Chamber Symphony Has Ambitious New York Debut
description: The Chamber Symphony of New Jersey, which made its New York debut at Carnegie Recital Hall last Sunday night, has much in its favor. The playing is vigorous and rhythmically alive, the conducting is spirited and sensitive to the basic of 18thcentury style, and the programming Is more imaginative than it would have to be.

title: EXPRESSBUS RUNS RAPIDLY EXPANDING
description: After an hour's ride from midtown Manhattan the express bus makes one of its routine lateafternoon stops on HyIan Boulevard in a pleasant residential section of Stater island. A commuter steps off and is greeted at the curb by his smiling teenage daughter and the family's big dog. Relaxed, except for the excited pooch, they head for home a few steps away.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayNorthwestern Conn. D.C. allbreed and obedience. Fair Grounds, Route 63, Goshen, Conn.; 1,694 dogs; 9 A.M.

title: Gene Federico
description: Gene Federicoart director/partner of Lord, Geller, Federico, the advertising agency that brings you Killington, Vt., Steinway pianos, Tiffany's and The New Yorker, yes, The New Yorkeris a slim, elegant man of 50. His exacting taste in clothes may date from his childhood in Coney Island, when his father, who was in the men's clothing business, kept up his sewing skills by making all the children's clothes.

title: A.H. Levy Fiance Of Tovah Feldshuh, Broadway Actress
description: Tovah Feldshuh, star of the recent Broadway musical YentlThe Yeshiva Boy, and Andrew Harris Levy of Washington, a lawyer with the firm of Arent, Fox, Kintner, Plotkin & Kahn, plan to be married in February.

title: A Profile Of Voting Strength
description: A PREDOMINANT majority of New Jerseys voters live in a stretch of counties that form a sort of question mark. The stretch begins in Passiac County, arches upward into Bergen County and then curves down through Hudson, Union, Essex, Middlesex and Mercer. Camden County forms the dot.

title: A Jailed Black Relays Warning To Kissinger
description: JOHANNESBURG. Sept. 18  While Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger was meeting in Pretoria today with a group of nonwhite representatives, hundreds of more radical black leaders were in jail cells, under indefinite detention without trial.

title: And Now a Few Vital Statistics About the Sport Fan
description: Most of us have been raised following some kind of sports average. Whether it was the batting average of a major league baseball player, how many yards our favorite football player carried the ball each time he ran or some other fact about a running, scoring and sweating hero, our thoughts were filled with numbers. In fact, so smart and accurate were we with all that we knew about sports that our parents wanted to know if we could trade it in for better grades in school.

title: Miss Shinabarger Wed To Tom Decker Seip
description: Linda Shinabarger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bruce Shinabarger of Darien, Conn., was married there yesterday in the Noroton Presbyterian Church, to Tom Decker Seip, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Seip of Erie, Pa. The Rev. Dr. Lawrence MacCall Horton, the minister, performed the ceremony.

title: The Meadowlands
description: RESULTS

title: Until Successor Is Found, There Will Probably Be Collective Leadership
description: HONG KONGWith the end of the elaborate memorial services for Chairman Mao Tsetung, China now begins the task its great Helmsman was unable to fulfill: the search for new leaders to continue his unfinished revolution.

title: Lisa Radoyevich Married to Timothy E. Sweet
description: Lisa Radoyevich, daughter of Boris Radoyevich, Federal Bankruptcy Judge in the Eastern District of New York, and Mrs. Radoyevich of St. James, L.I., was married yesterday afternoon to Timothy E. Sweet, son of Evelyn Kidd Sweet of Baltimore and the late Wilson Purcell Sweet of Staunton, Va. The ceremony was performed in the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read. He was assisted by the Rev. Richard E. Nathan.

title: Billy Dee Williams The Black Clark Gable Branches Out
description: HE was first thrust into the public eye as Billy Dee Williams, jock  the result of his outstanding portrayal of a football player in the Emmywinning 1971 television movie, Brian's Song. Then came two plum movie roles as Diana Ross's dream man, in Lady Sings the Blues and Mahogany, and he became known as Billy Dee Williams, the black Clark Gable.

title: Nettles Clout Again Wins for Yanks
description: MILWAUKEE, Sept. 18Graig Nettles, a Yankee who has been overshadowed this season by more heralded teammates, continued making up for his lagging recognition today by hitting his second consecutive gamewinning home run.

title: The Chisholms
description: The country may not be exactly drooling with hunger for another novel about Westering, but Evan Hunter, in his 17th book, evokes some freshness from the tritest materials and focuses our concern on complex, often perverse, human beings rather than on the vacuous panoramic vista that too often dominates this genre. When the Chisholm family pull out of barren Virginia In 1844 and head doggedly for the promised land, they do not automatically become archetypes, rendered featureless by the author's grim determination to make some Big Statement about the pioneering spirit of our hardy forefathers or how Noble Women Helped to Win the West.

title: Keeping Farmland Down on the Farm
description: ?? HAUPPAUGE JOHN V. N. KLEIN had just been elected County Executive of Suffolk and he was in a helicopter headed for the East End of the Island. At one point the rows of houses and development below seemd to stop and a beautiful patchwork of farmland was spread out before him. He could almost see the suburban sprawl heading east.

title: CrossCountry Set at Furman
description: GREENVILLE, S.C., Sept. 18 (AP)Tennessee, Western Kentucky and East Tennessee State are among the teams that will participate in the third annual Furman invitation crosscountry meet Oct. 16. Also In the 10team field will be Furman University, the host; Auburn; Florida; Clemson; the Citadel, Appalachian State, and Brevard.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Highlights in Jazz

title: Nat'l Football League
U.S. Accused of Breaking Pledge
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The Panamanian Government has accused the Ford Administration of reneging on an oral pledge to resume negotiations before the November elections on eventual transfer of the Panama Canal to Panama.

title: Rachmaninoff's Piano Music on New Disks
description: After performing a movement from Rachmaninoff's Cello Sonata with Vladimir Horowitz at the Carnegie Hall 85th birthday gala concert last May, Mstislav Rostropovich asserted: For me, Horowitz continues the Rachmaninoff tradition.

title: Opening Night Is Every Night This Week
description: Shortly after he had started composing Porgy and Bess, George Gershwin was buttonholed by Leonard Liebling in a crowded theater lobby. What, demanded the editor of the Musical Courier, was the character of this new project that was keeping Gershwin so busy. American, of course, in the modern idiom, replied Gershwin, but just the same a cross between Meistersinger and Madame Butterfly. And then with a mischievous smile, he added, Are those models good enough?

title: Weddings
description: KleinWapnowitz

title: Student Loss Is Squeezing The Colleges
description: LONG ISLAND's highereducation system grew too fast, forcefed by the demand of a swelling student population and by a generous program of state financing. While encouraging the independent colleges to expand by making attractive financing for construction available, the state set out at the same thpe to build a public system to rival that of Californiawhich has no independent higheaeducation sector to speak of.

title: Life With the Family A Formula for Living
description: I HAVE never known an uninteresting person, once I took the time to understand and appreciate his or her humanness. Everyone is unique and has a unique life story to tell. All of us are what we are today because of the ways we have incorporated and dealt with our experiences of the past.

title: Bruins 146 Victors, Aided by Fumbles
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Sept. 18The better team won the BrownYale game today, the Bruins coming out on top 146, but it was hard to tell which was best because of all the turnovers and penalties. The His, for example, lost the hall four times by fumbling and failed to score a point in the second half although the offensive team was inside the Brown 40yard line five times and inside the 30 four times.

title: Post Intercepts 5 Passes And Routs Hofstra, 276
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Sept. 18They fought the battle of Long Island a little early this year, but the outcome, a 276 victory for C. W. Post over Hofstra today. was not expected.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Jacques Offenbach mocked classical mythology in 1858 with his Orpheus in the Underworld, and found himself with a tremendous hit on his hands. So he followed that recipe in 1864 with La Belle Hlne, and had another hit. Everybody flocked to the Varits to see and be seen, to revel in Offenbach's bubbling music and the naughty libretto, and to admire Hortense Schneider, the voluptuous singing actress who specialized in entertaining royalty in more ways than one. This is the operetta that the New York City Opera is staging on Tuesday. It will be sung in English rather than French. Otherwise it will be presented as originally written. No updating, says Julius Rudel. We are retaining moat of the dialogue, there are no musical cuts, and the work will be presented exactly as it came from the composer.

title: Latin American Poetry
description: Gordon Brotherston's Latin American Poetry: Origin and Presence is a useful introduction to this body of writing. A brief book, it wisely avoids detailed cataloguing and concentrates on important themes and influences as exemplified by some of the leading figures of the 19th and 20th centuries in Latin America. One of the themes covered is the vernacular. The author points out the tendency of Latin American writing to introduce colloquial speech into Spanish, the presence of elements from native languages and the effect of the gaucho tradition. The literature of the southern cantneat has done much to refresh Spanish and Portuguese and to modify the academic narrowness of their use in the mother counties.

title: Southern Baptists and Catholics Find Ties
description: Every third Thursday, the Rev. C. Brownlow Hastings and six other Southern Baptist ministers drive a few miles from downtown Atlanta to a secluded Trappist monastery. There, with three Roman Catholic monks, they spend the day reading the New Testament in Greek.

title: Met Pitcher Holds Foes to 5 Hits
description: Tom Seaver is definitely not the man the Pittsburgh Pirates like to see hurling baseballs at them. For the second time in six days, Seaver cooled the sizzling Pirates with a fivehitter yesterday as the Mets topped Pittsburgh, 62, at Shea Stadium.

title: Design
description: When Rob and Tanya Thirkield moved from a Greenwich Village brownstone to a large coop facing Central Park, they asked designer Paul van Eyre for a slick, modern setting. Their old apartment had been country in mood, furnished with Biedermeier and American Empire antiques and patchwork quilts. Now they wanted to combine modern and antique styles, using a neutral background to offset their antiques. The coop was large but decrepit. Most of the walls, for instance, needed patching and replastering. There were too many small hallways full of doors. Removing two of the walls, one between the foyer and the living room and another between the butler's pantry and the dining room, opened up the spaces, as did using glossy white enameled paint on the walls and commercial carpeting throughout the rooms. The paint and the carpeting are also the key to the easy maintenance, an imperative since the couple have two small children and two active careers. Rob Thirkield is an actor, a director and cofounder of the Circle Repertory Company; Mrs. Thirkield is Tanya Berezin, an actress who won an Obie award last year forher performanceinThe Mound Builders.

title: Skilled Hands Can Make Life Begin at 65
description: IT IS likely that the elderly persons tending the boutique in the old house at 1015 Littleton Road in Parsippany also made the crocheted afghans, ceramic pots and gingham pillows displayed on the shelves.

title: A New Wrinkle On the City's Skyline
description: Early next month, on Oct. 6, the new Citicorp Center on Lexington Avenue between 53d and 54th Streets will be topped out.

title: Yonkers Drivers
description: FRIDAY NIGHT

title: He Is a Candidate
description: WASHINGTONThe case Eugene J. McCarthy presents for himself as an independent candidate for President rests on a disarming but shaky syllogism: If current trends continue, Democrats and Republicans are likely to be outnumbered one of these days by voters who regard themselves as independents; Mr. McCarthy is the candidate of the independents: therefore, he is a serious candidate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: S.1: Old Monster in New Clothes

title: Notes: Will Mexico Really Cost Less?; Notes About Travel; Notes About Travel
description: Mexico's decision to float the peso and then to peg it at 19.90 to the dollar had travel agents and tour operators doing a Mexican hat dance in frustration last week as they tried to determine exactly what the change would mean to American tourists.

title: For Moynihan, Now Is the Time To Soothe Egos
description: Although he was not the candidate of downstate Democratic leaders, Daniel P. Moynihan will have few fences to mend or egos to soothe in the case of these leaders now that he is the party nominee for the United States Senate.The 49yearold candidate kept his lines of communication with the bosses open even while they were officially supporting the City Council president, Paul O'Dwyer, and even though Mr. Moynihan has no previous ties with the Democratic organization. He came into Government and politics as a technician and an academic during the Harriman administration and has spent most of his Government career in Washington.

title: JERSEY INQUIRY FIGURE ENTERS A GUILTY PLEA
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Sept. 18 (AP)A man who testified before a state grand jury investigating the comatose condition of Karen Anne Quinlan has pleaded guilty to charges of operating a prostitution ring and illegally selling handguns.

title: Miss Ford Likes Steuben Parade, Sees President Doing Well Here
description: Susan Elizabeth Ford came to New York City yesterday to campaign for her father and wound up starring in the 19th annual Steuben Day Parade on Fifth Avenue.

title: Autumn Leaves: A Budget Ramble
description: As surely as the leaves turn each year, Easterners by the millions take the arrival, of October as a signal to head north for the fall foliage display and a last fling at puttering around the countryside before winter sets in.

title: Peter Gambaccini
description: There are two constants in Peter Gambaccini's wardrobe: a pair of Spanish boots and a pair of track shoes. Both are holdovers from a visit to Europe, where he lived and traveled for five months. In New York, the 26yearold researcher with the NBC News elections unit still finds buying shoes his toughest wardrobe problem. So far, the perfect pair of Spanish boots has eluded him. He usually ends up with a proper pair of Bostonians instead  they're bland and inoffensive.

title: Clifton Downs Hackensack On Woodruff's Conversion
description: Clifton made its formal debut In the Northern New Jersey Interscholastic League yesterday with a 76 victory over Hackensack in Hackensack.

title: Shooting The Deep in A MillionDollar Pool
description: BERMUDA I'm getting waterlogged, says Nick Nolte. I've been down in the water four or five times every day for the last three months Sand I've reached the point where the physical strain has become too much for me. It takes a long time for a human being to acclimatize to an environment as unnatural to him as the water but I may soon be growing gills??

title: Beame Urges Turnout For a Carter SendOff
description: New York supporters of Jimmy Carter for President were urged by Mayor Beame yesterday to turn out shortly after dawn on Monday morning to see him off on a whistlestop campaign through New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: Creation of Jobs Is Held by Study To Be Way of Reducing Welfare
description: A new federally financed study of how families go off welfare has called for making job creation a top national priority, along with encouraging twoparent families and seeking to discourage family breakup.

title: UTAH DEMOCRATS ENDORSE WRITEIN TO OPPOSE HOWE
description: MURRAY, Utah, Sept. 18 (UPI)Utah's Democratic Party formally repudiated Representative Allan T. Howe today and endorsed the writein candidacy of a man he defeated in the primary election two years ago.

title: Lineup of Leaders for Mao Eulogy Indicates an Attempt at Continuity
description: HONG KONG, Sept. 18Today's carefully organized memorial rally in Peking for the late Chairman Mao Tsetung appeared designed to reinforce a sense of continuity in China's leadership and pollcies, according to analysts here.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Now that theatrical workshops, stashed away in old brownstones, garages, lofts and church basements, have multiplied felicitously and even ferociously, taking over almost entirely for a defunct Off Broadway, I'd like to offer playwrights approaching them a handy rule of thumb. It's really a doublepronged rule: (a) Use the workshop for all it's worth; (b) Don't fall in love with it.

title: Dismay Over the Way New York City Has Been Run
description: New York is a tale of two cities: One is poor, violent, sustained by welfare; the other is workoriented and jobcreating.

title: Patrick de Richemont, Anne Hart Green Wed In an Ecumenical Rite
description: The Brick Presbyterian Church was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Anne Hart Green, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alex Hart Green of New York, to Vicomte Patrick de Richemont, son Of the Vicomte and Vicomtesse Jean de Richemont of Paris and Rochebrune, France.

title: Margot Pyne To Wed Oct. 16
description: Margaret Franchot Pyne and Maxwell Rolston Marston 3d plan to be married Oct. 16 in Southport, Conn. Mr. and Mrs. Grafton Howland Pyne Jr. of Southport have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mrs. Shelton Pitney of Southport and Mr. Marston Jr. of Old Lyme, Conn.

title: H.U.D. Finishes Fund Disbursal To Aid Housing
description: The Federal Department of Housing and Urban Development has completed disbursal of more than $150 million in funds for lowincome and moderateincome housing, recreation facilities, and other community improvements in the metropolitan area.

title: THE BLIND TAUGHT ART OF SELFDEFENSE
description: Dark city streets and empty subway cars may be a frightening prospect for the average New Yorker, but for the blind the possibility of unexpected attack looms even larger.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
Anne M. Beecher Bride Of Russell Curtis Johnson
description: Anne Marguerite Beecher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mathew J. Beecher of Ramsey, N.J., and Russell Curtis Johnson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Johnson of Mahwah, N.J. were married yesterday by the Rev. Francis McGuire in St. Paul's Roman Catholic Church in Ramsey.

title: As Rosh haShanah Approaches, Plight of World Jews Is Stressed
description: The plight of Soviet Jews and the precarious position of Israel in the Middle East were stressed by Jewish leaders at the approach of Rosh haShanah, the Jewish New Year, 5737.

title: Sumac Fire
description: Some say that sumac's color signals the autumnal equinox, though they cannot readily explain why an occasional branch or even a whole clump turns color in late August. In any case, by now most of the sumacs at the roadside and in the corner of the back pasture begin to look like Sioux war bonnets and are ready to lead the parade right into Indian summer. They are full of the most brilliant reds one will see until the maples take over.

title: DINING OUT
description: SANS SOUCI means carefree (it was the name of Frederick the Great's 18thcentury creampuff palace in Prussia), but what distinguishes the Sans Souci restaurant is caring on the part of the owners and staff. Dinner in the creamandgold dining rooms is delightful.

title: Beatrice Oswald Bride
description: Beatrice LaTurno Oswald, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Oswald of Capac, Mich., was married in New York yesterday to William H. Dom son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Edward Dorr of Forest Hills, Queens. The ceremony was performed by the. Rev. Thomas A. Nielson in St. Patrick's Cathedral. The bridegroom Is an accountant for the Texaco Oil Corporation. The bride's father is supervisor of St. Clair County in Michigan. Her husband's father is the former controller of the Sinclair Oil Corporation and the Atlantic Richfield Oil Corporation in New York.

title: Misses Wade And Stove in Tennis Final
description: ATLANTA, Sept. 18 (AP)Betty Stove and Virginia Wade will meet tomorrow in the final of the $75,000 national women's indoor tennis championships following their semifinal victories today.

title: The New Adventures of Tom Jones
description: LOS ANGELESWhen the corporate chieftains who make their living in the highstakes world of international arms sales gathered in England two weeks ago to show off their newest flying machines. there was a familiar figure.

title: The Eye of Paris Looks Inward
description: PARIS Braissai has just turned 77, but a stroll with him around his beloved Montparnasse quickly reveals that his visual sense is as sharp as ever. He frequently urges you to savor some chance compositionsuch as a hand (dark, male and hairy) abandoned on a female bottomwith the obsessive glee of a man whose eyes have not stopped photographing the streets of Paris for half a century. His sense of fun and evident enjoyment of life make him astonishingly young. Yet he becomes above all someone who has lived through and recorded an epoch that already belongs to history.

title: Karin S. Irwin Becomes Bride
description: At the Centennial Evangelical Lutheran Church in Kimberton, Pa., yesterday morning, Karin Sue Irwin, a former researcher and associate producer of film documentaries for WNBCTV in New York, was married to George Leslie Dorsett. He is an aviation economist with Eastern Airlines in Miami. The Rev. James Munz performed the ceremony and the Rev. Vincie Alessi assisted.

title: FISHING
description: BLUEFISH, working their way Baround Long Island, finally made it to the Cholera Banks, Shrewsbury Rocks and Norton's Point last week, thus ending a 2month scarcity of this popular game fish in North Jersey waters.

title: India Is Lifting Rules on Press For Foreigners
description: NEW DELHI, Sept. 18The Indian Government, in a gesture of good will toward foreign correspondents working here, announced today that it was withdrawing the censorship regulations that it has tried for the past year to impose upon them.

title: Raven Quothed As a Street Fair Honors Poet Poe
description: Under the kind of gloomy skies that Edgar Allan Poe might have appreciated, the 84th Street Block Association of Manhattan yesterday honored the poet with its fifth annual street fair. But the atmosphere in the neighborhood wehere Poe once lived was anything but gloomy.

title: Buckeyes Are Paced by Logan, Gerald
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Sept. 18  Nothing will change much in Ohio State's style of play as long as Woody Hayes is the coach. The Buckeyes win with a grinding, plodding, powerful offense, a style evident. today when they drove for two touchdowns without ever thinking of a pass. This enabled them In heat Penn State, 127, before a record crowd of 62,503 fans in Beaver Stadium and a regional television audience.

description: TROY, Mich.This month the S.S. Kresge Company will open 36 new K mart discount stores around the country.

title: POLITICS
description: O once a judge, always a judge, barring a felony. That has been the only slightly exaggerated effect bipartisan endorsements of sitting judges, who are almost guaranteed renomination and reelection unless they have been grossly and provably incompetent or venal.

title: Crimson Conquers Columbia, 34 to 10
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Sept. 18  The earliest opening in Ivy League football history at Harvard Stadium provided pleasant weather and no surprises today. As expected, the Crimson rolled to a 3410 triumph over Columbia in a game punctuated by many penalties.

title: Commodity Speculators Anticipate a Dip in the Pool
description: Commodity speculators, the oldest breed of gamblers in the marketplace, now have another game to play: the commodity pool. This idea is based on the ordinary mutual fund that is offered investors in the securities market.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION advanced strongly in August, rising 0.5 percent and bringing the index to 131.4, close to the prerecession levels, the Federal Reserve Board reported. . . . Housing starts rose by 151,000 units, or about 11 percent in August to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.54 million, the Commerce Department said. . . . Personal income in August advanced at the slowest pace in 13 months up 0.4 percent to an adjusted $1.39 trillion annual rate.

title: EPISCOPALIAN BODY ADOPTS PRAYER BOOK
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Sept. 18 (AP)Lay and clerical representatives of the Episcopal Church approved today a new version of their Book of Common Prayer, the first extensive revision of it since the Protestant Reformation in the 16th century.

title: Flushing Picks Up Where It Left Off in 75
description: Jim Maugeri, who Inherited a Flushing team that went scoreless in 1974 and coached it to the P.S.A.L. Class B championship last year, smiled broadly yesterday as his Red Devils opened the season with a 60 triumph over Poly Prep at the loser's field in Brooklyn.

title: Boy Killed in L.I. Car Crash
description: NORTH HAVEN, L.L, Sept. 18 (UPI) A 17yearold boy was killed and four of his friends were injured late last night when their car went off a road in North Haven, L.I., and struck a utility pole, the Southampton Town police reported. The driver of the car, Steven Kulakoski, 20, of South Drive, North Haven, L.I., was arrested after the acident and charged with driving while intoxicated and criminal possession of a controlled substance, a small amount of marijuana, according to the police. Eric Pickering of Ferry Road, North Haven, was killed in the accident. Mr. Kulakoski, his brother, James, 16; Christopher Farnam, 17, of Oak Drive, Noyack, Li., and Richard Lespesa, 14, of Germaine Avenue, Sag Harbor, L. I., were injured.

title: ABOUT NEW JERSEY
description: BEFORE summer comes to Its official end, and while it is still warm enough to use them occasionally, I'd like to discuss swimming pools, about which I have become somewhat of a student.

title: Everybody Hated Seagull
description: The monks are currently listening to William Manchester's The Glory and the Dream during lunch and supper. The book is a good one for reading in the refectory. It is long enough, 1,300 pages, to give a feeling of continuity to our days and weeks; it is nonfiction, the sale explicit requirement for mealtime reading (although I can remember two times when the rule has been broken in the last three or four years); it is timely, being a history of the United States from 1932 to 19,2; and it. is easy to read and easy to listen to.

title: SHOP TALK
description: IN another time, the local meeting place was the corner candystore, where the main attractions were the nickel chocolate bars, the dime comics and the neighborhood girls, not necessarily in that order.

title: Keystone Ore Wins Race
description: HAZEL PARK, Mich., Sept. 18 (UPI) Keystone Ore, driven by Stanley Dancer, captured the Brown Jug pacing trial by two lengths last night at the Hazel Park harness raceway.

Haden: Rhodes Scholar for Rams
description: Pat Haden thought he had played his final football game on New Year's Day 1975, and it was a nice way to go out. Haden threw a touchdown pass to his friend, John McKay, in the last minute as Southern California upset Ohio State in the Rose Bowl. This afternoon the 23yearold Haden will start his first game in the National Football League for the Los Angeles Rams against the Minnesota Vikings. It is the N.F.L.'s gameoftheweek and you can watch Haden and the others on television, Channel 2 in New York, starting at 4 P.M.

title: Synthesizer Duo and Computer Evoke Music's Sensuous Side
description: The downtown newmusic season got under way officially Friday night with two interesting concerts of electronic musicEar Food, a live synthesizer duo at Environ, 476 Broadway, and Laurie Spiegel's computer music as the beginning of a new latenight weekend series of contemporary concerts at the American Theater Laboratory, 219 West 19th Street.

title: Showy Perennials To Plant This Month
description: Although many beginning gardeners may not realize it, autumn is a great planting season. Any perennials set out now will have a headstart to develop a strong root system. Top growth should be trimmed back to a height of an inch or two so all energies will go toward root formation.

title: PEOPLE
description: Dr. Bernard L. Pollack, who seta out again next month on a hungerfighting visit to 14 African nations, is a dedicated agronomist who sums up his mission simply: It's better to teach people how to grow food today than it is to fight them for it tomorrow. The world's next major war will be fought over food, unless something is done right now to stop it. Dr. Pollack, a Cooperative Extension Service specialist in vegetable crops at Cook College, formerly the College of Agriculture at Rutgers University, has made three previous trips to places like Senegal, Upper Volta, Niger and Gambia to teach nearly starving people in droughtstricken areas how best to apply their primitive tools to the land and the available water resources. He also has developed and introduced crop seeds best suited for those arid areas. The newest African tour, on which Dr. Pollack will be accompanied by his wife, Sonia, a teacher in South Brunswick, will last six months.

title: F.B.I. Report on Police Deaths
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 (UPI)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation has reported that 75 state and local police officers died in the line of duty in the United States and Puerto Rico in the first eight months of 1976, as against

title: Dispensing Justice
description: WESTBURY WHEN a person arrives on the fourth floor of the Roosevelt Building to participate in vital business of the United States Court for the Eastern District, one of the first things he sees is a picture of a bikiniclad woman suggesting that the Caribbean is the ideal place to visit.

title: Armbro Regina Triumphs In Liberty Bell Trot
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 18Armbro Regina rallied from last place in the 12horse field tonight and won the Colonial Trot at Liberty Bell. Zoot Suit was second and Pershing finished third. Armbro Regina, owned by the Armstrong brothers of Brampton, Ontario. trotted the mile in 2:00 4/5, a record for a 3yearold filly on a fiveeighthsmile track. She returned $10.60 for $2 to win. Joe O'Brien was aboard.

description: ITHACA, N.Y. Sept. 18Chris Howe kicked a 23yard field early in the fourth quarter today and gave Princeton a 30 victory over Cornell today in the teams' season opener.

title: Linda Baylis Becomes the Bride Of Robert P. Zanes 3d, Sailmaker
description: Linda Baylis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. J. Robert Baylis of Madison, Conn., was married there yesterday to Robert Parker Zanes 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Zanes, also of Madison?? The Rev. Franklin Bower and the Rev. Gerard Schmitz officiated at the ceremony in the First Congregational Church.

title: To the outback and back again
description: She had fame and glamour; she had the recognition for serious work in films like All About Eve; she had common and uncommon frustration and humiliationlike Orson Welles pawing her mercilessly enroute home from shooting The Magnificent Ambersons. All in all, Anne Baxter was a movie star.Then, precipitously, she left Hollywood and went to live in a place called Giro, a house made of tin boxes, a cattle station in the Australian outback. Giro became her Everest frogs in the toilet bowls, sludge on the floors, a generator providing power only two hours a day. She learned making do with less, unspoiling herself. First she felt purified and triumphant, then caged, then restless.

title: Connecticut Is Blocking U.S. Antipollution Funds To New York and Jersey
description: HARTFORD, Sept. 18 (UPI)Connecticut is holding up almost $21.4 billion in Federal funds for New York and New Jersey because of differences in air pollution standards, the state's Environmental Commissioner, Joseph N. Gill, said yesterday.

title: The Tennis Clinic
description: In the United States Open men's final, Bjorn Borg. used a Bancroft wood racquet weighing 14 ounces, a monster. Jimmy Connors used a lighter Wilson T2000 metal. Borg's racquet was strung with gut at about 75 pounds of tensionextremely tight. Connors's was more loosely strung. Connors won the match. Did his racquet make the difference?

description: Today: Leading Events

title: BRIDGE
description: The proverbial Inability of the leopard to change its spots is shared by the bridge expert, an equally formidable carnivore in his chosen jungle. The expert will sometimes stare at the spots with which he has been provided by the chance of the deal and wish that a five would suddenly change into a six.

title: Alan Vanzo Sings Faust Stylishly
description: The Paris Opera's unusual, not to say peculiar, production of Faust was given two performances at the Metropolitan Opera House. And in the second, on Friday night, there was a new tenor in the title role. He was Alain Vanzo, a native of Monte Carlo and French trained, who had not previously sung on New York's opera's stage.

description: In celebration of its 25th anniversary, the United Nations Postal Administration is issuing on Oct. 8 four commemorative stamps that depart in several ways from all other U.N. stamps to make the occasion of special import to collectors.

description: The marriage of Beverley Thornton Sener, daughter of Joseph Ward Sener Jr. of Church Hill, Md., and the late Ann Clark Ten Eyck Sener, to Aubin Rougon Luecker took place yesterday in Church Hill. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. George Edwin Luecker of Reston, Va. The Rev. William E. Ticknor performed the ceremony in St. Luke's Episcopal Church.

description: In his new book Ralph Nader argues that giant corporations victimize their shareholders, employees, customers and neighboring communities.

title: Novels by Richard Yates, Lois Gould, Ishmael Reed
description: The journey from innocence to experience, from illusion to reality, has long been a traditional undertaking of the novel. Easter Parade, the fifth novel of Richard Yates, plays with this tradition as he describes a journey from innocence to renewed innocence, from illusion to fresh ??usion.

title: Miscellany
Ens. Gregory White Weds Mary H. Rossiter, Nurse
description: Mary Heath Rossiter and Ens. Gregory Joseph White, U.S.N., who were classmates at Vanderbilt University, were married yesterday in Summit, N.J. The Rev. William Strain performed the ceremony in Calvary Episcopal Church. He was assisted by the Rev. John Eagon, a Roman Catholic priest.

description: An invitation to adults who can read to teach reading to those who cannot has been extended by the Brooklyn Library and the nonprofit Literacy Volunteer organization.

title: JERSEY TEA PARTY PLANNED FOR BYRNE
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Sept. 18More than 350 demonstrators carried a crate of tea as a symbol of the Boston Tea Party today to the doorstep of Morven, the official residence of Governor Byrne, to protest New Jersey's recently enacted income tax law.

title: Harlem Heights Battle Revisited: Americans Briefly Turned Tide
description: Revolutionary War historians have seriously underestimated the significance of the Battle of Harlem Heights, according to a Columbia University historian who believes the strong American showing in the battle buoyed flagging Army morale at a critical point in the war.

title: I Am Not Movie Star! I Am Only Man From Street!
description: Los ANGELES Today is the 21st day of shooting of The Turning Point. The company, having completed its location work in New York, has moved west to take over Stage 15 at the Twentieth CenturyFox studios. The milieu of The Turning Point is the ballet, and the screenplay by Arthur Laurents is concerned with the continuity of the art, and the steep, emotional price that dedication to it exacts from its artists. A woman can't be a ballerina and raise a family, too; it's either/or. In the film, Anne Bancroft is the eitherthe star ballerina; Shirley Maclaine's the orthe Texas housewife. Miss MacLaine's daughter, played by newcomer Leslie Browne, has reached the moment of that decisionthe turning pointthat her mother faced 20 years before.

title: California Typifies Lack of Interest Shown Across Nation in Campaign
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 18Local Democrats received assurances last night, The San Diego Union reported this week, that the drive to elect Jimmy Carter is finally getting under way in San Diego.

title: Dave Anderson
description: He's known as Candy, but he doesn't melt in your mouth. And he especially doesn't melt in a pennant race. John Candelaria, at the untender age of 22, has emerged as the big rock candy mountain of the Pittsburgh Pirates pitching staff. In the Pirates pursuit of the Philadelphia Phillies in the National League East,the heat of his fast ball has been exceeded only by the cool of his maturity. After his 15th victory in the Pirates twogame sweep in Philadelphia, the 6foot7inch lefthander quietly discussed his role as if he had been in the big leagues for 15 years instead of 15 months.

title: Charles Anthony Vogt Marries Gail Anderson
description: Gail Anderson and Charles Anthony Vogt, graduates of Colorado College, were married yesterday afternoon in Charlotte, Vt. Frederick N. Anderson Jr., father of the bride and a justice of the peace, performed the ceremony at the Anderson home.

title: Suffering, surviving, enjoying
description: On the grounds of the Federally supported Lebe Hoch home for retarded children in Texas there was a strange structure with heavy black plastic covering all the windows, writes Kenneth Wooden in his Weeping in the Playtime of Others. It was the domain of a psychiatrist who believed socalled retarded children have intellectual facilities aborted at birth The solution? To recreate the mother's womb in these totally darkened moms and place the retarded child there to grow.

Theater
Miss Marple's last case
description: The publication in 1926 of Agatha Christie's fourth and most famous detective story, The Murder of Roger Ackroyd, coincided with the most curious event of her life. A few days after the novel appeared, Mrs. Christie disappeared. Traced to a health resort in the north of England a few weeks later, she was pronounced a victim of amnesia; but in contrast to her books, the mystery remained unsolved. Although rumors of a romantic episode were firmly denied, she divorced Col. Archibald Christie shortly afterwards and in 1930 married the archeologist Max Mallowan. In later life the prolific and wealthy Dame Agatha always refused to discuss the subject. When her biography is written, it will appropriately require an element of detection. There are clues to be followed up here, evidence to be checked, perhaps documents and alibis to be investigated

title: Model Warriors
description: WANTAGH THE German warplane raced desperately through the haze, a determined French pilot manning the controls of the steelgray fighter in hot pursuit only inches off its fail. Suddenly, an unexpected turn and the two craft collided, their wings and fuselages splintering and raining toward the ground as hundreds of spectators looked on in horror.

description: SANDY HOOK. N.J., Sept. 18A group of 350 children, elderly people, government offiicals and New York Waterfront lovers set out for Sandy Hook by boat today in the last trip of a summer??long program.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: THERE are many Long Islands and it is almost magical how quickly one disappears and another swifty materializes. Here is suburban Long Island, the neat assembly of houses behind immaculate lawns along curving lanes and streets set apart from the scrub and commerce of the main routes; they are tributaries of the great city to the west, its frontier settlements, whether they wish to call themselves so or not. And next to them is the Long Island that has been brushed by the metropolitan area but is not part of it; this is the Long Island that still speaks of the country, each hamlet with its own flavor and independent of the urban collar that gets a little tighter around its neck each year.

description: SALEM THE era of nuclear power is at hand in South Jersey in the form of a trickle of heat from a reactor known simply as Salem No. 1.

title: North Leads Ohio Golf On 66203
description: MASON, Ohio, Sept. 18 (AP)Andy North rolled in a 6foot birdie putt on the final hole today for his third straight belowpar round, a fourunderpar 66, to take a onestroke lead at 203 in the $150,000 Ohio Kings Island open golf tournament.

title: Carter Stand on Taxes Is Focus of a Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18The White House sought today to picture Jimmy Carter as having made a major campaign blunder by suggesting in an interview earlier this week that the income tax burden be shifted toward those with higher incomes and away from those with lower and middle incomes.

Harrold Carswell that might have raised questions about his nomination for a seat on the Supreme Court.

title: Sunday Observer
description: We cut off the children's television because we feared all that violence would turn them into monsters. Soon they were reading the newspapers and at grips with the real world. After a while, we noticed them dressing up in kimonos and playing at the manufacture of superb cameras.

title: City Gardeners Can Grow EverythingAlmost
description: If gardening in general tries a man's soul, making things grow on the 20th floor turns him into a masochist. This breeds timidity in the terrace gardener's approach to what he can tackle safely. How unfortunate! For the city gardener can grow just about anything his country friend does, only he must be more selective and take some extra precautions.

description: Joan Catherine Hennessy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Dean M. Hennessy of West Hartford, Conn., was married there yesterday afternoon to Arthur Webster Wright. The Rev. title: A Last Talk With Piatigorsky
description: I must say I have had an extremely hard life, hard but fascinating. As a little boy in Russia, I heard music at home all the time. My parents played, without really being musicians. They didn't especially encourage or discourage me to become a musicianI was absolutely determined about that myself at an early age.

description: MADRID, Sept. 18Spain's political opposition is preparing to reject a Government plan that calls for elections before next June of a twohouse Parliament that would have power to make changes in constitutional laws that have been in effect in Spain for 40 years.

description: In St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church in New Canaan, Conn., yesterday afternoon, Mary Loretto LeBlond and Kenneth Charles Cyr were married by the Rev. Francis B. Stocker. He was assisted by Msgr. Francis X. McGuire, pastor of the church.

description: Jeannette Antoine Farah was married yesterday afternoon to Charles Jackson Bird, a candidate for a master's degree in political science (Middle East area) at the American University in Beirut, Lebanon.

title: DINING OUT
description: MOST of the veal served in local restaurants tastes as if it could have done time as the tongue of one of Larry Csonka's football shoes. In most places, the fact that the veal is so awful is cleverly hidden by putting it under layers of had cheese and tomato sauce.

title: Dance
The Boom in MiniVacations by Bus
description: The bus was trapped like a fly in the spider web of traffic at 41st Street and Eighth Avenue. I wondered if my weekend tour of the Pennsylvania Dutch country would ever really begin. A newcomer to the world of the escorted motor coach package tour, I had more than my share of doubts about the whole business.

title: CORRECTION
description: An article on research among men with the XYY chromosome pattern that appeared in The Times last Sunday incorrectly identified the principal researcher. He is Dr. Herman Witkin, psychologist at the Educational Testing Service in Princeton.

title: Peter Russell Gray Weds Lynne Sward
description: Lynne Sward, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Sward of Bernardsville, N.J., was married in New York yesterday to Peter Russell Gray, son of Rear Adm. Augustine H. Gray, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Gray of Coronado, Calif. State Supreme Court Justice Richard J. Bartlett performed the ceremony at the clubhouse of the New York Junior League.

title: Films
Reels of Rarities On Film At Lincoln Center
description: Even in New York, the uncontested dance capital of the world, September can be a pretty dull month for dancegoers. The sort of gourmet smorgasbord which New York dance enthusiasts usually take for granted shrinks to something more like a midnight snack. So for those whose insatiable appetite for dance remains unsatisfied, here is a suggestion: visit the wonderful archive of films at the Dance Collection at Lincoln Center's Library and Museum of the Performing Arts (a branch of the New York City Public Library). Here, even during the endofsummer doldrums, one can see Natalia Makarova, Erik Bruhn, Suzanne Farrell and Rudolf Nuruyevon film, and free of charge.

title: POLITICS
description: AFTER weeks of indecision, New Jersey Democratic leaders finally have concluded that it is in their best interest to elect Jinimy Carter as President. It was a conclusion that did not come easily, particularly for State Senator James P. Dugan, the Democratic state chairman.

title: MIG25 Is Described As Unsophisticated
description: TOKYO, Sept. 18 (Reuters)The Soviet M1G25 that landed at Hakodate airport in northern Japan last week is less sophisticated than had been believed, bearing a resemblance more to a manned rocket, informed sources said today.

title: A Late Tally For Rippowam Stops Staples

Playhouse, struck a responsive chord in the Island's theatergoing community last year with a string of new, untried worksthe theater is starting its second season under Jay Broad's stewardship in an enviable position.

description: IN 20 years of suburban living, I've made peace with crabgrass, carpools and the ceramic dwarfs on my neighbor's lawn. I've learned to read the small print in the school budget and grow broccoli that would shame Luther Burbank. Why then, can't I adjust to that favorite of all suburban ritualsthe barbecue?

title: Joan Claire Darcy Is Married to Paul Joseph Sorgi
