title: BILL ON FOREIGN BANKS LOOKS DEAD IN CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (Reuters)A bill thit would have imposed severe restrictions on the operation of foreign banks in the United States appears dead for his year, informed sources said today.

title: 5 INDICTED IN A FRAUD USING TELEPHONE SALES
description: Five former officers of Galaxy Foods, a defunct organization, have been indicted on charges of defrauding 800 residents of Brooklyn, Queens and Long Island of $2.5 million over a twoyear period that ended in September 1973.

title: A New Look at Some Sleek Living in New York
description: As Bloomingdale's sees it, the average New Yorker lives in a converted carriage house in Sniffen Court. Or in a sleek aerie at one of the city's status addresses, such as the Olympic Tower or the Sovereign. Or in a roomy retreat in the Dakota, replete with Old World charm.

title: Carter Assails Role of Lobbyists In looted Mess of Government
description: PORTLAND. Ore., Sept. 27 Jimmy Carter apparently sought today to exploit reports that President Ford had received hospitality from a lobbyist.

title: Business Records
description: MARIO HARPER, 1847 University Ave., Bronx, N.Y. Liabilities 54,768; assets $130.

title: Books of The Times
description: Reviewers aren't supposed to review the book that could or should have been written, but the one thrust upon us. I can't help myself, however. Energy and Conflict could have been an important book. it is, instead, merely interesting.

title: MOYNIHAN IS GIVEN LIBERAL NOMINATION
description: With a simmering rebellion nipped by an unusual appeal from Governor Carey, the New York State Liberal Party last night finally did what virtually everyone expected it to do and overwhelmingly nominated Daniel P. Moynihan for the United States Senate.

title: TV: Big Event Presented Live
description: Even the elements are working against NBCTV this season. Sunday evening's live presentation of The Big Event, a new weekly series of what the network hopes will be superspecial attractions, was structured around three New York parties, and parts of the festivities were scheduled to be performed outdoors. The elaborate plans, however, ran into frequent periods of rain, and the generally soggy gloom permeated most of the indoor routines, turning an already awkward format into an excruciatingly embarrassing, almost pathetic occasion.

title: Walter Unit Closing Gypsum Plant
description: TAMPA, Fla., Sept. 27 (UPI)The Celotex division of the Jim Walter Corporation said that it would close its gypsum board plant at Edgewater, N.J., Oct. 9 because of falling demand. The closing will idle 125 workers. The plant. was built in 1959 and bought by Celotex in 1967 as part of the Barrett division of the Allied Chemical Corporation.

title: Stronger Warnings On Estrogen Labels Ordered by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON Sept. 27 (AP)The Food and Drug Administratin today ordered stronger health warnings on the labels of sex hormones taken by an estimated total of five million women nationwide to relieve the symptoms of menopause.

title: PORTUGUESE OWNERS GET SOME LAND BACK
description: LISBON, Sept. 27Portugal's twomonthold Socialist Government today began to return some illegally occupied farmlands to their original owners. At the same time, it vowed to proceed with new expropriations under the agrarian reform program.

title: Metal Particles Reported in Victims of Legion Illness
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Sept. 27A California pathologist reported today that he had found tiny metal particles in the lungs of four persons who died from a mysterious disease in Pennsylvania. But the findings are too preliminary to be definitive, the doctor said at a news conference at the University of California at San Diego.

title: U.S. Aide Says 3dQuarter Deficit May Be $7 Billion Below Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)The Federal budget deficit in the third quarter of 1976 may be as much as $7 billion below the Ford Administration's estimate, a budget agency official said today.

title: Dividends
description: Dividends

title: Georgia Church Believes Ina Salvation by Faith
description: PLAINS, Ga.  Clarence Dodson called on Brother Jimmy to open the Sunday school lesson with a prayer. Jimmy Carter, the Democratic Presidential candidate, rose to his feet, closed his eyes and asked the Lord to help remove the obstacles that keep us from being close to Thee, for the strength to overcome weakness and for the gift of compassion.

title: Strike by Basques Widely Supported; Clashes Reported
description: BILBAO, Spain, Sept. 27Hundreds of thousands of workers, shopkeepers and students went on strike today in the Basque region of Spain in support of Basque political prisoners and Basque freedoms. There were numerous demonstrations and some brought clashes with the police.

title: Canal Zone Americans Are Beset By Mood of Isolation and Mistrust
description: BALBOA, Canal ZoneWhen the United States Armed Forces Radio recently warned those living in the Canal Zone not to enter Panama because of a wave of student riots there, a mood near to panic gripped the American community.

title: U.S. Reports August Trade Deficit Of $757 Million, Third Largest
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)The United States posted its third largest monthly international trade deficit in August, the Government said today.

title: M.A.C. Assails Moody's as Unfit, Demands it Not Rate Agency Bonds
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation stepped up its feud with Moody's Investors Service yesterday by demanding that the creditrating agency disqualify itself from evaluating M.A.C. bonds on the ground that the president of Moody's had written a reprehensible letter about New York City.

title: Redundant Study
description: It is difficult to argue with the categorical statement by Kenneth B. Clark, veteran participant in and observer of decades of educational crises, that the New York City public schools need another study like New York City needs more deficits. Dr. Clark's remarks were prompted by the decision of the State Board of Regents to launch a major study of the school system's educational effectiveness, cost and governance.

title: Tiant, Sutton Honored For Getting 20 Victories
description: Luis Tiant, Boston's pitching ace who posted his 20th and 21st victories of the season last week, was named yesterday the American League's player of the week for last week.

title: Guide Dog of an Inwood Man Shot and Killed by Policeman
description: INWOOD, L.I., Sept. 27A dog that had been a guide and companion for a 31yearold man who is going blind was shot and killed by a Nassau County police officer Saturday atter the officer thought the dog was going to attack him.

title: The Allen Filibuster
description: While the country has been diverted the last few days by the Presidential debate, portentous news from southern Africa and the end of a couple of pennant races, a shameful but littlenoticed action has been taking place on the floor of the United States Senate. Senator James Allen of Alabama with the help of only a couple of colleagues has managed to paralyze the world's greatest deliberative body for six days by means of an oldfashioned Bilbostyle anticivil rights filibuster.

title: A Private Glimpse at a Private Eye: Long Hours, Tedious Work, No Riches
description: He is listed in the Yellow Pages under InvestigatorsPrivate, and Spiesman is his real name. Agencies like Burns and Pinkerton, which share the page, have big ads and lots of employees, most of whom, these days, work as security guards or matrimonial specialists. Anthony Spiesman has worked for those companies, too, but he's selfemploved now and of the roughly 900 detectives in New York City, he appears to be one of the few genuine private eyes remaining of the Sam Spade variety.

title: AMERICAN SHIP MERGE IS NOT OPPOSED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)The Tustice Department announced today that It would not oppose the American Ship Building Company's plan to acquire certain Pennsylvania drydock facilities now held by the Erie Marine division of Litton Industries.

title: Bridge:
description: Players with ambition and talent can reasonably expect that hard work and the passage of time will make them expert bidders. The transition from competent to expert is much harder in the field of play, and many never succeed in making it however hard they try.

title: 7 INMATES ESCAPE FROM RIKERS ISLAND
description: Seven prisoners, including two charged with slaying two armoredcar guards in a Times Square movie house last April, sawed their way out of the House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island in early morning darkness yesterday, city correction officials reported.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Article 1  No Title

title: assoclated Press
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Sept. 27 The bodies of the three Arabs hanged this morning remained for a time suspended by ropes from a simple wooden frame in the heart of Damascus.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Monday.

title: Carter Assails Role of Lobbyists in Bloated Mess of Government
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Sept. 27 Jimmy Carter apparently sought today to exploit reports that President Ford had received hospitality from a lobbyist.

title: How to Support a Charity And Survive While Doing It
description: One guest choked on a lettuce leaf. Two guests had a little tiff. Four guests wore two dress designs between them.

title: Homosexuality is Plot Gimmick In Three Series on Television
description: This week's premium plot gimmick appears to be homosexuality. Tonight at 10, ABC's Family begins a regular weekly series with son Willie (Gary Frank) discovering that Zeke (Bryan Byers), his best friend since childhood, has been arrested in a homosexual bar. Tomorrow at 9.30, Alice, the heroine of a new CBS series based on the film Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore, dates and flirts with a virile type exfootball player only to have him announce that he is homosexual.

title: E.P.A. is Called Lax in Protecting Scientists Involved in Research
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Federal agency responsible for protecting Americans against cancercausing substances and other poisons in the environment has failed to protect hundreds of its own scientists, according to a draft report of the General Accounting Office.

title: City Opera Cancels Shows in Dispute With Musicians
description: The New York City Opera, locked in a contract dispute with the musicians union, yesterday canceled all performantes until further notice. Immediately affected is tonight's scheduled performance of La Traviata.

title: Hay Fever Time at an End, After Unusually Mild Season
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Sept. 27Good news was recorded here today for New Jerseyans who suffer from seasonal allergic rhinitis, also known as hay fever.

title: The Bland and the Bored
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept 27Have we carried the commitment against ideological politics too fax? a liberal Illinois Democrat wondered out loud the other day.

title: U.S. Fights a Move In Congress to Bar Missiles for Saudis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Administration launched a lobbying effort today to deter Congress from blocking a sale of missiles to Saudi Arabia. A State Department official said such an action could lead to an increase in oil prices for the United States.

title: Milner Slam Sparks 103 Met Victory
description: John Milner, winding up his finest season as a Met, enjoyed his most outstanding game at Shea Stadium last night when he drove in six runs with a grand slam and a tworun homer as the Mets trounced the Montreal Expos, 103.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Virginia Radcliffe Hurst Dies; Was Writer and Conservationist
description: Virginia Radcliffe Hurst, known under her maiden name as a writer on the islands of the Caribbean and on Fire Island, died of cancer Friday in her home in Davis park, Fire Island. She was 62 years old.

title: Chessie System to Buy National Mine Shares
description: Chessie System Inc., a major railroad. announced it had agreed to acquire 22 percent of the outstanding shares of the National Mine Service Company of Pittsburgh from Thomas Dockrell Sons and Company of Dublin. The purchase price is about $18.8 million.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BARGING IN There's a port in every borough in New York City, and the New York Festival Barge will have put in at all of them by the time it completes its long statewide Bicentennial voyage.

title: Advice to Auditors Finding Bribery
description: In the two and a half years since the Watergate Special Prosecution Force was set up, 150 American corporationsshoved unwillingly by the Securities and Exchange Commission but not by their accountantshave disclosed voluntarily that they made questionable or illegal payments, ranging from the Exxon Corporation's $46 million to politicians in Italy to Santa Fe International's $66,140 to unidentified forei Eners.

title: Broadway Lures 2 Song Writers From Hubbub of Industrial Shows
description: There was little good news for New Yorkers last Dec. 1. A garbage strike was beginning, the Jets had just lost their eighth straight game and the city was enduring confirmal rebuke from its new fiscal sovereigns in Washington.

title: Options Plan Gets Approval of S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission, in a significant policy decision, gave its preliminary endorsement today to a proposal by the National Association of Securities Dealers that marketmakers be permitted to deal in both options and their underlying securities.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: MOYNIHAN IS GIVEN LIBERAL NOMINATION
description: With a simmering rebellion nipped by an unusual appeal from Governor Carey, the New York State Liberal Party last night finally did what virtually everyone expected it to do and overwhelmingly nominated Daniel P. Moynihan for the United States Senate.

title: Crash Kills One, Injures Three
description: KEARNY, N. J., Sept. 27 (UPI)  A woman was killed and three persons were injured critically yesterday in a twocar crash on the Wittpenn Bridge over the Hackensack River. Mariana Velasco, 30 years old, of Jersey City died when the car driven by her husband, David, 41, collided with an auto driven by Andre Hartman, 48, of Belleville. Mr. Hartman, Mr. Velasco and Betty Munoz, 31, of New York, a passenger in the Velasco car, were admitted to the West Hudson Hospital in critical condition.

title: Noon
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn.The andent Greeks had a word for me. They would have called me a private man, in contrast to a publicspirited man. The word for private man was uncomplimentary. it came to mean rude, clumsy, selfish. But I suggest that if Pericles were alive today, he might be inclined to join me and millions of Americansthe polls predict we may run as high as 70 percent of those eligiblewho won't bother to vote in the coming Presidential election.

title: KISSINGER AIDE SAYS BLACK LEADERS DENY RHODESIA REJECTION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Several black African leaders have informed the United States that their statement on Rhodesia yesterday was not meant as a rejection of the BritishAmerican plan for black majority rule in Rhodesia, a high State Department official said today.

title: Basic Resources to Share Oil With Shenandoah
description: Basic Resources International S.A. announced that it and the Shenandoah Oil Corporation had jointly acquired the 25 percent interest in their Guatemala oil concession that has been held by Saga Petroleum A.S. & Company. The acquisition price wasn't announced.

title: Gulls and Fishermen Ply an Ancient Trade Together on L.I.
description: ORIENT POINT, L. I.The gulls know who has made the best catch. By the hundreds they follow one fishing boat and ignore all the others.

title: Soviet Jewish War Hero Buried In Jerusalem in a Military Rite
description: TEL AVIV, Sept. 27Col. Yefim Davidovich, a Soviet Red Army hero who was stripped of his rank, medals and pension after he applied to emigrate to Israel, was reburied in Jerusalem today as a newly commissioned honorary colonel of the Israel armed forces.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 27The state's swine flu vaccine is expected to begin arriving from the manufacturers early next week, although the first shipment will be smaller than promised.

title: McCarthy on Texas Ballot
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 27 (UPI) Justice Lewis Powell ortdered today that the name of Eugene J. McCarthy be placed on the November ballot in Texas. Justice Powell said he had consulted informally with the eight other members of the Court and was authorized to say that a majority would grant the request of the independent candidate for President for the order.

title: Fatah Blames an Iraqi Unit
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 27Spokesmen for the Palestine Liberation Organization and Al Fatah denied involvement In the Syrian raid and blamed a dissident group in Baghdad, headed by Abou Nidal, who was expelled from Fatah in 1970.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 3 P.M. on SouthWest Africa.

title: Ali Confident in Bout With Norton Tonight
description: We can rebuild him, say the bionic doctors each week as they assemble television's fictional Six Million Dollar Man for another round of exploits. We can make him faster and stronger.

title: Skins Beat Eagles, 2017, In Overtime
description: PHILADELPHIA. Sept. 27 (AP)Mark Moseley s 29yard field goal with 12 minutes 49 seconds gone in suddendeath overtime carried the unbeaten Washington Redskins to a National Football League victory over the Philadelphia Eagles tonight, 2017, at Veterans Stadium.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: COCOA

title: Libertarian Convention Cheers Denunciation of Big Governments
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)Libertarian Party activists listened, took notes and cheered enthusiastically for four days as one speaker after another, usually college professors, praised civil liberties and denounced big government.

title: Democratic Chief Gets $39,000 Post In Nassau County
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Sept. 27After several months of controversy, Stanley Harwood, the chairman of the Nassau County Democratic committee, was appointed today to a vacancy on the County Board of Elections by the Board of Suoervisors.

title: Palestinian Units in Lebanon Adopt Defiant Policy in Wake of Setbacks
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Sept. 27The Palestinian leaders in Lebanon have adopted a policy of defiance in the wake of their military setbacks.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: The New York Times/Frank C. Dougherty

title: Will Ali Kayo the Nonbelievers?
description: On the cloudymorning after Muhammad All had deflated and dethroned George Foreman in Zaire, the world's heavyweight champion was twirling an ivoryinlaid mahogany cane outside his Congo River villa: As he gloated, he was asked if it had meant more to him to regain the title in Africa than anywhere else. I'd rather have done it in Madison Square Garden or Yankee Stadium,. he said. That's where the bulk of the nonbelievers are. The nonbelievers, the fight crowd. Finally, nearly two years after appearances in Cleveland, Las Vegas, Kuala Lumpur, Manila, San Juan, Landover, Munich and Tokyo during his second reign, Muhammad Ali will be on display against Ken Norton tonight for the nonbelievers, the real fight crowd in Yankee Stadium under the auspices of the Madison Square Garden promoters. But there aren't many nonbelievers now. Even those who don't acknowledge he's The Greatest agree he's a candidate. The only argument for the few nonbelievers is that despite 37 knockouts in his 52 triumphs, Muhammad Ali cannot really punchnot like Rocky Marciano could, not like Joe Louis could, not like Jack Dempsey could. But in a plot perhaps designed for those few nonbelievers, Muhammad Ali tonight will try to prove that he can really punch.

title: Dictaphone Plans to Make Offer to Data Documents
description: Data Documents Inc announced that it had received an indication from the Dictaphone Corporation that the latter would soon make a cash tender offer for all of the common stock of Data Documents of about $45 a share. Data Documents, which manufactures tabulating cards and business forms, has 468,800 common shares outstanding.

title: San Diego Turns Down Padre Bid for Loan Aid
description: SAN DIEGO, Sept. 27 (UPI)A city council committee rejected today a proposal by the San Diego Padres to delay repayment of a debt owed by the National League club.

title: Advertising
description: New Times magazine, founded just before the trough of the recession, celebrates its third anniversary with its Oct. 4 issue carrying 44 pages of advertising. it will be its biggest to date.

title: POOLING ON NUCLEAR FUEL URGED AT ENERGY PARLEY
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 27 (UPI)The Yugoslav delegate to the 20th general conference of the International Atomic Energy Agency proposed today an international nuclear fuel cycle pool, allowing nations to contribute or withdraw money, technology and fuel, according to their resources and needs.

title: Paris Mounts Honor Guard For a Mummy
description: PARIS, Sept. 27 And the children of Israel journeyed from Ramses, the Book of Exodus says in describing the flight of the Jews from the oppressive Pharaoh.

title: TAX RISE IN SUFFOLK PROPOSED IN BUDGET
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I, Sept. 27John V. N. Klein, the Suffolk County Executive, disclosed his 1977 budget proposals today, recommending tax increases of 29 percent for some property owners and 18 percent for others and the layoff of about 270 county workers.

title: Army Passing Cornbjnation: 2 ExArchrivals
description: Hall, the Army quarterback who throws to Brundidge these days, leads the nation in passing and total offense so far. These two athletes went against each other in their high school seasons, in Florida, when Brundidge played both offense and defense for Oviedo High School and Hall was the quarterback for Apopka High School. Brundidge said:

title: Robert T. Guyton is Dead at 38; Banker and Business Executive
description: Robert T. Guyton, a banker with many business interests in Nevada, Ohio and New York, died Saturday of acute peritonitis at the Medical College Hospital in Toledo, Ohio. He was 38 years old.

title: Issues in the Police Officer Dispute
description: PARTICIPANTS: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, which represents 18,000 police officers, and the Beame administration, whose chief negotiator in the talks, which began almost five months ago, has been the First Deputy Mayor John E. Zuccotti.

title: May Agrees to Bulls Terms; All Top Draft Picks Signed
description: Scott May, the college player or Tile year at Indiana University and the first player selected in the college draft, signed a longterm contract yesterday with the Chicago Bulls. The 6foot7inch, 220pound May was the last of the first round draft choices to agree to terms. Over the weekend, Wally Walker of Virginia ended his holdout with the Portland Trail Blazers and Mitch Kupchak of North Carolina signed with the Washington Bullets.

title: A Farmer Takes LongShot Aim At Thompson's Seat in the House
description: TRENTON, Sept. 27The Fourth Congressional District, a weird configuration that juts out in all directions from its base here in the state's capital, has long been a political graveyard for Republicans seeking to deny reelection to Representative Frank Thompson Jr.

title: Mark Almond Back To a Packed House At the Bottom Line
description: The Mark/Almond Band returned to New York Sunday evening after a twoandahalfyear absence. Originally formed by two graduates of John Mayall's blues band, Jon Mark and Johnny Almond, the group was disbanded while the musicians pursued individual careers. The reunion may have been dictated, at least in part, by economic considerations, because neither Mr. Mark nor Mr. Almond was able to expand his audiences significantly. But the group's shows at the Bottom Line on Sunday made it evident that the reunion had also been generated by genuine mutual respect.

title: Connally Law Firm Contributes $1,000 to Ford, $2,000 to Carter
description: HOUSTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)A committee composed of members of John B. Connally's law firm has contributed $18,000 to political candidates, almost all of it to Democrats, including Jimmy Carter, the party's Presidential nominee.

title: Rangers Tie Flyers, 3 to 3, On Murdoch's Second Goal
description: Playing his first exhibition game as it Ranger, Don Murdoch scored two goals last night at Madison Square 3arden as New York and the Philadelphia Flyers battled to a 3.3 tie. The Rangers No. 1 draft choice, Murdoch aad missed the first three exhibition contests after suffering a head cut that reauired 37 stitches.

title: Meadowlands
description: SECOND$15,000, pace, cl., mile.

title: Analysts Call Ford's Gain in Poll A. Factor in Stocks Rise of 3.82
description: An indicated improvement in President Ford's position among the American electorate helped push the Dow Jones industrial average to higher ground yesterday, the key barometer gaining 3.82 to close at 1,013.13 in moderate trading.

title: World Trade Center: A City by Itself With Its Own Neighborhood Air
description: At the entrance to the Sky Dive, a bustling, moderately priced cafeteria on the 44th floor of one of the 110story twin towers of the World Trade Center is a bulletin board carrying handwritten or typed offers to sell everything from puppies and kittens to automobiles or furniture.

title: FederalState Team Checking Discharge Into Niagara River
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Sept. 27 (AP) A team of Federal and state scientists began a threeday study of the Hooker Chemicals and Plastics Corporation plant today to determine if the plant is discharging Mirex into the Niagara River.

title: Mondale Spends a Day at Home
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)Senatot Walter F. Mondale, the Democratic VicePresidential candidate, took a day off from campaigning today and worked at his home in Washington, aides said. MC. Mondale is to return to the campaign tomorrow when he begins a threeday swing through Ohio, Wisconsin and Pennsylvania. The Republican Vice Presidential candidate, Senator Robert J. Dole, will be campaigning in the same area.

title: Syrians Stare at Hanged Raiders
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Sept. 27  The bodies of the three Arabs hanged this morning remained for a time suspended by ropes from a simple wooden frame in the heart of Damascus.

title: Authority Asserts Port is Injured By Conrail's Monopoly on Freight
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said yesterday that Conrail's nearmonopoly of rail freight service in the Northeast tended to favor the Port of Baltimore at the expense of the Port of New York.

title: University Strike Ends
description: DETROIT, Sept. 27 (AP)Wayne State University and three unions reached agreement on new twoyear contracts today, ending a threeday strike by two of the unions. Officials said weekend sessions were held with the American Association of University Professors local, the Staff Association and the Professional and Administrative Association.

title: School Walkout Ends in Buffalo; Arbitration Due
description: BUFFALO, Sept. 27 A threeweek strike in Buffalo's public schools ended today as the teachers returned to their classrooms after agreeing to submit their contract dispute to binding arbitration.

title: Black Leaders Balance Practical Needs With Ideal Goals
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Sept. 27There is a constant interplay between the anticolonial ideology of the black nations of southerri Africa an their economic ties with or dependence on South Africa. The black leaders who yesterday objected to a plan to bring majority rule to Rhodesia that had been accepted by Prime Minister Ian D. Smith are constantly balancing these philosophical and practical needs.

title: 2 More Flood Victims Identified
description: LOVELAND, Colo., Sept. 27 (UPI)Officials released today the identities of two more victims of the July 31 Big Thompson Canyon flood, bringing to 138 the number of bodies that have been identified. The victims were James Lon ence, 46 years old, of Philipsburg, Kan., and Michael Plant, 14, of Broomfield, Colo. Mr. Lorence's wife, and two daughters were also killed in the flood, as were the Plant boy's parents. Their bodies were identified earlier.

title: C.I.A. is Ordered to Explain Position on Missing Colorado Professor
description: DENVER, Sept. 27Judge Richard P. Matsch of the Federal District Court in Denver has ordered the Central Intelligence Agency to explain why it cannot disclose information about a missing University of Colorado professor.

title: Lahey Clinic Goes to Suburbs
description: BURLINGTON, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP) Boston's 53yearold internationally known Lahey Clinic is joining a nationil trend of urban clinics looking to the suburbs. Dr. Robert E. Wise said the new Lahey Clinic primary care and radiotherapy center in Burlington, which opened today, was similar to outreach programs developed by the Henry Ford Clinic in Detroit and the Mayo clinic in Rochester, Minn.

title: Senate Unit Hears Nixon Rejected Pentagon Advice on Iran Jet Sales
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Pentagon, in a recommendation made shortly before President Richard M. Nixon's visit to Iran in May 1972, privately urged that Iran not be permitted to purchase either the F14 or the F15 fighter aircraft, a Senate subcommittee hearing was told today.

title: Coast Mechanics Approve Pact
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 27 (UPI)Striking bus mechanics here have approved a new contract that raises their wages and fringe benefits by 19 percent over the next three years. The walkout, which began on Aug. 23, has affected 760,000 daily bus riders, who normally use the buses of the Southern California Rapid Transit District buses in four counties.

title: Ford Says He Finds No Bias in TV News
description: RADNOR, Pa., Sept. 27 (UPI)President Ford, in an interview with TV Guide magazine released today, said that he had not found any bias in television news and believed the medium's news coverage of his activities had been very fair and very broad.

title: Suit Asks Cancer Warning Message On Oral Contraceptive Packages
description: A lawsuit was filed yesterday seeking to require that oral contraceptives carry a warning that they are dangerous to women who have had breast cancer.

title: Musica Sacra's Festival Boasts a Certain Quality
description: Musica Sacra's first concert of the season, on Sunday night, one of a pair scheduled at Alice Tully Hall under the rubric A Festival of American Choral Masterpieces, came close at times to living up to that brave title. Not, perhaps, while Norman Luboff was conducting his own Look to This Day, which rocked and rolled along infectiously enoup, but tried a bit too hard to give a popmusic swagger to its subject. The text, full of seize the day exhortations, needed snore than the superficial Jazziness of Mr. Luboff's music.

title: SHIFT OF POOR URGED OUT OF CENTER CITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27A theorist on the recovery of American cities has proposed that the urban poor be moved away from the centercities so that these areas can be redeveloped for whitecollar workers employed downtown.

title: New Flight Around the World
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)Pan American World Airways announced today that it would begin roundtheworld 747 service from Washington on Oct. 31. Flights will stop in New York, London, Frankfurt, Tehran, New Delhi, Bangkok, Hong Kong and Tokyo, terminating in San Francisco. The flights will make the trip in 36 hours and 30 minutes and will cost $1,917, including the San FranciscoWashington domestic portion of the trip.

title: Alston Quits After 23 Dodger Seasons
description: LOS ANGELES, Sept. 27 (AP)Walter Alston, manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers for the last 23 yearsall on oneyear contractsretired today, saying, There comes a time when you get enough of everything.

title: Court Upholds N.C.A.A. On Coaching Staff Limits
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Sept. 27 (AP)A Federal judge ruled today that the National Collegiate Athletic Association could limit the size of coaching staffs at its member schools.

title: Libya Says it Tries to Improve Relations, but U.S. is Balking
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  The revolutionary Government says it is seeking to Improve relations with the United States despite basic divergences on the Palestinian question.

title: Avco Profits Set Records in 3 and 9 Months
description: The Avco Corporation, a diversified dustrial company, yesterday reported ??? earnings for the first fiscal guarEr and the nine months ended Aug. 31.

title: Blacks Stone Johannesburg Buses
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 27 (AP)Rockthrowing blacks battered nine buses in a black suburb today while three black youths were arrested in a white suburb for stoning passing cars.

title: Mrs. Dole's Campaigning Held Legal by the Library of Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)A Library of Congress study concludes that Elizabeth Dole is not violating any Federal law in campaigning with her husband. Senator Robert J. Dole, Republican of Kansas, but Representative John Moss, Democrat of California, said today she should resign as a member of the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Africans in U.N. Wary but Hopeful Over BritishLedTalks on Rhodesia
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 27African diplomats expressed cautious expectations today that the misunderstandings over procedures that seem to have arisen between Prime Minister Ian D. Smith of Rhodesia and five black African presidents could be resolved through Britishsponsored negotiation.

title: U.S. Fights a Move In Congress to Bar Missiles for Saudis
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Administration launched a lobbying effort today to deter Congress from blocking a sale of missiles to Saudi Arabia. A State Department official said such an action could lead to an increase in oil prices for the United States.

title: Extension is Supported For Revenue Sharing
description: WASHINGTON, Tuesday, Sept. 28 (UPI) A SouseSenate conference committee agreed early today to extend Federal revenue sharing to state and local governments through September, 1980. The extension would give them $25.5 billion.

title: Milner Hits Grand Slam
description: John Milner hit two homers, including a grand slam as the Mets rolled up a 10.3 victory over the Montreal Expos at Shea Stadium last night. The game, opening a scheduled doubleheader, was called in the top of the eighth because of rain, and the second contest was not played. Details Page 50.

title: BRITISH POUND FALLS TO NEW LOW OF $1.6810 IN WAVE OF SELLING
description: The pound, reflecting renewed anxieties over the state of the British economy, was hit yesterday by a sudden wave of selling that sent it tumbling to record lows against other currencies on the world's foreignexchange markets.

title: Kubacki, Backus Are Cited
description: CENTERVILLE, Mass., Sept. 27 (AP) Jim Kubacki, Harvard quarterback, and Ed Backus, a Columbia defensive back, were voted players of the week awards today on the Eastern College Athletic Conference Division I allstar team. Jim Hofher, a sophomore quarterback at Cornell, was selected rookie of the week.

title: Turks Expect to Close U.S. Bases If Congress Rejects Military Aid
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Sept. 27Turkisl officials say that Turkey will probably close down mostbut not allAmerican military operations here if Congress rejects a proposal to provide Ankara with Si billion in military aid over the next four years.

title: BEAME AUTHORIZES DISCIPLINARY STEPS FOR SOME OFFICERS
description: Mayor Beame authorized disciplinary action last night against some of the offduty police officers who had noisily demonstrated in residential neighborhoods during the last three days to protest new work schedules and deferred raises.

title: MINE UNION EXCLUDES TWO MORE REPORTERS
description: CINCINNATI, Sept. 27Two more reporters for leftwing newspapers were excluded today from the United Mine Workers convention here, raising the total to nine.

title: Tanzanian President Spells Out His Objections to Rhodesia Plan
description: LONDON, Sept. 27 (Reuters)President Julius K. Nyerere of Tanzania said today that African leaders would have entrenched and legalized white power in Rhodesia if they had accepted Prime Minister Ian D. Smith's terms for eventual black majority rule.

title: SMALL RISE INDICATED IN CHINESE HARVEST
description: PEKING (Reuters)Chinese reports on this summer's grain harvesta vital indicator of the nation's economic healthforecast relatively small increases in production, diplomatic observers report.

title: House Approves a Foreign Aid Bill $684 Million Below Ford's Request
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP)The House approved a $5.1 billion foreign aid appropriations bill today that is $684 million below the amount requested by President Ford. It contains no aid for Angola or Mozambique.

title: Sail to Rome, For Moment Win Cowdin
description: There was a study in contrasts for followers of form yesterday at Belmont Park. A 291 shot, Lucille E. Stephens's Sail to Rome, won the first division of the Cowdin. Then Gerald Robins's evenmoney favorite, For the Moment, captured the second division. Each race, over seven furlongs, had a value of $43,700. Sail to Rome, returning $60.20 for $2 to win, triumphed in a squeaker, beating C. V. Whitney's favored Banquet Table by a nose after a late rush on the inside. For the Moment, in capturing his fourth straight victory, won much more decisively. His margin 1 lengths.

title: 280 Rioting Inmates Set Fire To Building at a Montreal Prison
description: MONTREAL, Sept. 27 (AP)A protest by about 280 prisoners at the maximumsecurity Layal Institute prison ended in a riot last night, when the inmates set fire to a building in the center block.

title: Angola is Elected New Member Of International Coffee Pact
description: LONDON, Sept. 27(AP) Angola, the emerging West African coffeegrowing country, today was made a provisional member of the International Coffee Organization The I.C.O council vote was unanimous. Angola thus becomes the 43d producing member of the second International Coffee Agreement bringing the total producerconsumer membership of the organization to 64.

title: Interest Rates Climb Moderately And Fed Increases Bank Reserves
description: Interest rates rose moderately yesterday as investment bankers sought to reduce their holdings of unsold bonds and to prompt institutional portfolio managers to buy new issues being marketed this week. The changes in yields and bond prices, however, were unspectacular in contrast to their shifts late last week after the Federal Reserve's disclosure of a record increase in the nation's money supply, and on the whole the credit markets seemed much more composed.

title: 7 Poles Sentences Are Reversed
description: WARSAW, Sept. 27 (UPI)The Polish Supreme Court today suspended the prison sentences of seven workers who were jailed for blockading the railways in protest against food price increases and ordered their immediate release.

title: Chess:
description: It is exceptional, but by no means impossible, for a kingside attack to maintain its intensity after the defender has managed to get the queens off the board.

title: U.N. IS URGED TO TAKE UP SOUTHWEST AFRICAN ISSUE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Sept. 27Sam Nujoma, the leader of the SouthWest Africa People's Organization, called today on the Security Council to take punitive action against South Africa for failure to end its occupation of SouthWest Africa, also known as Namibia.

title: Yonkers Racing; RESULTS
description: (OT3 payoffs subject to S?4 state tax) FIRST$4,000, pace, mile.

title: What Homicide Officers Must Know
description: Now, you take situation one. Police officers arrive at the scene. The victim is on the ground, dead of a bullet wound, there's a man with a pistol, a smoking pistol, standing over the victim. The crowd in the background is yelling. He did it He did it The police officers handcuff him and put him in the police car. That man is in custody said the lecturer.

title: Two Japanese Warplanes Collide
description: TOKYO. Sept. 27 (AP)An F104 jet fighter and a T33A jet trainer of the Japanese air force collided over the Pacific off northern Japan today. Two pilots were missing and one was rescued, a spokesman of the defense forces said.

title: State Invites Private Industry to Collect Income Tax
description: TRENTON, Sept. 27State officials have begun seeking ways to reduce the estimated $6 millionto$8 million cost of administering the income tax and related property tax reductions.

title: Dr. Morris Fishbein Dead at 87; Former Editor of A.M.A. Journal
description: CHICAGO, Sept. 27 (AP)Dr. Morris Fishbein, a prominent medical authority and for many years the editor of the Journal of the American Medical Association, died today. He was 87 years old.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION IN WEEK UP TO 2.56 MILLION TONS
description: Steel production for the week ended Sept. 25 edged ahead by 0.5 percent to 2.56 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: A Plea for $1 Billion Now By Head of Postal Service Is Rejected by Senate Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27Pleas by the chief executive of the United States Postal Service for $1 billion in immediate aid were turned aside today by a Senate appropriations committee.

title: M.A.C. Assails Moody's as Unfit, Demands It Not Rate Agency Bonds
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporation stepped up its feud with Moody's Investors Service yesterday by demanding that the creditrating agency disqualify itself from evaluating M.A.C. bonds on the ground that the president of Moody's had written a reprehensible letter about New York City.

title: Richard H. Alexander Weds Miss Tishman
description: Virginia Blanche Tishman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan V. Tishman of New York and Stamford, Conn., was married in New York early yesterday evening to Richard H. Alexander, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Alexander of New York.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Cook Industries of Memphis, a leading grain exporter, announced yesterday that it was temporarily discontinuing a previously announced plan in which Cook would have become a privately owned company.

title: City Hall, the Police and Deadlocked Talks
description: For 18,000 police officers, the major issues are money and emotion. For City Hall, the primaryconcern could be the solvency of the city's financial recovery plan. These are the combustible Ingredients that have suddenly thrust the Beanie administration and the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association into deadlocked contract negotiations while police officers engage in boisterous picketing and rallies, accompanied by theats of a wildcat strike or other job actions.

title: Tent Collapse Hurts 9 in Texas
description: EL PASO, Tex., Sept. 27 (UPI)A large tent sheltering 1,000 persons from a storm collapsed today at the El Paso County Fair, injuring nine persons, more seriously.

title: People in Sports
description: Although Fran Tarkenton reportedly has severely bruised ribs it is quite possible the Minnesota Vikings quarerback will be ready to start agairr by Monday night when the Vikes are hosts to the Pittsburgh Steelers. Xrays yesterday did not reveal any broken bones. The durable Tarkenton, in his 16th year as a pro has never missed a National Football League game because of an injury. With an extra day for preparation, the Vikings did not schedule practice yesterday or today. A club spokesman said it's possible that Tarkenton won't have to throw the ball before Thursday.

title: Diana Trilling Book is Canceled; Reply to Lillian Hellman Is Cited
description: Little Brown & Company has declined to publish a book of essays and commentary by Diana Trilling, the critic and widow of Lionel Trilling, allegedly because she refused to delete several passages critical of Lillian Hellman, the author and dramatist.

title: General Tire and Union in Accord
description: AKRON, Ohio, Sept. 27 (AP)The General Tire and Rubber Company and the United Rubber Workers reached a tentative agreement early today on a contract covering about 3,350 employees, the company announced. A spokesman said that details would not be disclosed pending ratification. A union spokesman said that ratification decisions are expected this week. General Tire workers remained on the job when their contract expired last May 15, declining to join the strike going on at the time against the industry's four largest concerns.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Says it is Far Short Of Cash Required to Appeal Suit
description: The N.A.A.C.P. said yesterday it had not raised half of the $1.6 million needed this week to post as bond in its appeal of a $1.2 million lawsuit won against by white merchants in Port Gibson, Miss.

title: Czech Paddles 50 Miles for Asylum
description: TRIESTE, Italy, Sept. 27 (AP)A 22yearold Czech student paddled 50 miles across the Adriatic Sea from Yugoslavia on a rubber mattress to seek political asylum in Italy, the police reported today. They said the unidentified student was hospitalized for frostbite after spending 20 hours at sea.

title: General Mills And Stokely VanCamp
description: General Mills Inc., a leader in the packaged food industry, achieved record results with earnings up 30.9 percent on a sales gain of 15 percent in its first fiscal quarter ended Aug. 29.

title: Notes on People
description: The former district attorney for upstate Onondaga County, Jon K. Holcomb, was fined $200 yesterday and ordered to surrender his driver's license following his plea of guilty to charge of driving while intoxicated. Mr. Holr'mb, who resigned Sept. 17 upon pleading guilty, was also ordered to attend a rehabilitation school for drunken drivers but State Supreme Court Justice Richard N. Donovan dismissed sexual abuse charges against Mr. Holcomb brought by a former secretary, Patricia Adams. The case dated to an office clambake in July, when Mr. Holcomb was accused of drunken driving and molesting Mrs. Adams.

title: Lucchesi Fined, Suspended
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.; Sept. 27 (AP)Manager Frank Lucchesi of the Texas Rangers was fined and suspended for three days today by Lee MacPhail, president of the American League, because of an argument with an umpire, Rich Garcia, Sept. 14. Lucchesi kicked dirt on Garcia during a dispute over a call during a game with the California Angels.

title: COMMISSION DELAYS JAIL CONTACT VISITS
description: The State Commission of Correction, in an apparent reversal of earlier policy, has delayed an Oct. 1 deadline for putting into effect contact visiting privileges for inmates of local and county jail facilities.

title: AMERICAN LIFE CITED BY THE S.E.C. IN PLOT INVOLVING $3 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it had charged the National American Life Insurance Company, four other companies and four individuals with securitieslaw violations in connection with an elaborate scheme to misappropriate more than $3 million of company assets.

title: HEALTH DEPARTMENT CITES 14 AS CODE VIOLATORS
description: In setting final inspections for the 14 places, the department also released the results of final inspections at previously cited restaurants. The department's list follows:

title: Backing Denied Vermont Candidate
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Sept. 27 (AP)An influential Vermont Democrat, former Gov. Philip Hoff, declined today to support his party's gubernatorial nominee, Stella Hackel, saying that he had very serious reservations about her candidacy. Mr. Hoff said that he would remain neutral in the race for governor. He had called Mrs. Heckel a reactionary conservative.

title: Fairbanks is Struggling With a Rising Crime Rate
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Sept. 27The early morning light of the low Arctic sun gave the Indian girl a long, stumbling shadow as she went from bar to bar, seeking friends made last night.

title: Saudi Says Business Would Suffer
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. V., Sept. 27Foreign Minister Saud warned today that Congressional moves to challenge the Arab boycott could seriously penalize American workers and businesses. But he denied that his Government would cut off oil shipments in retaliation.

title: Hebert, After 36 Years, Bids House Farewell
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (UPI)Saying that his fox trot has turned into a waltz, 74yearold Representative F. Edward Hebert, Democrat of Louisiana, said goodbye to the House today after 36 years as a Congressman.

title: Rep. Flynt Suffers Heart Damage
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27 (AP) The chairman of The House ethics committee, Representative John J. Flynt Jr., Democrat of Georgia, has suffered minor heart damage, his office reported today. Mr. Flynt entered Bethesda Naval Hospital last Thursday with chest pains. His aides said that he had not suffered a heart attack.

title: Memorial Seruices
description: GLICKMANRabbi Jack Stanlay, Memorial Day is second day of Rosh Hashanah from 20754951. Brooklyn, N.Y. C.

title: Banks to Change Locks
description: CLEVELAND, Sept. 27 (AP)The police say Cleveland Trust Company banks will be changing locks. A thief who stole a station wagon belonging to a bank custodian, kept the keys to all of Cleveland Trust's branch offices that were in the vehicle's glove compartment. Each key Was marked with the appropriate branch name, the police said.

title: Woman Dies in Jersey Crash
description: MANASQUAN, N.J., Sept. 27 (AP)A 23yearold Wall Township woman, Robyn Kmiec, was killed yesterday when the car in which she was riding was struck by a van, the police said. They said Miss Kmiec was a passenger in a car, driven by Michelle Brown of Manasquan, that was struck by the van while attempting to make a left turn into a parking olt. The driver of the van, Michael Parish, 24, of Montclair, was charged with death by auto.

title: Poll No Surprise to Buckley
description: BINGHAMTON, N.Y., Sept 27Senator James L. Buckley, who came here today to attend a Republican campaign headquarters opening, said he was not surprised by a voter poll that showed him running far behind the Democratic challenger, Daniel P. Moynihan.

title: Major League Scores
description: Mets Records

title: Greek Fears Government Takeover
description: ATHENS, Sept.27 (AP)The shipping magnate and industrialist Stavros Niarchos accused the Greek Government today of trying to seize control of his assets in an oil refinery partly owned by the state.

title: Vacuity Marches On
description: Gentlemen, ladies. The times are grave. The armaments race is out of control. Millions are unemployed. Inflation is eroding our incomes. Our sources of oil could be cut off without warning.

title: DELLA JACKSON
description: Della Jackson, project director of the Police Athletic League's Miccio Head Start Center at 110 West Ninth Street in Brooklyn, died of a stroke Saturday at the Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn. She was 52 years old and lived at 797 Hicks Street in Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Team Plans Search in Alaska For Early People
description: WASHINGTON, Sept, 28One of the biggest archeological projects ever mounted in the United States is to be conducted over the next three years in Alaska to search for remains of the first people to enter North America from Asia over the now submerged Bering land bridge.

title: Gresham Replaces Davis As Jet Rushing Slows Up
description: Refusing to rest on their laurels after losing by only 160 to Miami, the Jets decided yesterday to make a major offensive change.

title: POLICE KILL MOTHER OF 4; SELFDEFENSE IS ALLEGED
description: The mother of four small children was shot and killed on the Lower East Side yesterday morning by a police officer who said that she had pointed a gun at him and had pulled the trigger several times, but that the weapon had misfired.

title: Canadian Provinces Are Recommending Limited Flu Effort
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Sept. 28Provindal health authorities have recommended that inoculation against swine flu in Canada should be confined for the time being to chronically ill persons and inmates of institutions.

title: Asians and Arkansas Hill Folk Ease Mutual Misgivings
description: GRANNIS, Ark., Sept. 26Mrs. Floy Lane, the storekeeper, has learned to like Orientalstyle alimentary paste, which she cooks into a soup.

title: New Inquiry at West Point Started As Hoffman Confers With Panel
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Sept. 28  Secretary of the Army Martin R. Hoffmann visited the United States Military Academy today to open what is likely to be the final but most significant of the many inquiries into the West Point cheating scandal.

title: HENRY S. BLOOMGARDEN
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28  Henry S. Bloomgarden, a freelance writer and novelist, died yesterday of a heart attack while jogging near his home in Reston, Va. He was 48 years old.

title: Illinois Paper to Be Sold
description: FREEPORT, III., Sept. 28 (UPI)The Freeport JournalStandard Publishing Company will be sold Oct. 1 to Howard Publications of Oceanside, Calif., it was announced today by Donald L. Breed, editor of the JournalStandard, and Heinz K. Vaterlaus, copublisher with Mr. Breed.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: Linked to Robbery, A Juror is Dropped In Susan Saxe Case
description: BOSTON. Sept. 28 (UPI)A juror in the Susan Saxe bank robberymurder trial was dismissed from the case today following allegations that she herself had been involved in an armed robbery several years ago. Chief Justice Walter H. Mclaughlin, in Suffolk County Superior Court, said that the juror Debra Fuller, 23 years old, was dropped from the 16member panel for reasons sufficient to the court.

title: President's Latest TV Commercials Portray Him As Father Figure Who Inspires Quiet Confidence
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28In the first batch of television commercials to be broadcast this fall for President Ford, he is portrayed as a dependable father figure who quietly inspires feelings of serenity in his family, his official circle and the country at large.

title: 21 Hospitals Interns and Residents Planning a Walkout Over Contract
description: Interns and residents at 21 voluntary and municipal hospitals in New York City said yesterday that they would go on strike at 7 A.M. next Tuesday unless the hospitals signed contracts with their union.

title: Belmont Racing
description: RESULTS

title: Hearing on Problem of Peddlers Opens a Day in Life of City Council
description: This is a great day for the Bronx, Councilman Stanley Simon said during yesterday's City Council meeting.

title: UNOPENED HOSPITAL TOURED IN THE BRONX
description: Dr. John L. S. Holloman, president of the Health and Hospital's Corporation, sponsored a tour of the new North Central Bronx Hospital yesterday to prove his contention that it was a bona fide hospital, fully equipped, wellstaffed and deserving of an operating certificate from the state.

title: Charles S. Bannerman, Lawyer Who Specialized in Estates
description: Charles S. Bannerman lawyer with the firm of Whitman & Ransom, died yesterday at his home at 1088 Park Avenue. He was 71 years old and had been counsel to the firm since 1973.

title: Siamsa is an Emerald of a Show
description: Presumably it was Igor Moiseyev who started it all when, before World War II, he founded his celebrated Moiseyev Folk Ensemble in Soviet Russia. Since, the theatrical possibilities of folklore, both in song and dance, have been thoroughly explored. Our latest folklorist visitor opened a week's engagement Monday night at the Palace Theater and is called Siamsa, The National Folk Theater of Ireland. It is as beguiling as a troupe of emeraldgreen leprechauns emerging unexpectedly out of a Celtic mist.

title: Peking TV Varies Mourning Fare
description: PEKING, Sept. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)For the first time since the death of Chairman Mao Tsetung on Sept. 9, Chinese television tonight stopped broadcasting scenes of sorrow and mourning, and showed instead a program on work and industrial production. The program began with a threeminute showing of the portrait of Chairman Mao framed in black. This was followed by working scenes and pictures of the operations of a steel mill and of military training and maneuvers.

title: Kissinger Says All Parties Are Eager for Rhodesia Talks and Predicts Rapid Progress
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28Secretary of State Henry A. Kissing cr said today that progress toward the opening of negotiations between Rhcdesian blacks and whites would be made rapidly and that within a week or so I would think that this would become evident.

title: Film: Comedy:'How Funny Can Sex Be?' Opens at Trans-Lux East
description: Watching Dino Risi's "How Funny Can Sex Be?" (Italian title: "Sesso Matto") is to be on the point of death and to have every Italian comedy ever made pass in front of your eyes instead of your life. It's a disappointment not easily remedied.The film, which opened yesterday at the Trans-Lux East, stars Giancarlo Giannini and Laura Antonelli in eight sketches that parody Italian sexual manners in ways that run the gamut from harmless to painfully predictable to slightly nasty, as in the sketch in which he plays a young man hopelessly attracted to elderly women, the older and uglier the better.With the kind of witty material that Lina Wertmuller gives him, Mr. Giannini is an immensely gifted character actor. In this Risi film, we can see remnants of some of those other performances in the Groucho-like walk, the dainty pursuit of lust, the radar-like eyes that can detect and chart a fine bust at a distance of 50 feet.The material written by Mr. Risi and his partner, Ruggero Maccari, is so ex-hausted, though, that long before we get through a pointless sketch called "Wild Gooseberries," spoken in imitation Swedish, we notice that the film has become a series of masquerades that allow Mr. Giannini to wear a lot of supposedly funny hair-pieces and glasses.Among the topics touched on but never successfully sent up are the impotence of a village Romeo, a premeditated murder effected by overindulgence in sex, and artificial insemination.Laura Antonelli, a stunning beauty and a talented comedienne, also wastes her talents, though the unadorned sight of her helps the time pass more quickly.

title: Bootstrapping it Here
description: The disastrous economic decline of New York City continues.

title: LOUISE BIRCH, 97, DEAD COFOUNDER OF SCHOOL
description: Louise Birch, cofounder and former headmistress of the Birch. Wathen School, 9 East 71st Street, died Friday in Berk Israel Hospital. She was 97 years old and lived at 24 West 55th Street.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (UPI)The Senate gave final Congressional approval today to legislation awarding $750,000 to the widow and family of a Government scientist who committed suicide in 1953 after unknowingly taking LSD in a Central Intelligence Agency experiment.

title: AMERICAN GIRL KIDNAPPED IN BUENOS AIRES IS WELL
description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 28 (AP)The kidnapped daughter of an American Mennonite pastor is alive and well, her father said today.

title: French Connection Narcotics Figure Changes His Plea to Guilty
description: A major figure in the socalled French Connection case, charged with heading an international ring that smuggled half a ton of heroin and cocaine into the United States from 1968 to 1972, pleaded guilty yesterday to smugglingconspiracy charges.

title: Mets Top Expos, 54, and Bow, 42
description: Sweeping doubleheaders remains Mission Impossible for the Mets, who once again had to settle for a split last night at Shea Stadium after Ed Kranepool's lateinning heroics had provided them a 54 victory over the Montreal Expos in the opener. The loss in the second game was by 42.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The state Department of Environmental Conservation reported a new proposal to control land management in the rich Catskills region of southeastern New York. it would be modeled after a similar plan now in effect in the Adirondack Mountains, but provide for wider participation by local governments.

title: Effort Collapses in Congress to Block Sale of Missiles to Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27A Congressional move to block the sale of aircraft missiles to Saudi Arabia collapsed today in the face of a warning by Secretary of State Kissinger that such an action could undermine Administration policy in the Middle East.

title: Hearing Today on Rizzo Recall
description: PHILADELPHIA, Sept. 28 (UPI)The State Supreme Court will open a hearing tomorrow on appeals aimed at blocking a recall election Nov. 2 that could topple Mayor Frank L. Rizzo from office. The recall question already is listed on the ballot and it would take a court order to remove it. The court is expected to act quickly on the appeals of a ruling by Common Pleas Judge David Savitt, who held a recall referendum petition valid.

title: Moynihan Continues To Teach at Harvard
description: Protecting his academic tenure. Daniel P. Moynihan will spend parts of three days each Week teaching at Harvard instead of campaigning for the Senate.

title: Mrs. Hearst Resigns As California Regent
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Sept. 28Catherine Hearst, who last Friday watched her daughter Patricia sentenced to sevenyear prison term for armed robbery, has resigned from the University of California's Board of Regents, effective immediately. in a letter to Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr., the 59yearold wife of Randolph A. Hearst, the publisher, gave no explanation of her resignation.

title: Bridge:
description: Tournaments in most parts of Europe, unlike those in the United States, are professional in the sense that cash prizes are awarded. However, only a few players emerge with a profit after paying their expenses.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Atalanta Corporation, food specialties importer, said it had been notified by the Polish agency for export, Animex, that the agency would not renew its marketing and technical agreement with the company when it expires Dec. 31. Since 1948, Atalanta has received commissions on sales of hams and other meat products imported from Poland into the United States. While it will no longer receive a commission after the agreement expires, Atalanta will continue through a subsidiary to be one of 11 importers and distributors of Polish meat products in the United States and Puerto Rico.

title: McCarthy Now Has A Theoretical Chance
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28Eugene J. McCarthy, running as an independent candidate for President, has won ballot status i enough states with enough elec. toral votes to make his election in November at least theoretically possible.

title: American Can Raising Its Prices
description: The American Can Company said yesterday that it would raise prices tomorrow on laminated flexible meat packaging products and Nov. 1 on other laminated packaging and related products. The increases will range from 4 percent to 9 percent, depending on materials involved.

title: Couple Sues L.I.R.R. As a Home Wrecker
description: MINEOLA, L. I, Sept. 28while l many commuters on the Long Island Rail Road have complained that the trains run too slowly and put them to sleep, a Plandome couple who live near the tracks filed a $2.8 million damage suit today on the ground that the railroad runs too quickly, keeps them awake and makes them ill.

title: POLICE FLOUT WRIT BY BLOCKING TRAFFIC AT ALINORTON FIGHT
description: Hundreds of offduty police officers, in direct violation of a court order, blew whistles and blocked traffic last night near Yankee Stadium and encouraged roving bands of youths in unsuccessful efforts to crash the gates to the Muhammad AliKen Norton heavyweight championship fight.

title: FRANK GNUP
description: VANCOUVER, B.C., Sept. 28 (AP)Frank Gnup, football coach at the University of British Columbia for 18 years until 1972, died yesterday of a heart attack at the age of 59. He was captain of the Manhattan College football team in New York during his student days.

title: The Cullums Try Something Old
description: John Cullum is an actor and the star of Shenandoah. Emily Frankel is dancer and choreographer. They are married to each other and are now presenting an evening in the theater that attempts its own marriage of dance and drama.

title: Slager, Irish Passer, Voted Back of Week
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Sept. 28 (AP)Rick Slager, who set a Notre Dame record last Saturday by completing 12 of 14 passes for 231 yards and three touchdowns, was named national college back of the week today by The Associated Press.

title: Adventures In Cooking For One
description: Among the requests we receive most often are those for cookbooks aim recipes geared to serve one, for the man or woman who lives alone, loves good. food and is tired of the steakchops omelettescrambled egg routine.

title: Manila's Hotel Boom May Turn Into Bust
description: MANILA, Sept. 28The glittering showplace of the Philippines the 700room Plaza Hotel staged its gala opening last night, but there were no bellboys, no room clerks and no guests.

title: Market Place
description: Last week's suggestion by Harrison J. Goldin, New York City's Comptroller, that the United States Trust Company and Citibank be dropped as investment advisers for the municipal employee retirement systems for inadequate performance on common stocks has distinct overtones of irony.

title: WMAL Radio In Washington Is Sold by Star
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (AP)The American Broadcasting Companies Inc. agreed yesterday to purchase two affiliated radio stations here from Washington Star Communications Inc.

title: Second Debate Set For San Francisco At Palace Theater
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28 (AP)The second debate between President Ford and Jimmy Carter will take place Oct. 6 in San Francisco's Palace of Fine. Arts Theater, the League of Women Voters announced today.

title: State Budget Officials Warn Carey Of a $120 Million Welfare Overrun
description: State budget officials told Governor Carey yesterday that if welfare costs continued to increase at the current rate, there would be an overrun of 5120 million to $175 million in the state's welfare budget for the current fiscal year.

title: Lillian Hellman Denies Having Played a Role In Little Brown's Rejection of Trilling Book
description: Lillian Hellman, the author, said yesterday that she had played no role whatever in the decision of Little Brown & Company not to publish a book by Diana Trilling, the critic, that contain several passages critical of Miss Hellman.

title: Group Plans to Sue To Bar Any Change In Rules on Abortion
description: A national organization that opposes any change in the existing Federal abortion rules said yesterday that it would sue to block any restriction on the use of Medicaid money for abortions, as contained in legislation now awaiting action by President Ford.

title: New Books Today
description: Jazz Is, by Nat Hentoff (Random House, $10). Jazz and its place place in American society.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Sept. 28This fall's election ballot in New Jersey will be completed at 4 P.M. tomorrow. That is the deadline for filing for three legislative vacancies created this week when members of the Assembly and State Senate resigned to take other posts.

title: From Scaasi, Too, the Rustle of Femininity
description: As far back as July, women came in asking me to make them a dress with a big taffeta skirt, Arnold Scaasi remarked at the opening of his fall collection yesterday. So I decided everybody was tired of jerseyI certainly wasand I would make big, important clothes for this winter.

title: Brazil's Trade Deficit Narrows
description: BRASILIA, Sept. 28Brazil's trade deficit in August narrowed to a provisional $100 million from a revised deficit of $149 million in July and a deficit of $211 million in August last year, Finance Minister Mario Herrique Simonsen said. Mr. Simonsen told reporters August exports were estimated at $950 million against $902 million in July and August imports of $1.05 billion against $1.05 billion also in July.

title: Syrians Pressing Arafat to Shift Position on Lebanon
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Sept. 28In addition to its military actions in Lebanon, Syria has begun to step up political pressure on Yasir Arafat, the leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization, to accept Syrian intervention and to give active support to the new Lebanese Government of President Elias Sarkis.

title: Adventures In Cooking For One
description: Among the requests we receive most often are those for cookbooks and recipes geared to serve one, for the man or woman who lives alone, loves good food and is tired of the steakchopsomelettescrambled egg routine.

title: Beame, Caso and DelBello Sign Nonagression Pact on Luring Business
description: OLD WESTBURY, L.I., Sept. 28Mayor Beame of New York City and the top officials of Nassau and Westchester Counties agreed today to form a joint planning group to promote economic growth in the area and to eliminate competition for industry among the city and its neighbors to the north and east.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.Listed to speak, Liberia, Canada, France, Australia, Belgium, Iceland, Singapore, Ireland, Cameroon, Afghanistan, Benin.

title: Poet on Trial in South Korea Demands New Panel of Judges
description: SEOUL. South Korea, Sept. 28A South Korean poet known for his satirizaLion of President Park Chung Hee's Government asked for a new panel of judges today on the ground that he was not receiving a fair hearing.

title: Stockton Battles Back For Victory in Tennis
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Sept. 28 (UPI)The $125,000 Fireman's Fund tennis tournament continued today with sixthseeded Dick Stockon fighting off Alan Stone, an Australian, 57, 64, 62.

title: 13 Debuts Set for Met's First Week
description: Thirteen artistsan unusually large numberwill make their debuts with the Metropolitan Opera in the first week of its 197677 season.

title: 5Year Notes at 7.08% Sold by U.S. Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28The Treasury sold today $2.5 billion of fiveyear notes at an average return of 7.08 percent. The department received $4.17 billion of tenders for the notes, which will carry a coupon Interest rate of percent.

title: DOLE IS STEPPING UP ATTACKS ON CARTER
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, Sept. 28For the last two days, Senator Robert J. Dole, the Republican VicePresidential candidate, has been crisscrossing Illinois and Ohio, two states vital to President Ford's election strategy, taking some of his sharpest digs at Jimmy Carter, the Democratic Presidential nominee.

title: Extensive Repairs Set For Old Tiger Stadium
description: DETROIT, Sept. 28 (UPI)  The Detroit Tigers, unable to get governmental help in fixing their aging ballpark, announced an extensive modernization plan for Tiger Stadium today. It will take from 7 to 10 years and will begin with new lights for next season.

title: WINE TALK
description: Wine tastings are the best means of learning about wine. Only at tastings of two or more wines is it possible to compare and begin to comprehend how and why wines of the same region, type and vintage can differ so much.

title: Major League Scores
CAREY GETS WARNING ON WELFARE BUDGET
description: State budget officials told Governor Carey yesterday that if welfare costs continued to increase at the current rate, there would be an overrun of $120 million to $175 million in the state's welfare budget for the current fiscal year.

title: Chaos on Arms
description: The controversy over the sale to Saudi Arabia of 650 airtoground Maverick missiles illustrates the grave risks that flow from this country's reckless arms trade with the rest of the (nonCommunist) world. in the absence of a carefully designed policy of restraint governing the export of sophisticated weapons, the United States is following the chaotic course that was set when President Nixon on an overnight stopover in Teheran in 1972 told Iran in a spurofthemoment gesture that it could, buy virtually anything it wanted.

title: FF for Fendi A Quiet. Part of the Initials Game
description: For those who keep track of such things, it is equally prestigious to carry a handbag or a suitcase inscribed with a couple of F's in tandem as it is to have one with G's for Gucci or LV for Louis Vuitton. Perhaps even more so the reason is that the F's for Fendi have had less exposure and, therefore, in the inverse snobbery of the fashion world, more cachet.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The furs in this house are almost unmistakably Maximilian's. They are, for the most part, the essence of simplicity and when simplicity falls by the wayside, as it does in the case of a few shawls and evning coats, the effect is highstyle elegance that knows when to stop.

title: Detroit Gets Black Chief in Controversy Over Police
description: DETROIT, Sept. 28 Mayor Coleman A Young, with his police department the subject of controversy in recent months, today, named William L. Hart as this city's first black chief of police.

title: Marion B. Folsom is Dead at 82; Architect of Social Security Act
description: Marion B. Folsom, the chief drafter in the 1930's of the nation's Social Security laws and later Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare in the Eisenhower Administration, died yesterday at his home in Rochester. He was 82 years old.

title: Wife and Mother of Soviet MIG Pilot Appeal for His Return
description: MOSCOW, Sept. 28The wife and the mother of a Soviet pilot who flew his jet fighter to Japan were brought forward today by the Soviet authorities to plead for him to come home without fear of punishment.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: RCA Looking Into Any Involvement In Tax Problems of Its ExChairman
description: The RCA Corporation is investigating the possibility that the coivpany itself or some of its employees migfit have been involved in the tax problems of its recently resigned chairman, Anthony L. Conrad, a regulatory source said yesterday.

title: Rockefeller Takes the Stump for State's Republicans
description: DOVER, Sept. 28  Vice President Rockefeller campaigned today for Republican Congressional candidates in New Jersey, saying that a restoration of balance in Congress was vital to the twoparty system.

title: How One Mother Makes Do, Or Doesn't Make Do, on Welfare
description: Elisa Fuentes is a welfare mother with three daughters. She benefits by Medicaid help every other week for her baby. She has been buying food stamps, but not right now because welfare records apparently got snarled when she moved from the Bronx to East Harlem.

title: Restrictions on C5 Plane Lifted
description: WASHINGTON. Sept. 28 (AP)The Air Force today lifted flight restrictions on its fleet of C5 transport planes. The 77 giant C5's were ordered limited to unpressurized training flights and special missions on Sept. 1, after a transport plane experienced pressure loss on a flight from the United States to West Germany.

title: British Envoy to Talks on Rhodesia Hopes Lightning is No Omen of Flak
description: JOHANNESBURG, Sept. 28 (UPI)An airliner carrying a British envoy to Africa for talks with heads of black states was struck by lightning today, and the official said he hoped it was not a bad omen.

title: A Sweet Variation Of Acidophilus Milk Now in the N.Y. Area
description: Sweet acidophilus milk, a recent development that is a boon to those who canna digest conventional milk but dislike the soured flavor of the previously available acidophilus milk, is now on sale at retail stores in New York, and New Jersey.

title: ACCOUNTANT TESTIFIES IN TRIAL OF GOV. MANDEL
description: BALTIMORE, Sept. 28 (AP)W. Dale Hess, a codefendant in the political corruption trial of Gov. Marvin Mandel of Maryland, began making regular payments to a person identified as M.M. in mid1972. Mr. Hess's accountant testified today.

title: British Pound at $1 64, New Low; Central Bank Acts to Halt Plunge
description: LONDON, Sept. 28The British pound, once the world's proudest and strongest currency, crashed 4 cents today to $1.64, its lowest point ever, after falling 2 cents yesterday. The losses are among the sharpest in history, and the Government is now beginning to look very much like one in crisis.

title: CREDIT PLAN TO HELP OILIMPORTING LANDS APPEARS DEAD IN U. Si
description: As a result of Congressional opposition, the Ford Administration has apparently abandoned hope of setting up a new multibillion dollar international credit arrangement, which it once billed as the centerpiece of its plans to protect the industrial world against a financial crisis caused by rising oil prices.

title: POLICE PROTEST LAID TO DECLINE OF P.B.A
description: The decline of the oncepowerful Patrolmen's Benevolent Association's influence at City Hall was described yesterday as one of the chief factors behind the current street demonstrations by thousands of offduty police officers.

title: Yacht Title for Cudmore
description: TRIESTE, Italy, Sept. 28 (Reuters) H. Cudmore of Ireland, at the helm of his yacht Silver Shamrock, was confirmed today as world Half Ton Class yachting champion at the end of the fiverace series here after protests had been heard and settled.

title: Carla Hubner Offers Piano Recital
description: Carla Hbner, a Chileanborn pianist whose previous New York recitals have been devoted to 20thcentury music, came to Alice Tully Hall on Monday night to play Schumann's Abegg Variations, Three Romances (Op. 28) and Sonata No. 2, Liszt's St. Francis of Assisi Preaching to the Birds and Ballade in B minor and Messiaen's Le Traquet Stapazin and Ile de Feu I and II.

title: Ford Was a Corporate Golf Guest Numerous Times While in House
description: WASHINGTON, Sept. 28The White House acknowledged today that President Ford had played golf as the guest of a number of mapor corporations while he was a member of the House of Representatives. But it said those activities in no way violated the House's code or ethics forbidding gifts to members from persons or companies with an interest in pending legislation.

title: Most New York Welfare Families Lifted Above the Poverty Level
description: New York City's welfare families actually receive cash and services that lift most of them well above the poverty level, leaving only 10 to 20 percent below that standard, a Federally financed study by the Rand Corporation reported yesterday.

title: Cocoa Futures Take a Sharp Plunge
description: Cocoa futures contract prices which have been moving at nearrecord price levels recently on the New York Cocoa Exchange, touched new highs yesterday before closing sharply lower on profit taking.

title: 36 Convicts Hurt in Racial Fight Involving 100 Inmates in Nevada
description: CARSON CITY, Nev Sept. 28 (UPI)Thirtysix convicts were injured in a brawl at the Nevada State Prison that had to be broken up by gunfire from guards the prison reported today.
